original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ci'i phyir bstan zhe na //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ci'i phyir bstan zhe na //
translated: Why are the aspects of impermanence, etc. taught?

original: de dag ni nyon mongs pa spong ba ma yin gyi bdag med pa'i rnam par yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir te //
analyzed: de dag ni nyon mongs pa spong ba ma yin gyi bdag med pa'i rnam par yongs su sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir te //
translated: They are not for the purpose of abandoning the defilements, but for the purpose of purifying the selflessness of the aspects.

original: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa la brten nas sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa la brten nas sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa 'thob bo //
translated: On the basis of the aspect of impermanence, one attains the aspect of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa la brten nas bdag med pa'i rnam pa 'thob ste //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa la brten nas bdag med pa'i rnam pa 'thob ste //
translated: On the basis of the aspect of suffering, one attains the aspect of selflessness.

original: ji skad du gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: ji skad du gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: As it is said: ‚ÄúWhatever is impermanent is suffering.

original: de bdag med pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bdag med pa'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: That is selfless.‚Äù

original: de bas na bdag med pa'i rnam pa ni bla na med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de bas na bdag med pa'i rnam pa ni bla na med pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the aspect of selflessness is established as unsurpassed.

original: bla na med pa nyid las brtsams nas bla na med pa nyid gsum ste //
analyzed: bla na med pa nyid las brtsams nas bla na med pa nyid gsum ste //
translated: From the point of view of the unsurpassed, there are three kinds of unsurpassed:

original: shes pa bla na med pa nyid dang // lam bla na med pa nyid dang // rnam par grol ba bla na med pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes pa bla na med pa nyid dang // lam bla na med pa nyid dang // rnam par grol ba bla na med pa nyid do //
translated: unsurpassed knowledge, unsurpassed path, and unsurpassed liberation.

original: de la shes pa bla na med pa nyid ni bdag med pa'i shes pa nyid de //
analyzed: de la shes pa bla na med pa nyid ni bdag med pa'i shes pa nyid de //
translated: The unsurpassed knowledge is the knowledge of selflessness,

original: de'i pha rol du shes pa gzhan btsal du med pa'i @45b phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i pha rol du shes pa gzhan btsal du med pa'i @45b phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other knowledge to be sought beyond that.

original: lam bla na med pa nyid ni sla la mngon par shes pa myur ba ste //
analyzed: lam bla na med pa nyid ni sla la mngon par shes pa myur ba ste //
translated: The unsurpassed path is the easy path with quick intuition,

original: de ni lam thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni lam thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the best of all paths.

original: rnam par grol ba bla na med pa nyid ni mi slob pa mi 'khrugs pa'i rnam par grol ba ste //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba bla na med pa nyid ni mi slob pa mi 'khrugs pa'i rnam par grol ba ste //
translated: The unsurpassed liberation is the unshakable liberation of the adept,

original: rnam par grol ba thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is superior to all other liberations.

original: bla na med pa nyid rnam pa gsum po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du mthong ba dang / bsgoms pa dang mthar phyin pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o /üîΩ// / bam po lnga pa /
analyzed: bla na med pa nyid rnam pa gsum po 'di dag ni go rims bzhin du mthong ba dang / bsgoms pa dang mthar phyin pa'i lam gyi dbang du byas par rig par bya'o / // / bam po lnga pa /
translated: These three kinds of supremacy should be understood as referring respectively to the paths of insight, cultivation, and completion.

original: dmigs pa'i las zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i ste //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i las zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i ste //
translated: The objective domain of action refers to the eye, etc.

original: gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Its action is seeing forms, etc.

original: byed pa'i las ni sa la sogs pa'i ste //
analyzed: byed pa'i las ni sa la sogs pa'i ste //
translated: The action of the agent refers to the earth, etc.

original: rten pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rten pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: 2. the action,üîΩ3. the result,üîΩ4. the activity,üîΩ5. the cause,üîΩ6. the effect,üîΩ7. the agent,üîΩ8. the instrument,üîΩ9. the object,üîΩ10. the application,

original: yang na gang gi mtshan nyid kyi byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: yang na gang gi mtshan nyid kyi byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: 11. the transformation,üîΩ12. the acquisition.

original: 'di lta ste gzugs kyi ni gzugs su yod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste gzugs kyi ni gzugs su yod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The action of form is the action of form, etc.

original: rtsol ba'i las ni bsam pa sngon du btang ba'i lus la sogs pa'i las so //
analyzed: rtsol ba'i las ni bsam pa sngon du btang ba'i lus la sogs pa'i las so //
translated: The action of effort is the action of body, speech, and mind that is preceded by will.

original: bsgyur ba'i las ni gser mgar la sogs pa'i ste //üîΩrgyan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsgyur ba'i las ni gser mgar la sogs pa'i ste // rgyan la sogs pa'o //
translated: The action of transformation is the action of a goldsmith, etc.

original: 'thob pa'i las ni 'phags pa'i lam la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: 'thob pa'i las ni 'phags pa'i lam la sogs pa ste //
translated: The action of acquisition is the action of the noble path, etc.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The action of attainment is the attainment of nirvana, etc.

original: skabs 'dir ni phal cher rtsol ba'i las su 'dod do zhes bya ba ni 'thob par byed pa'i las kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skabs 'dir ni phal cher rtsol ba'i las su 'dod do zhes bya ba ni 'thob par byed pa'i las kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this context, the action of effort is generally accepted, but the action of acquisition also exists.

original: lus la sogs pa'i las la las kyi lam zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dang mthun par ji ltar gtso bo bstan par rig par bya ste //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa'i las la las kyi lam zhes bya ba ni mdo sde dang mthun par ji ltar gtso bo bstan par rig par bya ste //
translated: The path of action should be understood as the principal action of body, speech, and mind, in accordance with the sutras.

original: de la sbyor ba la sogs pa yang lus la sogs pa'i las kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba la sogs pa yang lus la sogs pa'i las kyi nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the preparations, etc., are included in the actions of body, etc.

original: las kyi lam gsum dang bzhi dang gsum ni go rims bzhin du lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: las kyi lam gsum dang bzhi dang gsum ni go rims bzhin du lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The three, four, and three karmic paths should be known respectively as having the characteristics of actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i gzhi ni sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa dang // sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar te //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i gzhi ni sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa dang // sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar te //
translated: The bases of killing, etc., are sentient beings and non-sentient beings, as appropriate.

original: gang la brten nas srog gcod pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang la brten nas srog gcod pa la sogs pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: They are the bases on which killing, etc., occur.

original: bsam pa ni gzhi de la der 'du shes pa'i bsam pa dang // las kyi lam de byed par 'dod pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni gzhi de la der 'du shes pa'i bsam pa dang // las kyi lam de byed par 'dod pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The intention is the intention to recognize the basis as such and to commit the karmic path.

original: sbyor ba ni de bya ba'i phyir bdag gam gzhan gyi lus dang ngag dang yid kyi rtsom pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni de bya ba'i phyir bdag gam gzhan gyi lus dang ngag dang yid kyi rtsom pa'o //
translated: The performance is the performance of one‚Äôs own body, speech, and mind or the performance of another‚Äôs body, speech, and mind in order to do that.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug 'dus pa dang so so ba ji ltar mthun @46a * //üîΩmthun du sbyar ro //üîΩzin par byas pa ni sbyor ba de dang de'i dus sam /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang gti mug 'dus pa dang so so ba ji ltar mthun @46a * // mthun du sbyar ro // zin par byas pa ni sbyor ba de dang de'i dus sam /
translated: The afflictions are attachment, hatred, and delusion, either combined or individually, as is appropriate.

original: phyis las de dang des yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyis las de dang des yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The completion is the act of killing at that time or later by that action.

original: de la srog gcod pa'i gzhi ni sems can no //
analyzed: de la srog gcod pa'i gzhi ni sems can no //
translated: The basis of killing is a sentient being.

original: bsam pa ni de la der 'du shes shing bsad pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni de la der 'du shes shing bsad pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The intention is the perception of that being and the thought to kill.

original: sbyor ba ni bsad par bsams pa'i mtshon cha la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni bsad par bsams pa'i mtshon cha la sogs pa'o //
translated: The performance is the act of killing with a weapon, etc.

original: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: The afflictions are attachment, etc.

original: zin par byas pa ni sbyor ba des de ma thag tu 'am phyis shi ba'o //
analyzed: zin par byas pa ni sbyor ba des de ma thag tu 'am phyis shi ba'o //
translated: The completion is the death of that being immediately after the performance or later by that action.

original: ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'i gzhi dang zin par byas pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa la sogs pa'i gzhi dang zin par byas pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: The basis and the completion of taking what is not given, etc., should be explained.

original: lhag ma ni ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The rest should be applied as is appropriate.

original: ma byin par len pa'i gzhi ni gzhan gyis yongs su gzung ba sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'am sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i gzhi ni gzhan gyis yongs su gzung ba sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'am sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The basis of taking what is not given is that which is possessed by another, whether it is included in the number of sentient beings or not.

original: zin par byas pa ni bdag gir byas pa'o //
analyzed: zin par byas pa ni bdag gir byas pa'o //
translated: The completion is the intention to steal.

original: 'dod pas log par g-yem ba'i gzhi ni spyod yul ma yin pa'i bud med dang / spyod yul yin yang yan lag ma yin pa dang / yul ma yin pa dang / dus ma yin pa dang / tshod ma zin pa dang / rigs ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: 'dod pas log par g-yem ba'i gzhi ni spyod yul ma yin pa'i bud med dang / spyod yul yin yang yan lag ma yin pa dang / yul ma yin pa dang / dus ma yin pa dang / tshod ma zin pa dang / rigs ma yin pa dang /
translated: The basis of sexual misconduct is an inappropriate woman, or a suitable woman at an inappropriate time, or in an inappropriate place, or in an inappropriate manner, or to an inappropriate degree, or an inappropriate object.

original: pho dang ma ning thams cad do //
analyzed: pho dang ma ning thams cad do //
translated: Inappropriate objects are all men and eunuchs.

original: zin par byas pa ni gnyis kyis gnyis sprad pa'o //
analyzed: zin par byas pa ni gnyis kyis gnyis sprad pa'o //
translated: The completion is the union of the two organs.

original: brdzun du smra ba'i gzhi ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ma mthong ba dang / ma thos pa dang / bye brag mi phyed pa dang / rnam par ma shes ba'o //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba'i gzhi ni mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ma mthong ba dang / ma thos pa dang / bye brag mi phyed pa dang / rnam par ma shes ba'o //
translated: The basis of false speech is what is seen, heard, distinguished, or known, or not seen, not heard, not distinguished, or not known.

original: bsam pa ni gzhan du 'du shes la gzhan du smra bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni gzhan du 'du shes la gzhan du smra bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: The intention is the desire to say something different, thinking of something different.

original: zin par byas pa ni 'khor dang phyir rgol bas go bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zin par byas pa ni 'khor dang phyir rgol bas go bar byed pa'o //
translated: The completion is the communication of the meaning to the retinue and the adversary.

original: phra ma'i gzhi ni sems can 'dum pa dang / mi 'dum pa dag go //
analyzed: phra ma'i gzhi ni sems can 'dum pa dang / mi 'dum pa dag go //
translated: The basis of divisive speech is sentient beings who are in harmony or not in harmony.

original: bsam pa ni dbye ba dang sdum mi byed par sems pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni dbye ba dang sdum mi byed par sems pa'o //
translated: The intention is the thought to create disharmony and not to create harmony.

original: zin par byas pa ni phye bar shes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zin par byas pa ni phye bar shes par byed pa'o //
translated: The completion is the communication of the meaning of the divisive words to the person at whom it is aimed.

original: ngag rtsub po'i gzhi ni kun nas mnar sems kyi gzhir gyur pa'i sems can rnams so //
analyzed: ngag rtsub po'i gzhi ni kun nas mnar sems kyi gzhir gyur pa'i sems can rnams so //
translated: The basis of harsh speech is sentient beings who are the basis of the harm.

original: zin par byas pa ni ngag rtsub po smras pa'o //
analyzed: zin par byas pa ni ngag rtsub po smras pa'o //
translated: The completion is the speaking of the harsh words.

original: tshig kyal pa'i gzhi ni don med pa dang ldan pa'i don no //
analyzed: tshig kyal pa'i gzhi ni don med pa dang ldan pa'i don no //
translated: The basis of idle speech is a meaningless topic.

original: zin par byas pa ni de smras pa'o //
analyzed: zin par byas pa ni de smras pa'o //
translated: The completion is the speaking of the words.

original: brnab sems kyi gzhi ni gzhan gyi nor dang yo byad do //
analyzed: brnab sems kyi gzhi ni gzhan gyi nor dang yo byad do //
translated: The basis of covetousness is the wealth and possessions of others.

original: bsam pa ni de la der 'du shes shing de bzhin du 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni de la der 'du shes shing de bzhin du 'dod pa'o //
translated: The intention is the perception of that as that and the desire for it.

original: sbyor ba ni de bdag gir bya bar sems pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni de bdag gir bya bar sems pa'o //
translated: The performance is the thought to make it one‚Äôs own.

original: zin par byas pa ni bdag gir @46b bya bar nges pa'o //
analyzed: zin par byas pa ni bdag gir @46b bya bar nges pa'o //
translated: That which is appropriated is determined to be mine.üîΩ

original: gnod sems kyi gzhi ni kun nas mnar sems kyi rgyur gyur pa'i sems can rnams so //
analyzed: gnod sems kyi gzhi ni kun nas mnar sems kyi rgyur gyur pa'i sems can rnams so //
translated: The basis of malice is sentient beings who are the cause of complete irritation.

original: zin par byas pa ni bsad pa la sogs par nges pa'o //
analyzed: zin par byas pa ni bsad pa la sogs par nges pa'o //
translated: The intention is the certainty of killing, etc.

original: log par lta ba'i gzhi ni don yod pa'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba'i gzhi ni don yod pa'o //
translated: The basis of wrong views is an existent object.

original: bsam pa ni yod pa la med par 'du shes shing de bzhin du 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni yod pa la med par 'du shes shing de bzhin du 'dod pa'o //
translated: The intention is the perception of non-existence with regard to an existent, and the desire to be like that.üîΩThe completion is the certainty of denial.

original: zin par byas pa ni skur ba 'debs par nges pa'o //üîΩgzhan gyis bsgo ba sems pa las gyur pa ni 'di la ste /üîΩ'ga' zhig mi 'dod pa bzhin du gzhan dag gis nan gyis bsgos nas bsams te /
analyzed: zin par byas pa ni skur ba 'debs par nges pa'o // gzhan gyis bsgo ba sems pa las gyur pa ni 'di la ste / 'ga' zhig mi 'dod pa bzhin du gzhan dag gis nan gyis bsgos nas bsams te /
translated: The action of killing is the intention to kill.üîΩThe action of stealing is the intention to take what is not given.üîΩThe action of sexual misconduct is the intention to have sexual intercourse.üîΩThe action of lying is the intention to speak falsely.

original: mi dge ba spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba spyod pa'o //
translated: The action of malicious speech is the intention to speak maliciously.üîΩThe action of harsh speech is the intention to speak harshly.üîΩThe action of idle chatter is the intention to speak frivolously.

original: gzhan gyis gsol ba btab pa sems pa las gyur pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gsol ba btab pa sems pa las gyur pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The action of covetousness is the intention to take the property of others as one‚Äôs own.üîΩThe action of malice is the intention to kill, etc.üîΩThe action of wrong views is the intention to deny cause and effect.

original: 'ga' zhig mi 'dod bzhin du gzhan dag gis gsol ba btab nas 'di ni phan pa'o zhes yang dag pa 'dzin du bcug cing len du bcu gnas bsams te mi dge ba spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig mi 'dod bzhin du gzhan dag gis gsol ba btab nas 'di ni phan pa'o zhes yang dag pa 'dzin du bcug cing len du bcu gnas bsams te mi dge ba spyod pa'o //
translated: Some, though not wanting to, are urged by others to take up what is right, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is beneficial.‚Äù

original: mi shes pa'i sems pa la gyur pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi shes pa'i sems pa la gyur pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The mental activity of ignorance is as follows:

original: kha cig yon tan dang nyes pa mngon par mi shes shing //
analyzed: kha cig yon tan dang nyes pa mngon par mi shes shing //
translated: Some, not understanding virtues and faults,

original: mngon par zhen pa med la /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa med la /
translated: are not attached to anything.

original: 'dod dgar bsams nas mi dge ba spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod dgar bsams nas mi dge ba spyod pa'o //
translated: They engage in nonvirtue, thinking whatever they want.

original: rtsa ba la mngon par zhen pa'i sems las gyur pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba la mngon par zhen pa'i sems las gyur pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The mental activity of attachment to roots is as follows:

original: 'ga' zhig mi dge ba'i rtsa ba la chags pa la sogs pas zil gyis non cing sems non nas mngon par zhe na pa drag pos bsams te mi dge ba la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig mi dge ba'i rtsa ba la chags pa la sogs pas zil gyis non cing sems non nas mngon par zhe na pa drag pos bsams te mi dge ba la spyod pa'o //
translated: Some, overcome by attachment and so on to the roots of nonvirtue, and with their minds overcome, engage in nonvirtue, thinking with intense attachment.

original: phyin ci log gi sems pa las gyur pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log gi sems pa las gyur pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The mental activity of mistaken thought is as follows:

original: 'ga' zhig chos 'dod kyang mi mthun pa'i rgyu la lta ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig chos 'dod kyang mi mthun pa'i rgyu la lta ste /
translated: Some, though desiring the Dharma, look to discordant causes.

original: phyi ma la yid du 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i don du bsams nas mi dge ba spyod pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma la yid du 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i don du bsams nas mi dge ba spyod pa'o //
translated: The latter is the performance of nonvirtue after reflecting on it for the sake of a pleasant result.

original: de la sems pa las gyur pa dang po gsum ni las byas su zin kyang stsogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la sems pa las gyur pa dang po gsum ni las byas su zin kyang stsogs pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Among these, the first three kinds of reflection do not constitute accumulation even though the action is performed.

original: de'i phyir 'di'i rnam par smin pa gdon mi za bar myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di'i rnam par smin pa gdon mi za bar myong bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, its karmic maturation is not necessarily experienced.

original: sems pa las gyur ba tha ma gnyis ni gal te byas par gyur na bsags pa yin te /
analyzed: sems pa las gyur ba tha ma gnyis ni gal te byas par gyur na bsags pa yin te /
translated: The latter two kinds of reflection do constitute accumulation if the action is performed.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa gdon mi za bar myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa gdon mi za bar myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Its karmic maturation is necessarily experienced.üîΩAccumulation is the increase of habitual tendencies.

original: stsogs pa ni bag chags 'phel ba'o zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rnam par smin pa'i sa bon yongs su gsos par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa ni bag chags 'phel ba'o zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rnam par smin pa'i sa bon yongs su gsos par rig par bya'o //
translated: The increase of habitual tendencies should be understood as the activation of the seeds of karmic maturation in the store consciousness.

original: las byed par nges pa ni sngon gyi las rnams kyis rnam par smin pa'i rgyud nges par byas nas 'phangs par gyur ba ste /
analyzed: las byed par nges pa ni sngon gyi las rnams kyis rnam par smin pa'i rgyud nges par byas nas 'phangs par gyur ba ste /
translated: The certainty of action is the projection of the life-stream by previous actions that have already come to maturation.

original: gang gi tshe de la 'dis las 'di byed par nges par de dang mi 'gal bar las de byed /üîΩde'i @47a * //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de la 'dis las 'di byed par nges par de dang mi 'gal bar las de byed / de'i @47a * //
translated: When it is certain that this action will be done by him, it is done without contradiction.

original: rgyu'i nges pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu'i rgyur gyur ba'i phyir de mi bya bar bzlog pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang mdzad mi spyod do //
analyzed: rgyu'i nges pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'bras bu'i rgyur gyur ba'i phyir de mi bya bar bzlog pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis kyang mdzad mi spyod do //
translated: The Blessed Buddhas cannot stop him from doing that action, because the cause of the result is just as it is.

original: rnam par smin pa myong bar nges pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa myong bar nges pa ni /
translated: Karma whose result is to be experienced is certain.

original: sems pa las gyur pa'i las kyi ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: sems pa las gyur pa'i las kyi ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Karma that is to be experienced is certain in the case of karma that is volition and the rest as before.

original: dus nges pa ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyi dus kyang nges par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: dus nges pa ni mthong ba'i chos la myong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i las rnams kyi dus kyang nges par byas pa yin te /
translated: Karma whose time is certain is also certain in the case of karma to be experienced in this very life and so on.

original: ji ltar rnam par smin pa 'dis ni mthong ba'i chos la rnam par smin par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par smin pa 'dis ni mthong ba'i chos la rnam par smin par byed do //
translated: For example, it is said, ‚ÄúThis karma will ripen in this very life.

original: 'dis ni skyes nas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni skyes nas so //
translated: This will ripen after rebirth.

original: 'dis ni lan grangs gzhan la'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis ni lan grangs gzhan la'o zhes bya'o //
translated: This will ripen in another life.‚Äù

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni dud 'gro dang yi dgas dang sems can dmyal ba rnams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni dud 'gro dang yi dgas dang sems can dmyal ba rnams su rig par bya'o //
translated: The ripened result of the ten unwholesome courses of action should be known as animals, ghosts, and hell beings.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni ngan song rnams nas shi 'phos nas mir skyes pa rnams kyi srog gcod pa dang ma byin bar len pa la sogs ba so so dang mthun pa'i lus dang yongs su gzung ba mi 'byor ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni ngan song rnams nas shi 'phos nas mir skyes pa rnams kyi srog gcod pa dang ma byin bar len pa la sogs ba so so dang mthun pa'i lus dang yongs su gzung ba mi 'byor ba ste /
translated: The result corresponding to the cause is that, having died in the lower realms, one is born as a human with a body and possessions that do not correspond to each of the unwholesome actions, such as killing and stealing.

original: 'di ltar tshe thung ba dang dbul ba la sogs pa ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshe thung ba dang dbul ba la sogs pa ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, it is as appropriate as possible, such as a short life and poverty.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni so so dang mthun pa nyid du phyi'i dngos po lo tog la sogs pa mi 'byor ba ste /
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni so so dang mthun pa nyid du phyi'i dngos po lo tog la sogs pa mi 'byor ba ste /
translated: The dominant result is that external things, such as crops, do not correspond to each of the unwholesome actions.

original: 'di ltar srog gcod pa'i dbang gis ni byin chung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar srog gcod pa'i dbang gis ni byin chung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, due to killing, there is little rain, and so on.

original: de bzhin du dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi 'bras bu dag kyang lta dang mi rnams kyi nang du gsum gsum du 'gyur ba ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi 'bras bu dag kyang lta dang mi rnams kyi nang du gsum gsum du 'gyur ba ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: So too, the results of the ten contaminated paths of virtuous action are the three results of the three uncontaminated paths of virtuous action in the desire realm and the three results of the three uncontaminated paths of virtuous action in the higher realms, respectively.

original: las gcig gis lus gcig 'phen pa ni las kyi skad cig gcig gis tshe gcig kho na'i rnam par smin pa'i sa bon gsos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las gcig gis lus gcig 'phen pa ni las kyi skad cig gcig gis tshe gcig kho na'i rnam par smin pa'i sa bon gsos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One projects one body by one action because the seed of the single life is activated by a single moment of action.

original: gcig gis du ma 'phen pa ni /
analyzed: gcig gis du ma 'phen pa ni /
translated: One projects many by one action

original: de nyid kyis tshe rabs du ma'i rnam pa smin pa'i sa bon gsos pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdu mas gcig 'phen pa ni las kyi skad cig mang pos gcig po de nyid kyi sa bon dang yang gsos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis tshe rabs du ma'i rnam pa smin pa'i sa bon gsos pa'i phyir ro // du mas gcig 'phen pa ni las kyi skad cig mang pos gcig po de nyid kyi sa bon dang yang gsos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the seed of many lives is activated by that action.üîΩMany project one because the seed of that single life is activated by many moments of action.

original: du mas du ma 'phen pa ni mang po dag phan tshun ltos nas tshe rabs gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i sa bon gsos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du mas du ma 'phen pa ni mang po dag phan tshun ltos nas tshe rabs gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i sa bon gsos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Many project many because the seed of many lives is activated by many actions that mutually rely on each other.

original: ci'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i dge ba la mi g-yo ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i dge ba la mi g-yo ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the wholesome of the realm of fine-materiality and the realm of immateriality called ‚Äúunshakeable‚Äù?

original: ji ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'gro ba gzhan gyi yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i dge ba ni gzhan du rnam par smin pa 'byin pa byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'gro ba gzhan gyi yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i dge ba ni gzhan du rnam par smin pa 'byin pa byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: The wholesome of the realm of desire which perfects the other destinies, produces the effect of retribution in another place.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa @47b na spyod pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa @47b na spyod pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But the wholesome of the realm of fine-materiality and the realm of immateriality is not like that,

original: sa'i nges pas 'bras bu 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa'i nges pas 'bras bu 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it produces its effect in the place where it is produced.

original: de bas na rnam par smin pa 'byin par g-yo ba med pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa yin pas mi g-yo ba'i phyir mi g-yo ba zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par smin pa 'byin par g-yo ba med pa dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa yin pas mi g-yo ba'i phyir mi g-yo ba zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus, because it does not shake, i.e., does not produce the effect of retribution elsewhere, and because it is of the stage of the meditative development, it is called ‚Äúunshakeable‚Äù.

original: 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la rmongs pa ni mi dge ba'i 'du byed rnams 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni de dag gi ni gcig tu nyon mongs pa can yin pas ma rig pa yod par 'gyur na 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la mngon par yid
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la rmongs pa ni mi dge ba'i 'du byed rnams 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni de dag gi ni gcig tu nyon mongs pa can yin pas ma rig pa yod par 'gyur na 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la mngon par yid
translated: When there is ignorance with regard to the effect of retribution, there is the formation of unwholesome action. Since these are exclusively defiled, ignorance is present. But when there is no ignorance with regard to the effect of retribution, there is no formation of unwholesome action.

original: ces pa'i rnam pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces pa'i rnam pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no occasion for the right view of the aspect of non-existence.üîΩDelusion about the meaning of reality is the cause of the production of meritorious and immovable forces.

original: de kho na'i don la rmongs pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes mi g-yo ba rnam so zhes bya ba de kho na'i don zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag go //
analyzed: de kho na'i don la rmongs pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes mi g-yo ba rnam so zhes bya ba de kho na'i don zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag go //
translated: The meaning of reality is the four noble truths.

original: de la rmongs na dge ba'i sems yod du zin kyang bden pa ma mthong ba nams la bag la nyal gyi rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la rmongs na dge ba'i sems yod du zin kyang bden pa ma mthong ba nams la bag la nyal gyi rjes su 'brel par 'gyur ro //
translated: When there is delusion about them, even though there is a virtuous mind, there is a connection with the latent impressions of the truths that have not been seen.

original: de'i dbang gis de dag khams gsum pa sdug bsngal nyid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir yang srid pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams slong bar byed do //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis de dag khams gsum pa sdug bsngal nyid du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir yang srid pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i bsod nams dang mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed rnams slong bar byed do //
translated: By the power of that, they produce meritorious and immovable forces that are the cause of renewed existence, because they do not understand the reality of the three realms just as it is.

original: bden pa mthong ba rnams ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba rnams ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: Those who have seen the truths are not like that,

original: de kho na'i don la rmongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na'i don la rmongs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not deluded about the meaning of reality.

original: de bas na de dag ni de'i rgyu las byung ba rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de dag ni de'i rgyu las byung ba rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called ‚Äúarisen from that cause.‚Äù

original: srog gcod pa la yang shal sogs pa 'dod pa rnams ni chags pas sbyor ro //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la yang shal sogs pa 'dod pa rnams ni chags pas sbyor ro //
translated: One who kills through desire for meat, etc. is bound by attachment.

original: sha glon par 'dod pa rnams ni zhe sdang gis sbyor ro //
analyzed: sha glon par 'dod pa rnams ni zhe sdang gis sbyor ro //
translated: One who kills through desire for flesh is bound by hatred.

original: mchod sbyin la sogs pa gti mug gis sbyor ro //
analyzed: mchod sbyin la sogs pa gti mug gis sbyor ro //
translated: One who kills through delusion, such as in a sacrifice, is bound by delusion.

original: zhe sdang nyid kyis ni mthar phyin par byed de /
analyzed: zhe sdang nyid kyis ni mthar phyin par byed de /
translated: One who kills through hatred is bound by hatred.

original: snying rje med pa ma yin par sems can gsod mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying rje med pa ma yin par sems can gsod mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible to kill a sentient being without hatred.

original: ngag rtsub po la sogs pa la yang ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ngag rtsub po la sogs pa la yang ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to harsh speech, etc., as is appropriate.

original: brnab sems la sogs pa la ji ltar chags pa la sogs pas sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: brnab sems la sogs pa la ji ltar chags pa la sogs pas sbyor zhe na /
translated: How is one bound by attachment, etc. to covetousness, etc.?

original: de la brnab sems kyi las kyi lam ni gal te gzhan gyi nor dang yo byad bdag gir byed par nges pa'o zhes bstan pa de la gal te gzhan gyi nor dang yo byad de nyid 'dod par gyur na /
analyzed: de la brnab sems kyi las kyi lam ni gal te gzhan gyi nor dang yo byad bdag gir byed par nges pa'o zhes bstan pa de la gal te gzhan gyi nor dang yo byad de nyid 'dod par gyur na /
translated: In this regard, the path of action of covetousness is definitely appropriating the wealth and possessions of another. If one desires the wealth and possessions of another,

original: de bdag gir bya ba'i phyir mngon par 'du byed de /
analyzed: de bdag gir bya ba'i phyir mngon par 'du byed de /
translated: One engages in the activity of appropriating it.

original: de'i phyir chags pas sbyor bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir chags pas sbyor bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, one is established as engaging through attachment.

original: ci ste 'di yi ra ma gyur cig ce na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di yi ra ma gyur cig ce na /
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúMay it not be appropriated by another,‚Äù

original: de ltar na ni zhe sdang gis sbyor ro //
analyzed: de ltar na ni zhe sdang gis sbyor ro //
translated: then one engages through aversion.

original: ci ste gzhan gyis bdag gir byas kyang nyes pa ci yang med do @48a * //
analyzed: ci ste gzhan gyis bdag gir byas kyang nyes pa ci yang med do @48a * //
translated: If one thinks, ‚ÄúEven if it is appropriated by another, there is no fault,‚Äù

original: snyam na gti mug gis sbyor bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snyam na gti mug gis sbyor bar rig par bya'o //
translated: then one should understand that one engages through delusion.

original: gzhan la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to others.

original: phan tshun gyi dbang gis byung ba yang thun mong ba'i las su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: phan tshun gyi dbang gis byung ba yang thun mong ba'i las su rig par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that karma that arises through mutual power is common karma,

original: de'i dbang gis sems can rnams phan tshun du sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis sems can rnams phan tshun du sems dang sems las byung ba 'byung ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: because through its power the minds and mental factors of sentient beings arise mutually.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi las ni gnyen po'i las stobs dang ldan par blta ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi las ni gnyen po'i las stobs dang ldan par blta ste /
translated: One should understand that karma that is an opposing factor is powerful karma that is an antidote.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis 'bras bu 'phangs su zin kyang gnyen po'i stobs kyis gzhan du bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis 'bras bu 'phangs su zin kyang gnyen po'i stobs kyis gzhan du bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if the result of an unfavorable action has been projected, it can be transformed into another by the power of the antidote.

original: gnyen po'i stobs can gyi dge ba'i las sems pa las gyur pa ni /
analyzed: gnyen po'i stobs can gyi dge ba'i las sems pa las gyur pa ni /
translated: A virtuous action that is powerful by the power of the antidote is

original: mi dge bas stobs dang ldan par blta'o //
analyzed: mi dge bas stobs dang ldan par blta'o //
translated: seen to be powerful in comparison to a nonvirtuous action.

original: gnyen po'i mthu chung ba'i mi dge ba ni dge ba bas stobs dang ldan no //
analyzed: gnyen po'i mthu chung ba'i mi dge ba ni dge ba bas stobs dang ldan no //
translated: A nonvirtuous action that is weak in the power of the antidote is powerful in comparison to a virtuous action.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba rnam par smin par nges pa 'phags pa'i lam gyis ma spangs ba thams cad ni bye brag med par stobs dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba rnam par smin par nges pa 'phags pa'i lam gyis ma spangs ba thams cad ni bye brag med par stobs dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: All virtuous and nonvirtuous actions that are certain to yield results and have not been abandoned by the ƒÅrya path are called powerful without distinction.

original: 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i mi dge ba ni rang bzhin gyis stobs dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i mi dge ba ni rang bzhin gyis stobs dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Nonvirtuous actions associated with the desire realm are naturally powerful

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i 'khor mang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i 'khor mang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have a large retinue of afflictions, secondary afflictions, and so on.

original: gang sngon gyi goms par byas ba de yang stobs dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gang sngon gyi goms par byas ba de yang stobs dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Those that have been cultivated in the past are also powerful

original: des rgyud la bsgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des rgyud la bsgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have been infused in the mindstream.

original: gang gnas la gnas pa ni nar son pa rnams kyi ste /
analyzed: gang gnas la gnas pa ni nar son pa rnams kyi ste /
translated: That which is based on a basis refers to those who are mature.

original: mngon par zhen pa dang dad pa drag pos byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa dang dad pa drag pos byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are done with strong attachment and faith.

original: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can rnams kyi lam sgrub tu med pa gang yin pa de ni gnyen pos byung du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can rnams kyi lam sgrub tu med pa gang yin pa de ni gnyen pos byung du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is not to be practiced by those who have the Dharma of no more training is not to be practiced because it is not produced by its antidote.

original: zhing ni ma gsod pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhing ni ma gsod pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The field is such as one's mother, father, and so on.

original: sems kyi mngon par 'du byed pa ni byang chub sems por smon lam btab pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sems kyi mngon par 'du byed pa ni byang chub sems por smon lam btab pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Mental application is such as the aspiration for enlightenment and so on.

original: stobs dang ldan pa'i las su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: stobs dang ldan pa'i las su rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as powerful karma.

original: yang rnam pa dgus stobs dang ldan pa'i las su rig par bya ste 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa dgus stobs dang ldan pa'i las su rig par bya ste 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be understood as powerful karma in nine ways:

original: zhing ni gal te yon tan dang ldan pa'i sbyin gnas zhing du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhing ni gal te yon tan dang ldan pa'i sbyin gnas zhing du gyur pa'o //
translated: The field is such as the recipients of generosity who are endowed with good qualities.

original: dngos po ni gal te sbyin pa'i dngos po gya nom zhing mang por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po ni gal te sbyin pa'i dngos po gya nom zhing mang por gyur pa'o //
translated: The thing is such as the gift that is excellent and abundant.

original: ngo bo nyid ni sbyin ba bas tshul khrims stobs dang ldan no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni sbyin ba bas tshul khrims stobs dang ldan no //
translated: The nature is such as morality is more powerful than generosity.

original: tshul khrims pas bsgom pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims pas bsgom pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva is superior to the morality of the ≈õrƒÅvaka, etc.

original: gzhi ni bsod nams byed pa gal te 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi ni bsod nams byed pa gal te 'dod chags dang bral bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The basis is the person who is engaged in the meritorious work, if he is free from passion.

original: yid la byed pa ni gal te yid la byed pa dang ba drag po dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni gal te yid la byed pa dang ba drag po dang ldan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The attention is if he is endowed with intense and clear attention.

original: bsam ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: bsam ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa dang ldan par gyur pa'o //
translated: The intention is if he is endowed with the intention of attaining nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: grogs ni de las gzhan @48b pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos pos yongs su zin par 'gyur ba'o //üîΩlan mang du byed pa ni yang dang yang du byas par gyur ba'am /
analyzed: grogs ni de las gzhan @48b pa'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos pos yongs su zin par 'gyur ba'o // lan mang du byed pa ni yang dang yang du byas par gyur ba'am /
translated: The companion is if he is accompanied by the meritorious work of others.üîΩThe repetition is if he does it again and again,

original: rjes su rnam par brtags pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su rnam par brtags pa'o //
translated: or if he contemplates it.

original: skye bo mang pos kyang zhes bya ba ni bdag gis kyang byas par gyur la gzhan dang / kyang byed du bcug pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo mang pos kyang zhes bya ba ni bdag gis kyang byas par gyur la gzhan dang / kyang byed du bcug pa'o //
translated: The multitude is if he does it himself and also causes others to do it.

original: su zhig 'di skad du skyes bu gang zag 'di ji ltar las byed cing stsogs pa de lta de ltar rnam par smin pa myong ba gyur na /
analyzed: su zhig 'di skad du skyes bu gang zag 'di ji ltar las byed cing stsogs pa de lta de ltar rnam par smin pa myong ba gyur na /
translated: What is the meaning of the statement, ‚ÄúWhatever action a person does or makes another do, in that way he experiences the ripening‚Äù?

original: de ltar na tshangs par spyod pas gnas par mi 'gyur zhing yang dag par sdug bsngal zad pa dang / sdug bsngal mthar dbyung ba'i skabs kyang mi snang ngo zhes zer zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar na tshangs par spyod pas gnas par mi 'gyur zhing yang dag par sdug bsngal zad pa dang / sdug bsngal mthar dbyung ba'i skabs kyang mi snang ngo zhes zer zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, the life of purity would not exist, and there would be no opportunity for the complete extinction of suffering and the removal of suffering.

original: ji ltar byas na tshangs par spyod pas gnas par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas na tshangs par spyod pas gnas par mi 'gyur zhe na /

original: sbyor ba gnag la bsam pa dkar ba ni dper na 'ga' zhig bu 'am slob ma la mi phan pa bzlog par 'dod cing phan pa la sbyor bar 'dod nas /
analyzed: sbyor ba gnag la bsam pa dkar ba ni dper na 'ga' zhig bu 'am slob ma la mi phan pa bzlog par 'dod cing phan pa la sbyor bar 'dod nas /
translated: White intention and black application: for example, someone who, wishing to turn his son or disciple away from what is harmful and wishing to connect him with what is beneficial,

original: snying brtse ba'i sems kyis lus dang ngag gis drag tu byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: snying brtse ba'i sems kyis lus dang ngag gis drag tu byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: acts harshly with body and speech out of a compassionate attitude.

original: kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, he becomes defiled.

original: mi gnag cig dkar la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur zhing las zad par 'gyur ba'i las gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi gnag cig dkar la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur zhing las zad par 'gyur ba'i las gang zhe na /
translated: What is the action that is neither black nor white, which has no karmic maturation, and which leads to the exhaustion of actions?

original: sbyor ba dang ba chad med pa'i lam rnams la zag pa med pa'i las zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyor ba dang ba chad med pa'i lam rnams la zag pa med pa'i las zhes bya ba la /
translated: The action of the uninterrupted path of pure application is called ‚Äúundefiled action.‚Äù

original: sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa'i lam rnams ni spong ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa'i lam rnams ni spong ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The uninterrupted path of pure application is the antidote of abandonment.

original: de la mi gnag pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi gnag pa ni nyon mongs pa'i dri ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not dark because it is free from the stain of the afflictions.

original: dkar ba ni gcig tu rnam pa byang ba'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam par smin par mi 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: dkar ba ni gcig tu rnam pa byang ba'i phyir ro // rnam par smin par mi 'gyur ba ni /
translated: It is bright because it is exclusively pure.

original: 'khor ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not mature because it is not in accord with samsara.

original: las zad par 'gyur ba ni nag @50b po la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i las rnam pa gsum po 'di nyid zag pa med pa'i lam des rnam par smin pa 'byin pa'i bag chags legs par bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las zad par 'gyur ba ni nag @50b po la sogs pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i las rnam pa gsum po 'di nyid zag pa med pa'i lam des rnam par smin pa 'byin pa'i bag chags legs par bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It exhausts karma because it completely destroys the latent impressions that produce the maturation of the three types of karma, such as black, etc., which are contaminated, by means of that uncontaminated path.

original: bye brag med par zag pa med pa'i las 'di thams cad kyi bar du gcod pa dang rjes su mthun pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas nas yon po dang / nyes pa dang / rnyog pa dang / btsang ba dang / thub pa rnams go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag med par zag pa med pa'i las 'di thams cad kyi bar du gcod pa dang rjes su mthun pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas nas yon po dang / nyes pa dang / rnyog pa dang / btsang ba dang / thub pa rnams go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Without distinction, all uncontaminated karma should be understood as being established in order, as crooked, faulty, turbid, pure, and stainless, respectively, from the point of view of its obstruction, conformity, and nature.

original: de la yon po ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las drang po'i lam 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'byung ba'i sgrib par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la yon po ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las drang po'i lam 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'byung ba'i sgrib par gyur pa'o //
translated: Crookedness is an obstruction to the arising of the path of the noble ones, the path of rightness, which is the path of action of body, speech, and mind.

original: nyes pa ni lus la sogs pa'i las gang gis rnam par sun phyung ba'i sems kyi rgyud la de dang 'dra ba'i sgrib par gyur pa'i las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyes pa ni lus la sogs pa'i las gang gis rnam par sun phyung ba'i sems kyi rgyud la de dang 'dra ba'i sgrib par gyur pa'i las 'byung ngo //
translated: Faults are actions of body, etc., by which a stream of consciousness that has been corrupted gives rise to actions that are obstructions similar to it.

original: rnyog pa ni mu stegs can gyi lta ba la brten pa'i lus la sogs pa'i las gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rnyog pa ni mu stegs can gyi lta ba la brten pa'i lus la sogs pa'i las gang yin pa ste /
translated: Turbidity is any action of body, etc., based on the views of the tƒ´rthikas,

original: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la dad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma dad pa'i rnyog pas yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa la dad pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma dad pa'i rnyog pas yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seized by the turbidity of lack of faith, which is the opposite of faith in the teaching of the Buddha.

original: rnams grangs gzhan du na /
analyzed: rnams grangs gzhan du na /
translated: Another enumeration is:

original: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar lhung ba ste /
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar lhung ba ste /
translated: falling into the extremes of eternalism and annihilationism,

original: dbu ma'i lam dang mi mthun pa'i phyir yon po'o //
analyzed: dbu ma'i lam dang mi mthun pa'i phyir yon po'o //
translated: because it is not in accord with the middle way.

original: skur ba'i lta bas yongs su bzung ste rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa la rab tu zhe sdang ba'i phyir nyes pa'o //üîΩ'jig tshogs la lta bas yongs su bzung ste /
analyzed: skur ba'i lta bas yongs su bzung ste rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa la rab tu zhe sdang ba'i phyir nyes pa'o // 'jig tshogs la lta bas yongs su bzung ste /
translated: It is a fault because it is completely taken up with the view of self-abasement and is hostile to the establishment of purification.

original: bdag med pa'i de kho na la lta ba'i bar du gcod pa'i phyir rnyog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa'i de kho na la lta ba'i bar du gcod pa'i phyir rnyog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is a stain because it is completely taken up with the view of individuality and obstructs the vision of reality which is selflessness.

original: gtsang ba ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims kyis yongs su zin pa dang / lta ba drang pos yongs su zin pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gtsang ba ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims kyis yongs su zin pa dang / lta ba drang pos yongs su zin pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las gang yin pa ste /
translated: Purity is any action of body, speech, or mind that is taken up with pure morality and with right views.

original: tshul khrims dang lta ba la log par zhugs pa'i dri ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang lta ba la log par zhugs pa'i dri ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pure because it is free from the stain of immorality and wrong views.

original: thub pa ba ni gang slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las zag pa med pa ste /
analyzed: thub pa ba ni gang slob pa dang mi slob pa rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las zag pa med pa ste /
translated: The Sage's is the undefiled action of body, speech, and mind of the learners and the adepts.

original: de thub pa rnams kyi las yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de thub pa rnams kyi las yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the Sage's action because it is the action of the sages.

original: sbyin pa phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas sbyin pa por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyir zhing sbyin pa ston te /
analyzed: sbyin pa phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas sbyin pa por 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni phyir zhing sbyin pa ston te /
translated: In terms of the perfection of generosity, he becomes a donor shows generosity again and again.

original: de'i dang tshul can du gyur pas yang dang yang sbyin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dang tshul can du gyur pas yang dang yang sbyin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he becomes one who has that as his nature, he gives again and again.

original: dge sbyong rnams dang bram ze rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phyogs mi 'byed par sbyin pa ston te /
analyzed: dge sbyong rnams dang bram ze rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phyogs mi 'byed par sbyin pa ston te /
translated: The phrase to ascetics and brahmins and so on shows generosity without partiality,

original: 'dod pa thams cad la bye brag med par sbyin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbza' ba dang btung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa thams cad la bye brag med par sbyin pa'i phyir ro // bza' ba dang btung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: because he gives without making distinctions among all those in need.

original: @51a * // 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par sbyin pa ston te /
analyzed: @51a * // 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par sbyin pa ston te /
translated: The phrase food and drink and so on shows generosity that fulfills wishes,

original: bsam ba ji lta ba bzhin du yo byad kyi dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam ba ji lta ba bzhin du yo byad kyi dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he gives away all the things that are needed in accordance with their wishes.

original: lhug par gtong ba dang / lag brkyang ba dang / gtong ba la dga' ba dang mchod sbyin byed pa'i dang tshul can dang / gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyin pa legs par 'ged pa la dga' ba zhes bya'i tshig 'di dag ni mi gnas par sbyin pa la sogs pa dang go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhug par gtong ba dang / lag brkyang ba dang / gtong ba la dga' ba dang mchod sbyin byed pa'i dang tshul can dang / gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbyin pa legs par 'ged pa la dga' ba zhes bya'i tshig 'di dag ni mi gnas par sbyin pa la sogs pa dang go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The terms ‚Äúgenerous,‚Äù ‚Äúopenhanded,‚Äù ‚Äúdelighting in giving and offering,‚Äù ‚Äúperfect generosity,‚Äù and ‚Äútaking delight in distributing gifts‚Äù should be understood as referring, respectively, to the generosity of one who is not attached, etc.

original: mi gnas pa'i sbyin pa ni srid pa dang longs spyod kyi phyir yongs su mi bsngo ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i sbyin pa ni srid pa dang longs spyod kyi phyir yongs su mi bsngo ba nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The generosity of one who is not attached should be understood as not being dedicated to worldly existence or to enjoyments.

original: sbyin par bya ba phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas ldang ba'i brtson 'grus kyis thob pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po gnod pas grub pa ma yin pa ston te /
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas ldang ba'i brtson 'grus kyis thob pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po gnod pas grub pa ma yin pa ston te /
translated: In terms of the perfection of the object that is given, the verse speaks of ‚Äúthat which is obtained through the effort of rising.‚Äù This shows that the object that is given is not something that has been acquired through harm.

original: gnod pas grub pa ni ldang ba'i brtson 'grus kyis thob pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnod pas grub pa ni ldang ba'i brtson 'grus kyis thob pa ma yin te /
translated: That which is acquired through harm is not something that is obtained through the effort of rising.

original: rang gi gnas na 'dug cing gzhan gyis bcol ba bsnyon pas thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi gnas na 'dug cing gzhan gyis bcol ba bsnyon pas thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is obtained by denying what was entrusted to one's care by another.

original: lag dar ba'i mthus bsgrubs pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po gzhan las phrogs pa ma yin pa ston to //
analyzed: lag dar ba'i mthus bsgrubs pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po gzhan las phrogs pa ma yin pa ston to //
translated: By the expression obtained through the power of begging, it shows that the substance to be given is not stolen from another.

original: gzhan las phrogs pa ni lag dar ba'i mthus bsgrubs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan las phrogs pa ni lag dar ba'i mthus bsgrubs pa ma yin te /
translated: What is stolen from another is not obtained through the power of begging.

original: de dag gi sha thang bar thabs sna tshogs kyis bsgrubs pa phrogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi sha thang bar thabs sna tshogs kyis bsgrubs pa phrogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is stolen by various means through the exhaustion of one's strength.

original: rdul dang dri mas ma phog pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos pa ma rul cing dri ma med pa ston te /
analyzed: rdul dang dri mas ma phog pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos pa ma rul cing dri ma med pa ston te /
translated: By the expression not defiled by dust and dirt, it shows that the substance to be given is not rotten and is pure.

original: rdul dang dri mas mas ma phog pa zhes bya ba ni spangs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdul dang dri mas mas ma phog pa zhes bya ba ni spangs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is said that not defiled by dust and dirt means not abandoned.

original: chos dang mthun pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po rung ba ston te /
analyzed: chos dang mthun pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po rung ba ston te /
translated: By the expression in accordance with the Dharma, it shows that the substance to be given is suitable.

original: mtshon dang dug dang chang la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yongs su spangs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mtshon dang dug dang chang la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa'i dngos po yongs su spangs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because he has completely abandoned all unsuitable things, such as weapons, poison, and alcohol.

original: chos kyis thob pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po chos kyis bsgrub pa ston te /
analyzed: chos kyis thob pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po chos kyis bsgrub pa ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúObtained through Dharma‚Äù indicates that the thing to be given is accomplished through Dharma,

original: gzhal bal g-yo 'jug pa la sogs pa dang log pas 'tsho ba la sogs pa yongs su spangs nas bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhal bal g-yo 'jug pa la sogs pa dang log pas 'tsho ba la sogs pa yongs su spangs nas bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accomplished by avoiding deceit in trade, etc., and wrong livelihood, etc.

original: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas ma nyams pas de dang ldan pa'i phyir tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas ma nyams pas de dang ldan pa'i phyir tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: He is endowed with morality because he possesses it without impairment after having taken up morality.

original: thar pa'i phyir sdom pa gang yin pa de ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ste /
analyzed: thar pa'i phyir sdom pa gang yin pa de ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa ste /
translated: The vow that is for the sake of liberation is the vow of individual liberation.

original: de ni 'khor ba las 'byung bar 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'khor ba las 'byung bar 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: It is the means of deliverance from cyclic existence.

original: cho ga phun sum tshogs pa ni spyod lam la sogs pa dam pa rnams kyis ma smad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cho ga phun sum tshogs pa ni spyod lam la sogs pa dam pa rnams kyis ma smad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of ritual is the perfection of conduct, etc., which is not censured by the holy ones.

original: spyod @51b yul phun sum tshogs pa ni spyod yul ma yin pa lnga spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: spyod @51b yul phun sum tshogs pa ni spyod yul ma yin pa lnga spangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The perfection of the field of action is due to the avoidance of the five improper actions.

original: dge slong gi spyod yul ma yin pa lnga ni gsod pa'i sa dang / smad 'tshong gi gnas dang / chang 'tshong gi khyim dang / rgyal po'i pho brang dang / gdol ba'i khyim ste lnga pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi spyod yul ma yin pa lnga ni gsod pa'i sa dang / smad 'tshong gi gnas dang / chang 'tshong gi khyim dang / rgyal po'i pho brang dang / gdol ba'i khyim ste lnga pa'o //
translated: The five improper actions for a monk are: the place of killing, the place of prostitution, the place of liquor, the king's palace, and the house of an outcast.

original: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba rnams dang rang bzhin gyi kha na mtho ba rnams la yang bsam pha drag pos bslab pas kha na ma thob chung du tsam rnams la yang 'jigs par lta ba yin no //
analyzed: bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba rnams dang rang bzhin gyi kha na mtho ba rnams la yang bsam pha drag pos bslab pas kha na ma thob chung du tsam rnams la yang 'jigs par lta ba yin no //
translated: He also has a strong will to avoid the natural evil actions and the evil actions proscribed by rules. He is fearful of even the slightest evil action.

original: kun nas yongs su rdzogs par bslab pa rnams blangs nas slob pa'i phyir yang dag par blangs te bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la slob ces bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas yongs su rdzogs par bslab pa rnams blangs nas slob pa'i phyir yang dag par blangs te bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la slob ces bya'o //
translated: He is said to train in the bases of training, having taken up the training and having undertaken the training completely and in all ways.

original: 'di man chad du ni tshul khrims las brtsams nas /
analyzed: 'di man chad du ni tshul khrims las brtsams nas /
translated: From here on, the text discusses morality.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde gzhan dag las lus dang ngag bsdams pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang bstan ba de'i don brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde gzhan dag las lus dang ngag bsdams pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang bstan ba de'i don brjod par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of what the Lord taught in other sutras, that is, ‚Äúrestraint of body and speech,‚Äù should be stated.

original: de la lus dang ngag gi bsdams pa yin pa ni shes bzhin gyis yongs su zin pa'i yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la lus dang ngag gi bsdams pa yin pa ni shes bzhin gyis yongs su zin pa'i yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therein, ‚Äúrestraint of body and speech‚Äù is due to being taken hold of by awareness,

original: ji ltar bka' stsal pa bzhin du 'gro ba dang / ldog pa la sogs pa la blo sngon du btang nas legs par bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar bka' stsal pa bzhin du 'gro ba dang / ldog pa la sogs pa la blo sngon du btang nas legs par bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one goes and returns, etc., as instructed, after having first directed one‚Äôs mind to the task.

original: lus dang ngag phun sum tshogs pas phun sum tshogs pa ni ltung ba mi byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag phun sum tshogs pas phun sum tshogs pa ni ltung ba mi byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚Äú Perfection of body and speech‚Äù is due to not committing downfalls,

original: tshul khrims chud mi gson pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims chud mi gson pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not waste one‚Äôs morality.

original: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa yongs su dag pa ni ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa yongs su dag pa ni ting nge 'dzin la gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚Äú Purity of bodily and verbal conduct‚Äù is due to abiding in meditative concentration,

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis 'tshal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma thag bsring pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyis 'tshal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma thag bsring pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the force of meditative concentration removes the stains of morality.

original: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa dge ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi rtog pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa dge ba ni nyon mongs pa can gyi rtog pa dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir te /
translated: Virtuous bodily and verbal conduct is not mixed with afflicted thoughts,

original: gcig tu dge ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu dge ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is exclusively virtuous.

original: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa kha na ma tho ba med pa ni srid pa dang longs spyod kyi phyir yongs su mi bsngo bas dam pa rnams kyis bsngags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa kha na ma tho ba med pa ni srid pa dang longs spyod kyi phyir yongs su mi bsngo bas dam pa rnams kyis bsngags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Blameless bodily and verbal conduct is praised by holy beings because it is not dedicated to existence and enjoyment.

original: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa gnod pa med pa ni bdag la bstod pa la sogs pas gzhan dag khyad du gsod cing 'grogs na mi bde bas zher 'debs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa gnod pa med pa ni bdag la bstod pa la sogs pas gzhan dag khyad du gsod cing 'grogs na mi bde bas zher 'debs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Harmless bodily and verbal conduct is not contemptuous of others, nor does it cause distress when associating with others, because it is free from self-praise and so on.

original: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa rjes su mthun pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa dang mthun pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa rjes su mthun pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa dang mthun pa'i phyir te /
translated: Agreeable bodily and verbal conduct is conducive to attaining nirvana,

original: 'phags pa'i lam 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it leads to the noble path.

original: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa rjes su 'byor ba ni rang gi nyes pa dang yon tan sgrogs pa dang / mi spyoms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa rjes su 'byor ba ni rang gi nyes pa dang yon tan sgrogs pa dang / mi spyoms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas conduct of body and speech is appropriate because it does not proclaim their own good qualities and does not conceal their own faults.

original: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa @52a * //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa @52a * //
translated: The bodhisattvas conduct of body and speech is

original: thabs dang ldan pa ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa nye bar sdud pa'i tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thabs dang ldan pa ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa nye bar sdud pa'i tshul khrims yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: skillful because it is the morality that attracts fellow practitioners.

original: nye bar 'gro bar bya ba'i 'os yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar 'gro bar bya ba'i 'os yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is worthy of being approached.

original: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa 'tsham ba ni bla ma rnams dang bla ma dang 'dra ba rnams la nga rgyal bcag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa 'tsham ba ni bla ma rnams dang bla ma dang 'dra ba rnams la nga rgyal bcag pa'i phyir te /
translated: The bodhisattvas conduct of body and speech is fitting because it is free of pride in the presence of gurus and those similar to gurus.

original: ci rigs su bsnyen bkur byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci rigs su bsnyen bkur byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is worthy of being served in every way.

original: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa mthun pa ni gdams ngag la mthun par 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa mthun pa ni gdams ngag la mthun par 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The bodhisattvas conduct of body and speech is harmonious because it is the acceptance of instruction.

original: rang gi lta ba la mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi lta ba la mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is free of the grasping at ones own view as paramount.

original: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa gdung ba med pa ni dka' thub drag po dang ngan don la mos pa spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa gdung ba med pa ni dka' thub drag po dang ngan don la mos pa spangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The bodhisattvas physical and verbal conduct is not tormented, because it is free of the mortification of asceticism and the inclination to evil.

original: bdag la gdung bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la gdung bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not torment the self.

original: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa phyis 'gyod pa med pa ni longs spyod pa rnams dang las kyi mtha' rnams spang pa la brtsams nas 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa phyis 'gyod pa med pa ni longs spyod pa rnams dang las kyi mtha' rnams spang pa la brtsams nas 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The bodhisattvas physical and verbal conduct is not regretted later, because it is free of regret after having begun to enjoy sense objects and to perform actions.

original: phyis 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not regretted later.

original: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa yid la gcags pa med pa ni dge ba'i phyogs la brtsams nas cung zad tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa'i yid la gcags pa med ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi kun tu spyod pa yid la gcags pa med pa ni dge ba'i phyogs la brtsams nas cung zad tsam gyis chog par mi 'dzin pa'i yid la gcags pa med ba'i phyir te /
translated: The bodhisattvas physical and verbal conduct is not remorseful, because it is free of remorse after having begun the virtuous side and not being satisfied with a little.

original: bsgrub nus pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bsgrub nus pa'i bar du'o //
translated: up to the point of being able to accomplish it.

original: 'di dag gi las ni bdag gir bya ba yin pas 'di dag ni las bdag gir bya ba dag go //
analyzed: 'di dag gi las ni bdag gir bya ba yin pas 'di dag ni las bdag gir bya ba dag go //
translated: These are called the actions of the appropriator because they are the actions of the self.

original: de dag gi las bdag gir bya ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi las bdag gir bya ba ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What are their actions of the appropriator?

original: rang gis byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa myong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gis byas pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa myong ba'i phyir te /
translated: because they experience the evolution of actions that they themselves have done.

original: gang gzhan dag dang thun mong ma yin pa de ni bdag gi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gzhan dag dang thun mong ma yin pa de ni bdag gi zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is not shared with others is called ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: 'di dag ni las kyi bgo skal la spyod pa yin pas 'di dag ni las kyi bsgo skal la spyod pa dag go //
analyzed: 'di dag ni las kyi bgo skal la spyod pa yin pas 'di dag ni las kyi bsgo skal la spyod pa dag go //
translated: They are called ‚Äúthose who experience the results of their own actions‚Äù because they experience the results of their own actions.

original: ji ltar na las kyi bgo skal la spyod pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na las kyi bgo skal la spyod pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How do they experience the results of their own actions?

original: rang gis byas pa'i las kyi rnams par smin pa myong ba de la dge ba dang mi dge ba so so'i bgo skal la spyod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rang gis byas pa'i las kyi rnams par smin pa myong ba de la dge ba dang mi dge ba so so'i bgo skal la spyod pa'i phyir te /
translated: They experience the results of their own actions because they experience the evolution of the actions that they themselves have done, and because they experience the results of their own actions, whether good or bad.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: rang rang gi 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa 'ged pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rang gi 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa 'ged pa'i phyir ro //
translated: they experience the results of their own actions, whether good or bad, because they experience the results of their own actions, whether good or bad.

original: rang gis byas pa'i las la 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dag gi rnam par smin pa myong ba'i sems can de dag thog ma ga las byung /
analyzed: rang gis byas pa'i las la 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa dag gi rnam par smin pa myong ba'i sems can de dag thog ma ga las byung /
translated: From where do those sentient beings come who experience the results of their own actions, whether good or bad?

original: ci rgyu med pa las byung ba zhig gam /
analyzed: ci rgyu med pa las byung ba zhig gam /
translated: Do they come from no cause?

original: 'on te rang bzhin dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: 'on te rang bzhin dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba zhig ce na /
translated: Or, do they arise from a cause such as a primal substance or God?

original: smras pa / las kyi skyes gnas la dgag go //
analyzed: smras pa / las kyi skyes gnas la dgag go //
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúThe origination of beings is refuted in terms of karma.‚Äù

original: 'di dag gi las nyid rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyu rnams par spangs pa'i skyes gnas te /
analyzed: 'di dag gi las nyid rgyu med pa dang mi mthun pa'i rgyu rnams par spangs pa'i skyes gnas te /
translated: The origination of these beings is karma, which is free from causelessness and incompatible causes.

original: sems can rnams 'byung ba'i @52b phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can rnams 'byung ba'i @52b phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of ‚Äúbecause of the appearance of sentient beings.‚Äù

original: de ltar 'jug pa las kyang brtsams ldog pa las kyang brtsams nas las bstan par bya ba dag ste /
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa las kyang brtsams ldog pa las kyang brtsams nas las bstan par bya ba dag ste /
translated: Thus, karma is to be taught in terms of both engagement and withdrawal.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i las spang ba'i phyir zag pa med pa'i las rten yin pas /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i las spang ba'i phyir zag pa med pa'i las rten yin pas /
translated: Since uncontaminated karma is the basis for the abandonment of contaminated karma,

original: 'di dag gi brten par bya ba ni las nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gi brten par bya ba ni las nyid yin no //
translated: karma is what is to be based on.

original: sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes gang gsungs pa de ni rnam pa thams cad du bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes gang gsungs pa de ni rnam pa thams cad du bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThe ripening of karma of sentient beings is inconceivable.‚Äù This should be understood as inconceivable in every way.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is inconceivable?

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa bde 'gro dang ngan 'gror 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rnam par smin pa bde 'gro dang ngan 'gror 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: The inconceivable is the desirable and undesirable results of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma, such as birth in happy or evil realms.

original: nus pa dang yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'i yon tan khyad par can 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa dang yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa'i yon tan khyad par can 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is inconceivable because it is the cause that attracts special qualities such as power and right view.

original: las 'dis sems can rnams kyi lus kyi kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa rnams pa tha dad pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
analyzed: las 'dis sems can rnams kyi lus kyi kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa rnams pa tha dad pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa ste /
translated: The inconceivable is the various types of sentient beings‚Äô bodies, colors, shapes, and so on, which are produced by karma.

original: mi nus pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las gzhan pa mgo rmongs pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi nus pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las gzhan pa mgo rmongs pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is inconceivable because it is the cause that attracts faults such as impotence and delusion, which are different from omniscience.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i las de nyid gnas la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i las de nyid gnas la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas ni bsam gyis mi khyab bo //
translated: That very virtuous and nonvirtuous karma is inconceivable due to its classification as stable and so on.
