original: de la gnas ni grong ngam grong khyer gyi phyogs gang du gnas nas las de byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩdngos po ni sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'am /
analyzed: de la gnas ni grong ngam grong khyer gyi phyogs gang du gnas nas las de byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // dngos po ni sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'am /
translated: The basis is the place where the action is performed, such as a village or a town.

original: sems can ma yin pa'i grongs su gtogs pa gang la brten te byas pa'o //üîΩrgyu ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams te /
analyzed: sems can ma yin pa'i grongs su gtogs pa gang la brten te byas pa'o // rgyu ni dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams te /
translated: The object is that which is acted upon, whether it is a sentient being or not.

original: ji ltar mthun mthun sbyar ro //
analyzed: ji ltar mthun mthun sbyar ro //
translated: The cause is the roots of virtue and nonvirtue, as is appropriate.

original: rnam par smin pa ni lus sna tshogs pa de nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni lus sna tshogs pa de nyid do //
translated: The result is the maturation of the action.

original: sna tshogs mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i las bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni las ci 'dra bas tsher ma la sogs pa'i rno ba la sogs pa byas pa ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i las bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni las ci 'dra bas tsher ma la sogs pa'i rno ba la sogs pa byas pa ste /
translated: The inconceivable action that produces variety is the action by which thorns and so on are made sharp.

original: 'jig rten gyis bsam par gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis bsam par gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is inconceivable because it is beyond the scope of worldly thought.

original: nor bu dang sngas dang sman dang mkhyud spyod dang ldan pa'i las bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
analyzed: nor bu dang sngas dang sman dang mkhyud spyod dang ldan pa'i las bsam gyis mi khyab ste /
translated: The inconceivable action that is endowed with jewels, spells, medicine, and ritual is the action by which the various results of karma are produced.

original: de la nor bu dang ldan pa ni chu shel la sogs pa las chu 'byung ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la nor bu dang ldan pa ni chu shel la sogs pa las chu 'byung ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The power of jewels is such that water comes forth from a water crystal jewel and so on.

original: sngags dang ldan pa ni sngags de dag gis btab pa mi 'tshig pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngags dang ldan pa ni sngags de dag gis btab pa mi 'tshig pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The power of mantras is such that things do not burn when treated with those mantras.

original: sman dang ldan pa ni des zin na mi snang bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sman dang ldan pa ni des zin na mi snang bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The power of medicine is such that one becomes invisible when one ingests it.

original: mkhyud spyad dang ldan pa ni mkhyud spyad de dang des rims nad dang 'bral bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mkhyud spyad dang ldan pa ni mkhyud spyad de dang des rims nad dang 'bral bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The power of spells is such that one becomes free of fever when one is treated with those spells.

original: @53a * // rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyi mthu'i las bsam gyis mi khyab pa ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩde dag gi sems kyi mthus sa chen po g-yo bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: @53a * // rnal 'byor pa thams cad kyi mthu'i las bsam gyis mi khyab pa ji lta bu zhe na / de dag gi sems kyi mthus sa chen po g-yo bar byed pa'am /
translated: How is the power of the karma of all yogis inconceivable?

original: nam mkha' la 'phur ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'phur ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: By the power of their minds, they can shake the great earth or fly through the sky.üîΩHow is the karma of bodhisattvas inconceivable?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang gi las la sogs pas las gang byed pa de bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang gi las la sogs pas las gang byed pa de bsam gyis mi khyab pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The karma of bodhisattvas is inconceivable through their mastery and so on.

original: tshe la dbang ba sa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams tshe'i 'du byed byin gyis brlabs nas ji srid 'dod pa de srid du gnas so //
analyzed: tshe la dbang ba sa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams tshe'i 'du byed byin gyis brlabs nas ji srid 'dod pa de srid du gnas so //
translated: Mastery of life is the bodhisattva's mastery of the life forming force, remaining for as long as one wishes.

original: sems la dbang ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go //
analyzed: sems la dbang ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug go //
translated: Mastery of mind is the mastery of meditative concentration, entering meditative equipoise as one wishes.

original: yo byang la dbang bas ni sems can thams cad la yo byad rin che ba dang dpag tu med pa'i char 'bebs so //
analyzed: yo byang la dbang bas ni sems can thams cad la yo byad rin che ba dang dpag tu med pa'i char 'bebs so //
translated: Mastery of material goods is the mastery of raining down a rain of precious material goods for all sentient beings.

original: las la dbang bas ni khams dang sa dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas dang gnas skabs gzhan na myang bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams gzhan du bsgyur ro //
analyzed: las la dbang bas ni khams dang sa dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas dang gnas skabs gzhan na myang bar 'gyur ba'i las rnams gzhan du bsgyur ro //
translated: Mastery of action is the mastery of transforming actions that are to be experienced in other realms, other levels, other reincarnating beings, other births, and other circumstances.

original: skye ba la dbang bas ni bsam gtan la gnas shing yongs su ma nyams bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams su skye'o //
analyzed: skye ba la dbang bas ni bsam gtan la gnas shing yongs su ma nyams bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams su skye'o //
translated: Mastery of birth is the mastery of being born in the desire realm while remaining in the meditative states without falling away.

original: mos pa la dbang bas ni sa la sogs par chu la sogs par mos so //
analyzed: mos pa la dbang bas ni sa la sogs par chu la sogs par mos so //
translated: Mastery of aspiration is the mastery of aspiring to make earth and so on become water and so forth.üîΩMastery of pristine wisdom is the mastery of manifesting pristine wisdom in all its aspects.

original: smon lam la dbang bas ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par byed pa'i smon lam rgya chen po grangs med pa mngon par sgrub bo //
analyzed: smon lam la dbang bas ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs par byed pa'i smon lam rgya chen po grangs med pa mngon par sgrub bo //
translated: By the power of aspiration, one accomplishes the great aspirations which accomplish the abundant good of self and other according to ones desire.

original: rdzu 'phrul la dbang bas ni sems can rnams 'dun par bya ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dpag tu med pa kun tu ston ston to //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul la dbang bas ni sems can rnams 'dun par bya ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul dpag tu med pa kun tu ston ston to //
translated: By the power of supernormal power, one manifests the miracle of supernormal power in order to inspire sentient beings.

original: ye shes la dbang bas ni chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dang spobs pa rnams kyis rab kyi mthar phyin par 'gro'o //
analyzed: ye shes la dbang bas ni chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dang spobs pa rnams kyis rab kyi mthar phyin par 'gro'o //
translated: By the power of intuition, one goes to the furthest limit of the best of the Dharmas, meanings, expressions, and eloquence.

original: chos la dbang bas ni ci rigs par ji tsam du sems can thams cad la ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs gzhan dang gzhan dag gis mdo la sogs pa'i chos rnam par bzhag nas cig car du sems yongs su tshim par byed nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos la dbang bas ni ci rigs par ji tsam du sems can thams cad la ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs gzhan dang gzhan dag gis mdo la sogs pa'i chos rnam par bzhag nas cig car du sems yongs su tshim par byed nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the power of Dharma, one is able to satisfy the minds of all sentient beings simultaneously by establishing the Dharmas such as the sutras with various collections of names, expressions, and letters, as is appropriate.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bsgrub pa'i 'phrin las bsam gyis mi khyab pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa bsgrub pa'i 'phrin las bsam gyis mi khyab pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it that the activity of accomplishing the deeds of all buddhas is inconceivable?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad lhun gyis grub par gtogs par thugs su chud cing chos kyi dbyings rog cig pa nyid du gyur nas sems can rnams la gang gi tshe dang ji lta bu dang / ji srid du mdzad pa bsgrub par bya ba de thams cad rjes su gnas te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das thams cad lhun gyis grub par gtogs par thugs su chud cing chos kyi dbyings rog cig pa nyid du gyur nas sems can rnams la gang gi tshe dang ji lta bu dang / ji srid du mdzad pa bsgrub par bya ba de thams cad rjes su gnas te /
translated: When all the Bhagavat Buddhas are included in spontaneous accomplishment, and when they become the same in the realm of the Dharma, then all that is to be accomplished for sentient beings, when, how, and for how long, is subsequently present.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul bsam @53b gyis mi khyab bo //üîΩyang srid pa'i bag chags 'jog pa'i byed rgyu zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul bsam @53b gyis mi khyab bo // yang srid pa'i bag chags 'jog pa'i byed rgyu zhes bya ba ni rgyu'o //
translated: Thus, the object of the Buddhas is inconceivable.üîΩThe cause is called the ‚Äúcausal condition for the placement of the latent impressions of existence.‚Äù

original: sems can bag chags bsags pa rnam pa lha la sogs pa'i sems can gyi ris su de'i cha byad dang rang bzhin dang 'dra bar mthun par 'byung ba'i byed rgyu zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sems can bag chags bsags pa rnam pa lha la sogs pa'i sems can gyi ris su de'i cha byad dang rang bzhin dang 'dra bar mthun par 'byung ba'i byed rgyu zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: The ‚Äúcausal condition for the arising of the accumulation of latent impressions of sentient beings‚Äù is the origin.

original: so so rang gi rgyud nges pa dang / 'gro ba dang skye gnas la sogs pa rnams dang mchog tu 'byung bas srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'gro ba'i bar du 'byung ba'i byed rgyu zhes bya ba ni rab tu skye ba'o //
analyzed: so so rang gi rgyud nges pa dang / 'gro ba dang skye gnas la sogs pa rnams dang mchog tu 'byung bas srid pa'i rtse mo'i 'gro ba'i bar du 'byung ba'i byed rgyu zhes bya ba ni rab tu skye ba'o //
translated: The cause of the arising of the aggregates is called the ‚Äúactive cause‚Äù because it is the cause of the arising of the aggregates in one‚Äôs own stream of consciousness, in the various destinies of rebirth, and so on, up to the peak of existence.

original: sngon ma byung ba'i lus gzhan dang gzhan 'thob pa dang / sngon 'thob pa'i lus 'da' ba'i byed rgyu zhes bya ba ni rkyen to //
analyzed: sngon ma byung ba'i lus gzhan dang gzhan 'thob pa dang / sngon 'thob pa'i lus 'da' ba'i byed rgyu zhes bya ba ni rkyen to //
translated: The condition of the aggregates is called the ‚Äúactive cause‚Äù because it is the cause of the acquisition of a different body that has not been acquired before, and the cause of the passing away of the body that has been acquired.

original: 'du byed de dag gi 'jig pa las 'gog pa de dag gzhan zhig yin na ni 'brel ba med de don gzhan du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du byed de dag gi 'jig pa las 'gog pa de dag gzhan zhig yin na ni 'brel ba med de don gzhan du 'gyur ro //
translated: If cessation were something other than the destruction of the aggregates, it would be unrelated to them, and would be a different object.

original: ji ste gzhan ma yin na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /üîΩde'i phyir gnyi ga yang ma yin /
analyzed: ji ste gzhan ma yin na ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur te / de'i phyir gnyi ga yang ma yin /
translated: If it were not other, it would have the characteristic of defilement.üîΩTherefore, it is neither the same nor different.

original: gnyi ga yin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga yin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is neither both nor neither.

original: spros pa ni skabs 'dir tshul bzhin ma yin par sems pa yin te zhes bya ba ni lam ma yin pa dang // rigs ma yin pa dang / thabs ma yin par sems pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: spros pa ni skabs 'dir tshul bzhin ma yin par sems pa yin te zhes bya ba ni lam ma yin pa dang // rigs ma yin pa dang / thabs ma yin par sems pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means thinking about what is not the path, what is not the spiritual lineage, and what is not the method.

original: sems pa yang gzhan las sems par bya ba yang gzhan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems pa yang gzhan las sems par bya ba yang gzhan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the thought is one thing and what is to be thought about is another.

original: sems pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sems pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the thought?

original: zhi ba dang gya nom pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis so ;
analyzed: zhi ba dang gya nom pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis so ;
translated: It is the aspects of calmness, excellence, etc.

original: / rgyan med pa ni shes rab kyi cha las rnam par grol ba rnams kyi yon tan khyad par can rigs pa la sogs pa'i rgyan med pa'i rgyan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / rgyan med pa ni shes rab kyi cha las rnam par grol ba rnams kyi yon tan khyad par can rigs pa la sogs pa'i rgyan med pa'i rgyan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The unadorned stage is the stage of the liberation of wisdom, because it is unadorned by the adornments of special qualities such as reasoning, etc.

original: rnam grangs kyi sa ni ma lus par spangs pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyi sa ni ma lus par spangs pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'o //
translated: The stage of enumeration is the stage of the complete abandonment of all obscurations.

original: lhag ma ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni bshad pa'o //
translated: The rest is as explained above.

original: de'i phyir de'i tshig lhag ma rnams kyis phyir ro zhes brjod de ;
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i tshig lhag ma rnams kyis phyir ro zhes brjod de ;
translated: Therefore, the remaining words of the verse are stated in order to show that.

original: de dag gi de bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi de bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they explain that.

original: ji ltar byas na ma lus par spangs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas na ma lus par spangs she na /
translated: How is it abandoned without remainder?

original: kun nas dkris pa dang bag la nyal spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa dang bag la nyal spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the envelopment and the latent impressions are abandoned.

original: de la nges par spangs pa ni kun nas dkris pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: de la nges par spangs pa ni kun nas dkris pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: Among them, definite abandonment is from the point of view of the abandonment of the envelopments.

original: 'byung ba yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba yongs su spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the occurrence is abandoned.

original: byang bar gyur pa ni bag la nyal spangs pa ste /
analyzed: byang bar gyur pa ni bag la nyal spangs pa ste /
translated: Purification is from the point of view of the abandonment of the latent impressions.

original: rtsa ba med na gtan mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba med na gtan mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when the root is destroyed, they are never produced again.

original: de ni gnyen po mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de ni gnyen po mthong ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyi bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: That is established as twofold by the distinction of the path of insight and the path of cultivation.

original: zad pa dang 'dod chags dang bral zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zad pa dang 'dod chags dang bral zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called exhaustion and separation from desire.

original: de la zad pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyis bral ba nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: de la zad pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyis bral ba nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: Among them, exhaustion is from the point of view of the separation by the path of insight,

original: @54a * // nyon mongs pa'i tshogs cung zad tsam zhig lus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @54a * // nyon mongs pa'i tshogs cung zad tsam zhig lus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a mere residue of the mass of afflictions remains.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis bral ba nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis bral ba nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: Separation from desire is from the point of view of the separation by the path of cultivation,üîΩbecause the mass of afflictions is completely destroyed.

original: de ni sa la 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du 'gyur bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde gnyis kyis bral bar gyur na mi skye ba'i chos nyid du byas pas phyi ma la sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / kun du mi 'byung bas mthong ba'i chos la yid mi bde ba rnam par zhi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni sa la 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid du 'gyur bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro // de gnyis kyis bral bar gyur na mi skye ba'i chos nyid du byas pas phyi ma la sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / kun du mi 'byung bas mthong ba'i chos la yid mi bde ba rnam par zhi bar 'gyur te /
translated: because it is distinguished by being free from attachment to the realm of desire.

original: de'i phyir de'i 'bras bur gyur ba sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis spong pa'i dbang du byas nas 'gog pa dang rnam par zhi bzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'bras bur gyur ba sdug bsngal rnam pa gnyis spong pa'i dbang du byas nas 'gog pa dang rnam par zhi bzhes bya ba smos so //
translated: When one is free from those two, one makes them dharmas that are not subject to arising, and thus, in the future, suffering is stopped and does not occur. Therefore, in terms of the abandonment of the two kinds of suffering that are its results, it is called ‚Äúcessation‚Äù and ‚Äúcomplete tranquility.

original: sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pas yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phung po rnams ni rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa'i dbang du byas nas nub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pas yang dag par bsgrub pa'i phung po rnams ni rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa'i dbang du byas nas nub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: ‚Äù The aggregates that are produced by former karma and the afflictions are called ‚Äúsetting‚Äù in the sense that they naturally perish.

original: de ltar byas na ma lus par spangs pa bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byas na ma lus par spangs pa bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the phrase ‚Äúcompletely abandoned‚Äù refers to the complete abandonment of both the aggregates that are produced by karma and the afflictions and the aggregates that are produced by the afflictions and karma.

original: 'dus ma byas ni 'dus byas las bzlog pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni 'dus byas las bzlog pa ste /
translated: The unconditioned should be understood as the opposite of the conditioned.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa dang gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no origination, destruction, or transformation of a life-force.

original: blta dka' ba ni 'phags pa gcig pu'i shes rab kyi spyan gyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blta dka' ba ni 'phags pa gcig pu'i shes rab kyi spyan gyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is difficult to see, because it is the domain of the wisdom eye of the noble ones alone.

original: g-yo ba med pa ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar mi 'pho bas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i 'gro bar mi 'pho bas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is unmoving, because it is taught that it does not move to the destinies of hell and so on.

original: mi 'dud pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sred pa med pas srid par mi 'dud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dud pa ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sred pa med pas srid par mi 'dud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not bent, because it is not bent toward existence due to the absence of craving for the desire, form, and formless realms.

original: 'chi ba med pa ni 'chi ba'i rten phung po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi ba med pa ni 'chi ba'i rten phung po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is deathless, because there is no life-force that is the basis of death.

original: zag pa med pa ni zag pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa med pa ni zag pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is without outflows, because it is free from the outflows.

original: gnas ni rnam par grol ba'i bde ba'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas ni rnam par grol ba'i bde ba'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a refuge, because it is the basis of the bliss of liberation.

original: gling ni 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho chen po la thang lta bur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gling ni 'khor ba'i rgya mtsho chen po la thang lta bur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is an island, because it is like dry land in the great ocean of cyclic existence.

original: skyob pa ni de thob na skye ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa thams cad las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyob pa ni de thob na skye ba la sogs pa'i gnod pa thams cad las bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a protector, because when one attains it, one is turned away from all the harms of birth and so on.

original: mgon ni de'i bsam pa dang sbyor ba byas pa 'bras bu yod pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pas rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mgon ni de'i bsam pa dang sbyor ba byas pa 'bras bu yod pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin pas rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The protector is the basis of the foundation of the existence of the result of the performance of his thought and performance.

original: dpung gnyen ni 'phags pa'i mchog nyid du 'gro ba'i gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir to /
analyzed: dpung gnyen ni 'phags pa'i mchog nyid du 'gro ba'i gzhi'i gnas yin pa'i phyir to /
translated: The defender is the basis of the foundation of the going of the highest of the noble ones.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa'i thabs la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid 'thob pa'i thabs la dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is the object of the means of attaining arhatship.

original: 'chi 'pho med pa ni ma skyes pas nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho med pa ni ma skyes pas nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is without death and transmigration because it is not subject to deterioration through non-birth.

original: rims nad med pa ni 'dod pas phongs pa'i gdung ba thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rims nad med pa ni 'dod pas phongs pa'i gdung ba thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is without fever because it is free from all the torments of the suffering of desire.

original: yongs su gdung ba @54b med pa ni mya ngan la sogs pa'i yongs su gdung ba thams cad rgyun chad pas bsil ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba @54b med pa ni mya ngan la sogs pa'i yongs su gdung ba thams cad rgyun chad pas bsil ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is without torment because it is cool through the cessation of all the torments of sorrow, etc.

original: bde ba ni na ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba'i 'jigs sba dang bral bas 'phags pa'i gnas pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba ni na ba dang rga ba dang 'chi ba'i 'jigs sba dang bral bas 'phags pa'i gnas pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is happiness because it is the basis of the abode of the noble ones, being free from the fear of sickness, old age, and death.

original: zhi ba ni dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba ni dge ba'i chos thams cad kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Peace is the basis of all virtuous qualities.

original: bde gzhi ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde gzhi ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The basis of happiness is the basis of supramundane happiness.

original: bde bar 'gyur ba ni sbyor ba bde bas de thob par 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde bar 'gyur ba ni sbyor ba bde bas de thob par 'gyur ba'i dmigs pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Happiness is the object that is attained through the happiness of practice.

original: nad med pa ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nad med pa ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Health is the freedom from the obscurations of the afflictions, and so on.

original: mi g-yo ba ni yul gyi spros pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni yul gyi spros pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Immobility is the freedom from all the distractions of the proliferation of objects.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes thams cad dang bral te zhi zhing bde bar gnas pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du shes thams cad dang bral te zhi zhing bde bar gnas pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Nirvana is the object that is the peaceful and happy state that is free from all the discriminations of form, and so on.

original: yang 'gog pa'i bden pa la brtsams nas /
analyzed: yang 'gog pa'i bden pa la brtsams nas /
translated: Moreover, beginning with the truth of cessation,

original: ma skyes pa la sogs pa rnam grangs su gtogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: ma skyes pa la sogs pa rnam grangs su gtogs pa rnams te /
translated: the categories of the unarisen, and so on,

original: sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid las bzlog par rig par bya'o //
translated: should be known as the opposites of the characteristics of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal ni sems can gyi ris de dang der nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed pas skye ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni sems can gyi ris de dang der nyid mtshams sbyor bar byed pas skye ba'o //
translated: Suffering is birth, because it is the linking of a sentient being with a particular class of beings.

original: de'i 'og tu lus yongs su rdzogs par 'phel lo /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lus yongs su rdzogs par 'phel lo /
translated: After that, the body grows to maturity.

original: sdug bsngal de yang sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pas 'phangs te byas pa ni da ltar gyi las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis srid pa gzhan du byed pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de yang sngon gyi las dang nyon mongs pas 'phangs te byas pa ni da ltar gyi las dang nyon mongs pa rnams kyis srid pa gzhan du byed pa'i gzhi'i gnas yin te /
translated: That suffering is created by former karma and afflictions, and is the basis for the creation of other existences by present karma and afflictions.

original: de'i rgyun mi 'chad pa'i tshul gyis yang srid pa'i rgyun skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyun mi 'chad pa'i tshul gyis yang srid pa'i rgyun skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The continuity of existence is born by the uninterrupted continuity of that.

original: de las bzlog pa ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni sdug bsngal 'gog pa 'phags pa'i bden pa ste /
translated: The cessation of suffering is the noble truth of cessation,

original: ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / ma byas pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang / skyes pa med pa dang / go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang / ma byung ba dang / ma byas pa dang / 'dus ma byas pa dang / skyes pa med pa dang / go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: which should be understood as unborn, unoriginated, uncreated, uncompounded, and non-existent, respectively.

original: yang 'gog pa'i bden pa mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang 'gog pa'i bden pa mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the truth of cessation should be known as having four characteristics:

original: 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'byung ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa rnams dang bral ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i mtshan nyid ni 'byung ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa rnams dang bral ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of cessation is from the perspective of being free from the afflictions that are the cause of arising.

original: zhi ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams dang bral ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //üîΩgya nom pa'i mtshan nyid ni nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhi ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyis ma zhi ba'i mtshan nyid nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga rnams dang bral ba'i dbang du byas pa'o // gya nom pa'i mtshan nyid ni nyon mongs pa dang sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: The characteristic of peace is from the perspective of being free from the five appropriated aggregates, which are characterized by the suffering of conditioned existence.

original: bdag nyid gtsang ba dang bde ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'o //üîΩnges par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni rtag pa @55a * //
analyzed: bdag nyid gtsang ba dang bde ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'o // nges par 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ni rtag pa @55a * //
translated: The characteristic of excellence is from the perspective of being pure and blissful by nature, because it is free from afflictions and suffering.

original: dang phan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: dang phan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The characteristic of definite emergence is from the perspective of being permanent and beneficial by nature.

original: yang phyir mi ldog pa dang bde ba'i phyir phan pa dang bde ba dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: yang phyir mi ldog pa dang bde ba'i phyir phan pa dang bde ba dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: It is definite emergence because it is permanent and beneficial, and it is beneficial because it is blissful.

original: lam gyi bden pa ni gang gis sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ni gang gis sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The truth of the path is that by which one fully understands the truth of suffering and so on.

original: bden pa rnams la 'di'i bya ba'i skabs kyis mtshan nyid bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa rnams la 'di'i bya ba'i skabs kyis mtshan nyid bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The characteristic of the truth of the path should be understood as taught in the context of its function with regard to the truths.

original: lam rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba ni rab tu dbye ba lnga'i skabs kyi'o //
analyzed: lam rnam pa lnga zhes bya ba ni rab tu dbye ba lnga'i skabs kyi'o //
translated: The five aspects of the path are in the context of the five divisions.

original: rab tu dbye ba 'di yang lam gyi bden pa 'khor dang bcas pa'i skabs kyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba 'di yang lam gyi bden pa 'khor dang bcas pa'i skabs kyis rig par bya'o //
translated: This division should be understood in the context of the truth of the path together with its retinue.

original: de la tshogs kyi lam ni tshul khrims la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la tshogs kyi lam ni tshul khrims la sogs pa ste /
translated: The path of accumulation is morality, etc.

original: de yongs su rdzogs pas dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa'i go rims kyis bden pa mthong bar bya ba dang / de la sgrib pa spangs bar bya ba'i phyir sems kyi rgyud 'os su gyur pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: de yongs su rdzogs pas dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa'i go rims kyis bden pa mthong bar bya ba dang / de la sgrib pa spangs bar bya ba'i phyir sems kyi rgyud 'os su gyur pa 'thob bo //
translated: By perfecting it, one obtains a mental continuum fit for the stages of heat, etc., in order to see the truths and to abandon the obscurations with regard to them.

original: gang yang rgyur gyur pa'i dge ba gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'gyod pa med pa la sogs par rig par bya'o//
analyzed: gang yang rgyur gyur pa'i dge ba gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'gyod pa med pa la sogs par rig par bya'o//
translated: And the other virtues that are causes should be known as non-remorse, etc.

original: dro bar gyur pa ni so so rang gis bden pa rnams la snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin shes rab dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos mdo sde la sogs
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa ni so so rang gis bden pa rnams la snang ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin shes rab dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos mdo sde la sogs
translated: The state of heat is the meditative concentration and wisdom, together with their associated factors, that obtain the light of the truths for oneself.

original: pa yid kyis brjod pa'i sgo nas don snang bar gyur pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni dro bar gyur par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: pa yid kyis brjod pa'i sgo nas don snang bar gyur pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni dro bar gyur par rig par bya'o //
translated: The state of heat should be understood as the calm abiding and insight that are the mental expression of the Dharma, such as the scriptures, in terms of the truths, by means of the mind that is equipoised.

original: de 'phel pa ni rtse mo ste /
analyzed: de 'phel pa ni rtse mo ste /
translated: The state of summit is the increase of that.

original: de'i gang na rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gang na rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is so called because it is firmly fixed in that.

original: bzod pa ni phyogs gcig la zhugs pa dang rjes su song ba'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzod pa ni phyogs gcig la zhugs pa dang rjes su song ba'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la /
translated: The state of acceptance is the meditative concentration that is engaged in one part and that is followed.

original: ji ltar na phyogs gcig la zhugs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na phyogs gcig la zhugs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it engaged in one part?

original: gcig tu gzung ba med par bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu gzung ba med par bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one accepts that there is no apprehension of a unity.

original: ji ltar na phyogs gcig gi rjes su song ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na phyogs gcig gi rjes su song ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it followed in one part?

original: 'dzin pa med par rtog pa'i rjes su mthun par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa med par rtog pa'i rjes su mthun par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is in conformity with the realization that there is no subject.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ni gang gi 'og tu thog mar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ni gang gi 'og tu thog mar 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mo //
translated: The supreme mundane experience is that which is immediately followed by the supramundane path for the first time.

original: mthong ba'i lam ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi 'og gi rnam par mi rtog pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi 'og gi rnam par mi rtog pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The path of vision should be known as the non-conceptual state immediately after the supreme mundane experience, and as having the nature of calm abiding and penetrating insight.

original: dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa mnyam pas mnyam par shes pa'ang de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni des gzungs ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i de @55b bzhin nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba dang dmigs par byed pa mnyam pas mnyam par shes pa'ang de bzhin te zhes bya ba ni des gzungs ba dang 'dzin pa med pa'i de @55b bzhin nyid rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The knowledge of the sameness of the apprehended object and apprehending subject is also like that, because it penetrates thatness, which is devoid of the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: so so rang la sems can gyi brda dang chos kyi brda gsal ba dang / thams cad du gnyi ga'i brda gsal pa dmigs pa'i chos shes pa 'ang de yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: so so rang la sems can gyi brda dang chos kyi brda gsal ba dang / thams cad du gnyi ga'i brda gsal pa dmigs pa'i chos shes pa 'ang de yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is also the knowledge of the object as the basis of the conventional expression of sentient beings and the conventional expression of the dharmas, individually and collectively.

original: sems can gyi brda so so rang gis gsal ba la dmigs pa'i chos shes pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: sems can gyi brda so so rang gis gsal ba la dmigs pa'i chos shes pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of dharmas that has as its object the individual clear expression of the words of sentient beings?

original: des rang gi rgyud la bdag gi mtshan mar rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des rang gi rgyud la bdag gi mtshan mar rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not conceive the signs of self in its own continuum.

original: so so rang la chos kyi brda gsal ba la dmigs pa'i chos shes pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: so so rang la chos kyi brda gsal ba la dmigs pa'i chos shes pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of dharmas that has as its object the clear expression of the words of dharmas for oneself?

original: des rang gi rgyud nyid la gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan mar rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des rang gi rgyud nyid la gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan mar rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not conceive the signs of form and so on in its own continuum.

original: thams cad du gnyi ga'i brda gsal ba la dmigs pa'i chos shes pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad du gnyi ga'i brda gsal ba la dmigs pa'i chos shes pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the knowledge of dharmas that has as its object the clear expression of both for all?

original: thams cad du bye brag med par bdag dang chos kyi mtshan ma la rnams par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad du bye brag med par bdag dang chos kyi mtshan ma la rnams par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not conceive the signs of self and dharmas in all without distinction.

original: yang mthong ba'i lam la rab tu dbye ba na bden pa rnams pa bcu drug ste /
analyzed: yang mthong ba'i lam la rab tu dbye ba na bden pa rnams pa bcu drug ste /
translated: Moreover, when the path of seeing is divided, there are sixteen aspects of the four truths:

original: chos dang rjes su rtog pa la bzod pa dang shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: chos dang rjes su rtog pa la bzod pa dang shes pa rnams so //
translated: the acceptances and the knowledges of phenomena and subsequent realization.

original: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni sbyor ba'i lam la /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa ni sbyor ba'i lam la /
translated: The perseverance for the knowledge of the teaching on suffering is the path of preparation.

original: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i mdo la sogs pa'i chos la rnam par dpyod pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i mdo la sogs pa'i chos la rnam par dpyod pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: It is the knowledge that analyzes the Dharma of s≈´tra and so on in terms of the truth of suffering.

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pas bsdus pa'i dbang du byas nas rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la de'i de bzhin nyid mngon sum du 'gyur pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab yang dag par lta ba'i rang bzhin 'byung ste /
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pas bsdus pa'i dbang du byas nas rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la de'i de bzhin nyid mngon sum du 'gyur pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab yang dag par lta ba'i rang bzhin 'byung ste /
translated: In terms of being subsumed by proper mental contemplation, it is the supramundane wisdom that is the nature of right view that directly perceives the suchness of the truth of suffering that exists in one‚Äôs continuum.

original: des sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba khams gsum pa'i bag la nyal nye shu rtsa brgyad rab tu spang ngo //
analyzed: des sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba khams gsum pa'i bag la nyal nye shu rtsa brgyad rab tu spang ngo //
translated: It completely abandons the twenty-eight latent states of the three realms that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: de bas na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: de bas na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: Therefore it is called the perseverance for the knowledge of the teaching on suffering.

original: / bzod pa des sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir gnas gyur nas de ma thag tu shes pa gang gi gnas gyur ba de myong ba de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa zhe bya'o //
analyzed: / bzod pa des sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir gnas gyur nas de ma thag tu shes pa gang gi gnas gyur ba de myong ba de ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa zhe bya'o //
translated: By that patience, having transformed the basis for the purpose of abandoning the afflictions to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, the subsequent knowledge that experiences the transformation of that basis is called the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering.

original: dang po'i bzod pa dang shes pa 'di gnyis ni slong ba dang slob pa'i 'phags pa'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: dang po'i bzod pa dang shes pa 'di gnyis ni slong ba dang slob pa'i 'phags pa'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu yin te /
translated: These first two, patience and knowledge, are the cause of all the noble dharmas of learners and those beyond learning,

original: de las de dag yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las de dag yang dag par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the source of those dharmas.üîΩTherefore, these two are the cause of all noble dharmas.

original: de'i phyir 'di gnyis ni 'phags pa'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu'o zhes de la dmigs nas so so rang la mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni sdug bsngal la rjes su rtog par shes @56a * //üîΩpa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di gnyis ni 'phags pa'i chos thams cad kyi rgyu'o zhes de la dmigs nas so so rang la mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i zag pa med pa'i shes rab ni sdug bsngal la rjes su rtog par shes @56a * // pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: The uncontaminated wisdom that directly realizes that, observing that, is the subsequent patience for the knowledge of dharmas with regard to suffering.

original: rjes su rtog par shes pa'i bzod pa dang de shes pa gang gis myong ba de ni rjes su rtog pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su rtog par shes pa'i bzod pa dang de shes pa gang gis myong ba de ni rjes su rtog pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The subsequent knowledge of dharmas and the knowledge that experiences that are called the subsequent knowledge of dharmas.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi yul ni gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi yul ni gnyis te /
translated: The object of the supramundane path is twofold:

original: de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: reality and correct direct intuition.

original: de la chos shes pa'i phyogs kyi lam gyi yul ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de la chos shes pa'i phyogs kyi lam gyi yul ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The object of the path that is the side of the knowledge of reality is reality.

original: rjes su rtog pa'i shes pa'i phyogs kyi yul ni yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: rjes su rtog pa'i shes pa'i phyogs kyi yul ni yang dag pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The object of the path that is the side of subsequent knowledge is correct direct intuition.üîΩTherefore, it is said that:

original: de'i phyir 'di skad ces bya ste chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyis ni gzung ba rtogs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di skad ces bya ste chos shes pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyis ni gzung ba rtogs so //
translated: by means of the receptivities and knowledges of the knowledge of reality, one realizes the apprehended;

original: rjes su rtog pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyis ni 'dzin so  rtogs so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su rtog pa'i bzod pa dang shes pa rnams kyis ni 'dzin so  rtogs so zhes bya'o //
translated: by means of the receptivities and knowledges of subsequent knowledge, one realizes the apprehending.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i gang zag drug bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang mtshan ma med pa la gnas pa'i gang zag drug bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Lord has declared six persons who abide in signlessness.

original: de ni bzod pa dang shes pa de dag la gnas par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni bzod pa dang shes pa de dag la gnas par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should know that they abide in those receptivities and knowledges,

original: mtshan ma thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not apprehend any signs.

original: bzod pa dang shes pas bsdus pa sems kyi skad cig bcu drug po 'di dag ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: bzod pa dang shes pas bsdus pa sems kyi skad cig bcu drug po 'di dag ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
translated: These sixteen moments of mind, which are included in the path of insight, are the path of insight.

original: de dag gis sngon ma mthong ba'i 'phags pa'i bden pa re re la yang rnam pa bzhi bzhir mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis sngon ma mthong ba'i 'phags pa'i bden pa re re la yang rnam pa bzhi bzhir mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, by means of them, one sees each of the noble truths, which were not seen before, in four moments.

original: 'dir dngos po ma byung ba byung ba tsam la sems kyi skad cig tu rig par bya ba ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir dngos po ma byung ba byung ba tsam la sems kyi skad cig tu rig par bya ba ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, one should not understand a moment of mind to be the mere occurrence of an entity that did not exist before.

original: ji tsam du shes bya la shes pa 'byung ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba la bya ste /
analyzed: ji tsam du shes bya la shes pa 'byung ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba la bya ste /
translated: Rather, it is the completion of the occurrence of the knowledge of an object of knowledge.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: sdug bsngal ni yongs su shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems kyi skad cig gcig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni yongs su shes par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sems kyi skad cig gcig go //
translated: the statement, ‚ÄúSuffering is to be fully known,‚Äù is one moment of mind.

original: kun 'byung ni spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //üîΩgang mthong ba'i lam las brtsams te /
analyzed: kun 'byung ni spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin no // gang mthong ba'i lam las brtsams te /
translated: The same is true for the statements, ‚ÄúThe origin is to be abandoned,‚Äù and so on.

original: rgya cher rnam par spros pa de thams cad ni rnam par gzhag pa tsam du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rgya cher rnam par spros pa de thams cad ni rnam par gzhag pa tsam du rig par bya ste /
translated: All of this extensive elaboration that is based on the path of insight should be understood as a mere presentation.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnas skabs ni so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnas skabs ni so so rang gis rig par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The supramundane state is to be known by each one for himself.

original: lam gyi bden pa thams cad ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa thams cad ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: All the truths of the path should be known as fourfold:

original: rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / myong ba dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / myong ba dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: establishment, investigation, experience, and completion.

original: de la rnam par gzhag pa ni nyan thos la sogs pas ji ltar rang gi khong du chud pa mthar phyin nas /
analyzed: de la rnam par gzhag pa ni nyan thos la sogs pas ji ltar rang gi khong du chud pa mthar phyin nas /
translated: Among them, establishment is that, having completed the understanding of the disciples and so on,

original: de'i rjes la thob pa'i shes pas gzhan dag la go bar bya ba'i phyir ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams kyis lam gyi bden pa rnam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la thob pa'i shes pas gzhan dag la go bar bya ba'i phyir ming dang tshig dang yi ge'i tshogs rnams kyis lam gyi bden pa rnam par 'jog ste /
translated: the path truth is established by the groups of names, phrases, and letters, through the knowledge subsequent to that, in order to make others understand.

original: bden pa rnams la bzod pa @56b dang shes pa ni 'di lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa rnams la bzod pa @56b dang shes pa ni 'di lta bu'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is said, The acceptance and knowledge of the truths are like this.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni mngon par rtogs pa la zhugs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i shes pas ji ltar rnam par bzhag pa bzhin du rnam par rtog cing goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni mngon par rtogs pa la zhugs pa'i 'jig rten pa'i shes pas ji ltar rnam par bzhag pa bzhin du rnam par rtog cing goms par byed pa'o //
translated: Conceptualization is the conceptualization and familiarization with the world of the path of insight as it is presented by the mundane knowledge that has entered into realization.

original: myong ba ni de ltar goms par byed pa na mthong ba'i lam zhes brjod pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa spros pa med pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pas dang po so sor rang gis myong ba'o //
analyzed: myong ba ni de ltar goms par byed pa na mthong ba'i lam zhes brjod pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa spros pa med pa'i gnas skabs gang yin pas dang po so sor rang gis myong ba'o //
translated: Experience is the first personal experience of the supramundane state free of elaboration which is called the path of insight, when one is familiarizing oneself in that way.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa ni de'i 'og tu gnas gyur pa yongs su rdzogs nas thob pa mthar phyin pa'i bar du 'thob pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa ni de'i 'og tu gnas gyur pa yongs su rdzogs nas thob pa mthar phyin pa'i bar du 'thob pa'o //
translated: Completion is the attainment of the culmination of attainment after the transformation is completed.

original: thob pa mthar phyin pa de dag ni de'i rjes la thob pa'i shes pas lam gyi bden pa rnam par 'jog go //üîΩde ltar na rnam pa 'di bzhi ni lam gyi 'khor lo ste /
analyzed: thob pa mthar phyin pa de dag ni de'i rjes la thob pa'i shes pas lam gyi bden pa rnam par 'jog go // de ltar na rnam pa 'di bzhi ni lam gyi 'khor lo ste /
translated: Those who have completed the attainment of the path of insight subsequently attain the knowledge of the truth of the path.

original: yang dang yang gzhan dang gzhan la brten nas 'jug par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang gzhan dang gzhan la brten nas 'jug par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, these four aspects are the wheel of the path, which should be understood as operating in dependence on other and other persons again and again.üîΩThe wheel of the Dharma is fourfold, having the nature of the four noble truths.

original: chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba skyes so zhes bya ba gang gsungs pa de ni mthong ba'i lam gyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ste zhes bya ba de ni thog ma kho nar bden pa rnams la 'phags pa'i shes
analyzed: chos rnams la chos kyi mig rdul med cing dri ma dang bral ba skyes so zhes bya ba gang gsungs pa de ni mthong ba'i lam gyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ste zhes bya ba de ni thog ma kho nar bden pa rnams la 'phags pa'i shes
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe eye of truth with respect to phenomena, free from dust and impurity, has arisen‚Äù is made from the perspective of the path of seeing.

original: rab kyi spyan gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab kyi spyan gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the nature of the eye of arya wisdom with respect to the truths.

original: de la chos la bzod pa rnams kyis ni rdul med de /
analyzed: de la chos la bzod pa rnams kyis ni rdul med de /
translated: With respect to that, the acceptances of phenomena are free from dust.

original: de dag gis nyon mongs pa'i rdul spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis nyon mongs pa'i rdul spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they abandon the dust of affliction.

original: chos shes pa rnam ba ni dri ma dang bral ste /
analyzed: chos shes pa rnam ba ni dri ma dang bral ste /
translated: The knowledges of phenomena are free from impurity.

original: de dag ni de'i sgrib pa'i dri ma spangs pa'i gnas su skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni de'i sgrib pa'i dri ma spangs pa'i gnas su skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are born in the state of having abandoned the impurity of obscuration.

original: yang bzod pa dang shes pa'i gnas skabs 'di gnyis ni go rims bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang spangs pa'i lam gyi rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas ba ste /
analyzed: yang bzod pa dang shes pa'i gnas skabs 'di gnyis ni go rims bzhin du yongs su shes pa dang spangs pa'i lam gyi rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas ba ste /
translated: Moreover, these two states of acceptance and knowledge are, respectively, from the perspective of the purity of the path of complete knowledge and abandonment.

original: rdul med pa dang dri ma dang bral bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rdul med pa dang dri ma dang bral bar rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it is without dust and free from defilements.

original: chos mthong ba zhes pa la sogs pa yang mthong pa'i lam nyid kyi dbang du byas par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: chos mthong ba zhes pa la sogs pa yang mthong pa'i lam nyid kyi dbang du byas par rig par bya ste /
translated: The seeing of the Dharma and so on are also to be understood in terms of the path of seeing,

original: 'dul ba rnams bden pa mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i 'og tu gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dul ba rnams bden pa mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i 'og tu gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Vinaya mentions the clear realization of the truths immediately after the seeing of the Dharma.

original: de la chos la bzod pa rnams kyis ni chos mthong ste de dag gis de kho na rtogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩchos shes pa rnams kyis chos thob ste /
analyzed: de la chos la bzod pa rnams kyis ni chos mthong ste de dag gis de kho na rtogs pa'i phyir ro // chos shes pa rnams kyis chos thob ste /
translated: The acceptances of the Dharma see the Dharma because they realize thatness.

original: chos shes pa rnams kyi gnas gyur pa mngon sum du thob par byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrjes su rtog pa'i bzod pa rnams kyis chos rig ste /
analyzed: chos shes pa rnams kyi gnas gyur pa mngon sum du thob par byed pa'i phyir ro // rjes su rtog pa'i bzod pa rnams kyis chos rig ste /
translated: The knowers of the Dharma obtain the Dharma because they cause the transformation of the basis of the knowers of the Dharma to be directly obtained.

original: de dag gis 'di ni 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu'o zhes de gnyis rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis 'di ni 'phags pa'i chos kyi rgyu'o zhes de gnyis rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The subsequent acceptances know the Dharma because they know that the Dharma is the cause of the ƒÅrya Dharmas.

original: rjes su rtog pa'i shes pa rnams kyis @57a * //
analyzed: rjes su rtog pa'i shes pa rnams kyis @57a * //
translated: The subsequent knowers

original: chos rtogs te /
analyzed: chos rtogs te /
translated: realize the Dharma because they realize the result of the Dharma.

original: de dag gis shes bya ji snyed pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis shes bya ji snyed pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the complete knowledge of all that is to be known.

original: bzod pa dang shes pa thams cad kyis som nyi las brgal te /
analyzed: bzod pa dang shes pa thams cad kyis som nyi las brgal te /
translated: By all the patiences and knowledges, one goes beyond doubt,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu thob pas yun ring po nas 'dod pa rang gis thob pa la the tshom med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi 'bras bu thob pas yun ring po nas 'dod pa rang gis thob pa la the tshom med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one has attained the result of the supramundane path and is free from doubt about the self-gained goal that has been sought for a long time.

original: thams cad kyi gzhan gyis thob pa la the tshom las brgal te /
analyzed: thams cad kyi gzhan gyis thob pa la the tshom las brgal te /
translated: By all the patiences and knowledges, one goes beyond doubt about the attainment of others,

original: de'i dus na gzhan dag gis kyang khyad par thob pa la yid gnyis za ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dus na gzhan dag gis kyang khyad par thob pa la yid gnyis za ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time, one is free from doubt about the special attainment of others.

original: lam bsgom pa la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa ni gzhan la lung mnos pa med par yang bdag nyid kyis mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam bsgom pa la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa ni gzhan la lung mnos pa med par yang bdag nyid kyis mkhas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One is not dependent on others for the cultivation of the path, because one is wise by oneself without having to receive instruction from others.

original: gzhan gyis mi bkri pa ni shes nas dang pa thob pas gzhan mu stegs can rnams kyis tshe rabs gzhan la yang ston pa'i bstan pa las mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi bkri pa ni shes nas dang pa thob pas gzhan mu stegs can rnams kyis tshe rabs gzhan la yang ston pa'i bstan pa las mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One is not led by others, because one has attained the faith that comes from knowledge and cannot be led away from the teaching of the Master by other tirthikas even in another life.

original: chos rnams la 'jigs pa thob pa ni thob pa las brtsams nas yongs su dri ba'i chos rnams dang lung bstan pa'i chos rnams la sdig pa 'dod pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal can bzhin du sems zhum pa med pa'i phyir ro /üîΩ// / bam po drug pa /
analyzed: chos rnams la 'jigs pa thob pa ni thob pa las brtsams nas yongs su dri ba'i chos rnams dang lung bstan pa'i chos rnams la sdig pa 'dod pa mngon pa'i nga rgyal can bzhin du sems zhum pa med pa'i phyir ro / // / bam po drug pa /
translated: The acquisition of fearlessness with regard to the teachings is the absence of a timid mind, like that of a guilty criminal, with regard to the teachings that are the subject of questions and the teachings that are the subject of answers, on the basis of the acquisition.

original: bsgom pa'i lam ni 'phags pa nyan thos bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ni 'phags pa nyan thos bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i'o //
translated: The path of cultivation is that of the noble disciples who have realized the truths.

original: de'i gong du gyur pa ni kun tu sbyor ba lhag ma spangs pa'i phyir zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i gong du gyur pa ni kun tu sbyor ba lhag ma spangs pa'i phyir zhugs pa ste /
translated: The path that is higher than that is the path of application for the sake of abandoning the remaining fetters.

original: gang 'jig rten pa la sogs pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten pa la sogs pa'i lam mo //
translated: It is the mundane path, etc.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i lam ni bsam gtan rnams dang gzugs med pa rnams so //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i lam ni bsam gtan rnams dang gzugs med pa rnams so //
translated: The mundane path is the meditative development of the immeasurables and the formless-world.

original: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa de dag kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par dag pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa de dag kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang / rnam par gzhag pa dang / rnam par dag pas rig par bya'o //
translated: These meditative absorptions and the formless-world should be known in terms of: defilement, purification, their establishment and their complete purity.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How so in terms of defilement?

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba bzhi po sred pa dang lta ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i rtsa ba bzhi po sred pa dang lta ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa ste /
translated: The four neutral roots are craving, view, pride, and ignorance.

original: de dag gis sems kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur ba rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i bsam gtan gyi sgo nas gzugs dang gzugs med na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad bsgribs pa'i lung du mi ston par 'gyur ba'i phyir
analyzed: de dag gis sems kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur ba rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i bsam gtan gyi sgo nas gzugs dang gzugs med na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad bsgribs pa'i lung du mi ston par 'gyur ba'i phyir
translated: Because all afflicted meditative states of those whose minds are afflicted by those roots are obscured neutral states in the form and formless realms, since they are afflicted by all afflictions and branch afflictions.

original: ro // de la sred pas ni ro myang ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs te /
analyzed: ro // de la sred pas ni ro myang ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs te /
translated: Craving afflicts them through the affliction of relishing taste,

original: shin tu sbyangs ba'i bde ba'i ro myong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs ba'i bde ba'i ro myong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it relishes the taste of the bliss of pliancy.

original: lta bas ni lta ba shas che ba'i bsam @57b gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs te /
analyzed: lta bas ni lta ba shas che ba'i bsam @57b gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs te /
translated: View afflicts them through the meditative stability of the predominance of view,

original: bsam gtan la brten nas sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa la sogs pa'i lta ba kun nas slong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas sngon gyi mtha' la rtog pa la sogs pa'i lta ba kun nas slong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it generates views such as the investigation of the prior limit in dependence on meditative stability.üîΩPride afflicts them through the pride of thinking, ‚ÄúI have attained meditative stability.‚Äù

original: nga rgyal gyis ni nga rgyal gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs te /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis ni nga rgyal gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs te /
translated: Arrogance afflicts those who are devoted to meditation, since they are dominated by pride.

original: des khyad par du thob na khengs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des khyad par du thob na khengs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For, when they attain a special state, they become conceited.

original: ma rig pa ni the tshom gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni the tshom gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Ignorance afflicts those who are devoted to meditation, since they are dominated by doubt.

original: de kho na ma gtogs pas thar pa 'dod pa khyad par de thob pa la thar pa yin nam ma yin snyam du the tshom skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na ma gtogs pas thar pa 'dod pa khyad par de thob pa la thar pa yin nam ma yin snyam du the tshom skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For, when they attain that special state, they doubt whether it is liberation or not, since they do not know what liberation is.

original: rnam par byang ba ji lta bu zhe na dag pa'i bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa 'jig rten pa rnams kyang dge ba'i phyir kun nas dkris pa'i dri ma dang bral bas na rnam par byang ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ji lta bu zhe na dag pa'i bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa 'jig rten pa rnams kyang dge ba'i phyir kun nas dkris pa'i dri ma dang bral bas na rnam par byang ba zhes bya'o //
translated: How is there purification? The pure meditations and formless attainments are called purification, since they are wholesome and free from the stain of the entanglements.

original: rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu zhe na bsam gtan rnams ni yan lag dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang tshad dang / ming du gdags pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhir rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pas ji lta bu zhe na bsam gtan rnams ni yan lag dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang tshad dang / ming du gdags pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhir rnam par gzhag go //
translated: How are they established? The absorptions are established as fourfold by way of the distinctions of members, meditative attainment, measure, and nominal designation.

original: gzugs med pa rnams ni yan lag ma gtogs pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams ni yan lag ma gtogs pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The formless states are established as threefold, excluding the members.

original: gang gi dbang du byas nas chos gzhan dag kyang yod bzhin du rtog pa la sogs pa kho na bsam gtan rnams la yan lag nyid du rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: gang gi dbang du byas nas chos gzhan dag kyang yod bzhin du rtog pa la sogs pa kho na bsam gtan rnams la yan lag nyid du rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: With respect to what are the members of the absorptions established as investigation and so on, even though other phenomena exist?

original: de tsam gyis gnyen po dang / phan yon dang / de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis gnyen po dang / phan yon dang / de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi yan lag yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the members of antidotes, benefits, and the basis of both are complete in just those.

original: bsam gtan dang po la rtog pa dang / dpyod pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la rtog pa dang / dpyod pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
translated: In the first absorption, investigation and analysis are the members of antidotes.

original: de gnyis kyis 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis 'dod pa dang / gnod sems dang / 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those two abandon the conceptions of desire, malice, and harm.

original: dga' ba dang bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag ste /
translated: Joy and pleasure are the benefit branch.

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis kyis gnyen po byas pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de las dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa gnyis kyis gnyen po byas pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de las dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one obtains the joy and pleasure born of seclusion from the unfavorable side that is opposed to both applied thought and sustained thought, which are the antidote.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi yan lag ste /
translated: One-pointedness of mind is the branch that is the basis of both of them,

original: ting nge 'dzin la brten pa'i stobs kyis rtog pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la brten pa'i stobs kyis rtog pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one engages in applied thought, etc. by the power of concentration.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa la nang rab tu dang ba ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gnyis pa la nang rab tu dang ba ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
translated: In the same way, in the second meditative concentration, inner clarity is the branch that is the antidote,

original: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i gnyen po byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i gnyen po byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it acts as the antidote to applied thought and sustained thought.

original: dga' ba dang bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni yan lag lhag ma gnyis la snga ma bzhin no //üîΩbsam gtan @58a * //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni yan lag lhag ma gnyis la snga ma bzhin no // bsam gtan @58a * //
translated: Joy, pleasure, and one-pointedness of mind are the remaining two branches, as before.

original: gsum pa la btang snyoms dang ngan pa dang / shes bzhin ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: gsum pa la btang snyoms dang ngan pa dang / shes bzhin ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
translated: In the third meditative concentration, equanimity, the absence of applied thought and sustained thought, and mindfulness and introspection are the branch that is the antidote,üîΩbecause they are the antidotes to the agitation of joy.

original: de dag dga' ba'i gnyen po byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dga' ba'i gnyen po byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the antidote to joy.

original: bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni yan lag lhag ma gnyis dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: bde ba dang sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni yan lag lhag ma gnyis dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: The remaining two members are respectively the members of pleasure and of one-pointedness of mind.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang dran pa yongs su dag pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang dran pa yongs su dag pa ni gnyen po'i yan lag ste /
translated: In the fourth meditation, complete purity of equanimity and complete purity of mindfulness are the member of antidote,

original: de gnyis bde ba'i gnyen po byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis bde ba'i gnyen po byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those two are the antidote to pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa ni phan yon gyi yan lag go //
translated: The member of benefit is the neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant feeling.

original: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi yan lag go ;
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa nyid ni de gnyi ga'i gnas kyi yan lag go ;
translated: The member of basis is the one-pointedness of mind of both.

original: / ji ltar na bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa bdun du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: / ji ltar na bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa bdun du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How are there seven attentions in the first meditation?

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pa gang gi 'dod pa rnams la nyes dmigs la sogs par lta bas rags pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu rig pa ste /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pa gang gi 'dod pa rnams la nyes dmigs la sogs par lta bas rags pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu rig pa ste /
translated: The attention of the stage of meditative equipoise is the thorough knowledge of the characteristics of coarseness by seeing the faults of the desire realm and so on.

original: de med pa'i phyir bsam gtan dang po la zhi ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir bsam gtan dang po la zhi ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Since that does not exist, the first meditation is characterized as peaceful.

original: 'di ni mtshan nyid rab tu rig pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshan nyid rab tu rig pa'i yid la byed pa zhes bya ste /
translated: This is called the attention of the knowledge of characteristics.

original: de ni thos pa dang sems pa dang 'dres par rig par bya'o //üîΩde'i 'og tu thos pa dang sems pa las 'das nas gcig tu bsgom pa'i rnam pas de'i rags pa dang zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshan ma la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom zhing yang ji ltar yongs su bsal ba rags pa dang zhi ba nyid
analyzed: de ni thos pa dang sems pa dang 'dres par rig par bya'o // de'i 'og tu thos pa dang sems pa las 'das nas gcig tu bsgom pa'i rnam pas de'i rags pa dang zhi ba'i mtshan nyid kyis mtshan ma la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom zhing yang ji ltar yongs su bsal ba rags pa dang zhi ba nyid
translated: It should be understood as mixed with hearing and reflection.

original: du mos te /
analyzed: du mos te /
translated: After that, having gone beyond hearing and reflection, by the aspect of being exclusively meditation, he cultivates ≈õamatha and vipa≈õyanƒÅ that take the characteristics of coarseness and calmness as their object, and again aspires to coarseness and calmness as they have been discerned.

original: 'di ni mos pa las byung ba zhes ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mos pa las byung ba zhes ba'o //
translated: This is called arisen from belief.

original: de goms pas thog ma kho nar spong ba'i lam dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa ni rab tu dben pa las byung ba ste ;
analyzed: de goms pas thog ma kho nar spong ba'i lam dang ldan pa'i yid la byed pa ni rab tu dben pa las byung ba ste ;
translated: By cultivating that, the attention that possesses the path of abandonment is arisen from separation,

original: des nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chen po spangs pa dang / de'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chen po spangs pa dang / de'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it abandons the great aspect of affliction and is free from the negative tendencies of that class.

original: rnal 'byor ba de de'i 'og tu spong ba la dga' bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba de de'i 'og tu spong ba la dga' bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: After that, the yogi becomes delighted in abandoning and

original: spong ba la phan yon du lta ste /üîΩrab tu dben pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba chung du reg nas dus dus su dang bar 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa ji tsam du rmugs pa dang gnyid dang rgod pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir rab tu dga' bar byed par 'di ni dga' ba sdud
analyzed: spong ba la phan yon du lta ste / rab tu dben pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba chung du reg nas dus dus su dang bar 'gyur ba'i yid la byed pa ji tsam du rmugs pa dang gnyid dang rgod pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir rab tu dga' bar byed par 'di ni dga' ba sdud
translated: sees the benefits of abandoning.

original: pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Having touched the lesser delight and pleasure of solitude, from time to time he delights in the mental attention that is refreshing, to the extent that he is free from sluggishness, sleep, and excitement. This is called delighting in gathering.

original: de ltar legs par zhugs pa de dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bas brten pa'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa @58b kun nas mi 'byung bas /
analyzed: de ltar legs par zhugs pa de dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor bas brten pa'i phyir 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa @58b kun nas mi 'byung bas /
translated: Thus, since one who has entered well is supported by application to the side of virtue, the entanglements of afflictions of the desire realm do not arise.

original: de spangs sam ma spangs pa khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de spangs sam ma spangs pa khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to understand whether they are abandoned or not abandoned,

original: de 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i sdug pa'i mchan ma yid la byed pas so sor rtog pa ni dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de 'byung ba dang mthun pa'i sdug pa'i mchan ma yid la byed pas so sor rtog pa ni dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
translated: the mental attention that discerns by means of mental attention to the signs of beauty that are conducive to their arising is the mental attention of investigation.

original: des de ltar dpyad nas gnyen po bsgoms pas dus de srid cig pa'i tshul gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan dang po la sbyor ba'i mthar thug pa'i gnyen po yid la byed pa ni sbyor ba'i mtha'o
analyzed: des de ltar dpyad nas gnyen po bsgoms pas dus de srid cig pa'i tshul gyis 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan dang po la sbyor ba'i mthar thug pa'i gnyen po yid la byed pa ni sbyor ba'i mtha'o
translated: The attention that is the antidote to the final stage of preparation is the antidote that is applied to the first meditative absorption in order to abandon all the afflictions that are active in the desire realm.

original: // de'i 'og tu dngos gzhi'i bsam gtan dang por gyur ba ni sbyor ba'i mtha'i 'bras bu yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: // de'i 'og tu dngos gzhi'i bsam gtan dang por gyur ba ni sbyor ba'i mtha'i 'bras bu yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The attention that is the result of the final stage of preparation is the actual first meditative absorption that occurs after the final stage of preparation.

original: de la mtshan nyid rab tu rig pas ni spang bar bya ba dang / thob par bya ba legs par yongs su shes nas spang ba dang thob par bya ba'i phyir sems 'jog go //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid rab tu rig pas ni spang bar bya ba dang / thob par bya ba legs par yongs su shes nas spang ba dang thob par bya ba'i phyir sems 'jog go //
translated: In this context, the attention that is directed toward the knowledge of the defining characteristics is the one that is applied to the process of abandoning and obtaining, after having understood what is to be abandoned and what is to be obtained.

original: mos pa las byung ba ni de'i 'og tu yang dag par sbyor ba tsam mo //
analyzed: mos pa las byung ba ni de'i 'og tu yang dag par sbyor ba tsam mo //
