translated: The attention that is directed toward the attainment of conviction is the one that is applied to the mere act of correct preparation that occurs after the attention that is directed toward the knowledge of the defining characteristics.

original: rab tu dben pa las byung bas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa chen po rnams rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa las byung bas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa chen po rnams rab tu spong ngo //
translated: The attention that is directed toward the attainment of separation is the one that is applied to the process of abandoning the great afflictions.

original: dga' ba sdud pas ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa 'bring du spong ngo //
analyzed: dga' ba sdud pas ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa 'bring du spong ngo //
translated: The second, the stage of joy, eliminates the middling degree of the afflictions.

original: dpyod pas ni thob par mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa la sems 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: dpyod pas ni thob par mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa la sems 'jog par byed do //
translated: The third, the stage of investigation, stabilizes the mind in the absence of the pride of attainment.

original: sbyor ba'i mthas ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu rab tu spong ngo //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i mthas ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu rab tu spong ngo //
translated: The fourth, the stage of the culmination of practice, eliminates the lesser degree of the afflictions.

original: sbyor ba'i mtha'i 'bras bus ni yid la byed pa legs par bsgoms pa 'di dag gis bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu myong bar byed do //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i mtha'i 'bras bus ni yid la byed pa legs par bsgoms pa 'di dag gis bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu myong bar byed do //
translated: The fifth, the result of the culmination of practice, experiences the result of the cultivation of these well-cultivated mental attentions.

original: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rnam pa bdun ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar la snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir yang ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩrags pa'i mtshan nyid ni sa 'og ma thams cad de /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir yid la byed pa rnam pa bdun ji lta ba bzhin du 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar la snyoms par 'jug pa'i phyir yang ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar bar bya'o // rags pa'i mtshan nyid ni sa 'og ma thams cad de /
translated: Just as there are seven mental attentions for entering the first meditative absorption, so too there are for entering up to the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, as is appropriate in each case.

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi bar du'o //
translated: The characteristic of the gross is all the lower stages up to the sphere of nothingness.üîΩThe characteristic of the subtle is the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be understood as twofold:

original: rab tu ma zhi bar gnas pas shin tu sdug bsngal bar gnas pa dang / shin tu tshe thung ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu ma zhi bar gnas pas shin tu sdug bsngal bar gnas pa dang / shin tu tshe thung ba'o //
translated: They are born in a place of great suffering, because they are born in a place of great agitation, and they have a very short life.

original: de las bzlog ste sa gong ma ni zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog ste sa gong ma ni zhi ba'i mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that should be understood as the characteristics of the higher stages.

original: tshad rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshad rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The arrangement of the measure of the stages is as follows.

original: bsam gtan rnams ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang cher yongs su bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ni chung ngu dang 'bring dang cher yongs su bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absorptions are cultivated to a small, middling, and great degree.

original: re re la yang bsam gtan gyi skye ba gsum gsum ni 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: re re la yang bsam gtan gyi skye ba gsum gsum ni 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Each of the absorptions has three births as its result.

original: 'di lta ste tshangs ris dang / @59a * //
analyzed: 'di lta ste tshangs ris dang / @59a * //
translated: For example, the Brahmakayika,

original: tshangs pa mdun na 'don dang / tshangs pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar gong du bshad pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa mdun na 'don dang / tshangs pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji ltar gong du bshad pa'o //
translated: Brahmapurohita, and Mahabrahma gods, as explained above.

original: gzugs med pa rnams na ni gzhal med khang gi gnas gzhan gnas pa med pa'i phyir de ltar skye ba'i bye brag rnam par gzhag pa med de /
analyzed: gzugs med pa rnams na ni gzhal med khang gi gnas gzhan gnas pa med pa'i phyir de ltar skye ba'i bye brag rnam par gzhag pa med de /
translated: In the formless realms, there is no such arrangement of births as a specific type, because there is no other place in the celestial mansions.

original: 'on kyang de dag chung du la sogs pa yongs su bsgoms pa rnams kyis skye ba la tshe la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis mthon po dang dma' ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa mang ba'i khyad par gyis ngan pa dang bzang po ni yod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag chung du la sogs pa yongs su bsgoms pa rnams kyis skye ba la tshe la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis mthon po dang dma' ba dang / nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa mang ba'i khyad par gyis ngan pa dang bzang po ni yod do //
translated: However, they are high or low due to the difference in lifespan and so on, and they are bad or good due to the difference in the amount of afflicted or unafflicted meditative attainment.

original: ming du gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni bsam gtan bzhi'i rab tu dbye ba'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi ming grangs med pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams te /
analyzed: ming du gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni bsam gtan bzhi'i rab tu dbye ba'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi ming grangs med pa dang bsam gyis mi khyab pa rnams te /
translated: The presentation of the designation of names is the countless and inconceivable names of the concentrations and formless states that are classified as the four absorptions.

original: 'di ltar bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa ji snyed la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' mthu chen po thob pa rnams snyoms par 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin de dag gi ming yang nyan thos rnams dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis mi shes na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam gtan dang pos bsdus pa ji snyed la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' mthu chen po thob pa rnams snyoms par 'jug pa'i ting nge 'dzin de dag gi ming yang nyan thos rnams dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyis mi shes na /
translated: Thus the Bhagavan Buddhas and bodhisattvas who have attained great power enter meditative attainment in countless concentrations subsumed by the first absorption and the names of those concentrations are not known to ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: de dag gi grangs shes par 'gyur ba'am snyoms par 'jug par lta ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gi grangs shes par 'gyur ba'am snyoms par 'jug par lta ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How could they know the number of those meditative attainments?

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ting nge 'dzin brgya lha gcig bstan pa dang / de bzhin du theg pa chen po'i mdo sde gzhan de dang de dag nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las ting nge 'dzin brgya lha gcig bstan pa dang / de bzhin du theg pa chen po'i mdo sde gzhan de dang de dag nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: The one hundred meditative stabilizations taught in the perfection of wisdom and similarly in other Mahayana sutras are the meditative stabilizations of the bodhisattva.

original: rnam par dag pas ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩrab kyi mtha'i cha las byung ba'i bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa rnams ni rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pas ji lta bu zhe na / rab kyi mtha'i cha las byung ba'i bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa rnams ni rnam par dag pa zhes bya ste /
translated: How are they pure?

original: yon tan khyad par can mngon par bsgrub ba'i phyir 'dod pa bzhin du 'thob pa la sogs pas las su rung ba mchog tu phyin par khrid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan khyad par can mngon par bsgrub ba'i phyir 'dod pa bzhin du 'thob pa la sogs pas las su rung ba mchog tu phyin par khrid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meditative stabilizations and formless absorptions that arise from the final summit are called pure because they are the supreme culmination of fitness that is attained as one wishes and so on, in order to manifest special qualities.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi bsgom pa'i lam la brgyad de /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi bsgom pa'i lam la brgyad de /
translated: The path of meditation of the supramundane path has eight:

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa la chos dang rjes su rtog pa'i shes pa rnams te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa la chos dang rjes su rtog pa'i shes pa rnams te /
translated: the Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge of the truths of suffering and so on.

original: ji ltar mthong ba'i lam la bstan pa rnams te /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba'i lam la bstan pa rnams te /
translated: They are the concentrations that are taught in the path of seeing.

original: ji ltar mthong ba'i lam la bstan pa rnams so //üîΩde dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa'am /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba'i lam la bstan pa rnams so // de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni mi lcogs pa med pas bsdus pa'am /
translated: They are the concentrations that are taught in the path of seeing.

original: bsam gtan dang po nas ci yang med pa'i skye mchod kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nas ci yang med pa'i skye mchod kyi bar du'o //
translated: The concentrations that are associated with them are included in the stage of unrestricted access concentration or the first meditative absorption up to the station of nothingness.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ni 'du shes kyi rgyu ba yongs su mi gsal bas 'phags pa'i lam mchog tu gsal ba'i gnas ma yin pa'i phyir @59b gcig tu 'jig rten par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ni 'du shes kyi rgyu ba yongs su mi gsal bas 'phags pa'i lam mchog tu gsal ba'i gnas ma yin pa'i phyir @59b gcig tu 'jig rten par rig par bya'o //
translated: The station of neither conceptualization nor non-conceptualization is known as being exclusively mundane because the movement of conceptualization is not clear there and it is not a basis for the clear highest path of the noble ones.

original: de'i phyir de'i 'du shes dman pas dmigs pa la mtshan mar mi byed pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'du shes dman pas dmigs pa la mtshan mar mi byed pa'i phyir mtshan ma med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because the conceptualization there is weak, it is called ‚Äúsignless‚Äù because it does not form signs of the object.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la 'phags pa'i lam med pa de ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la 'phags pa'i lam med pa de ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How is it known that the noble path does not exist in the station of neither conceptualization nor non-conceptualization?

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ji tsam du 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa de tsam du kun shes pas rtogs so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis ji tsam du 'du shes kyi snyoms par 'jug pa de tsam du kun shes pas rtogs so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the Lord has said, ‚ÄúTo the extent that there is meditative attainment of discriminations, to that extent there is realization through complete knowledge.‚Äù

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: The meditative attainment of cessation is supramundane,

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi rjes la thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi rjes la thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is attained subsequent to the noble path.

original: mi rnams kyi nang du mngon bar sgrub po zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi rnams kyi nang du mngon bar sgrub po zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is actualized among humans.

original: thog ma nyid du skyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: thog ma nyid du skyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This means that it is first generated among humans.

original: sngar skye na mi rnams kyi nang du tshe de nyid dam gzugs kyi khams su skyes nas mngon du 'gyur ro //üîΩ'phags pa nyan thos gzugs kyi khams las 'dod chags dang bral ste /
analyzed: sngar skye na mi rnams kyi nang du tshe de nyid dam gzugs kyi khams su skyes nas mngon du 'gyur ro // 'phags pa nyan thos gzugs kyi khams las 'dod chags dang bral ste /
translated: If it were generated previously, it would be actualized among humans in that very life or in the form realm.

original: gzugs med pa thob pa gzugs kyi khams su ji ltar skye zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa thob pa gzugs kyi khams su ji ltar skye zhe na /
translated: How does an ƒÅrya ≈õrƒÅvaka who is free from attachment to the form realm and who has obtained the formless realm take birth in the form realm?

original: gzugs kyi khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gzugs med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa nges pa med do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid gzugs med pa la snyoms par 'jug pa nges pa med do //
translated: There is no certainty that one who is free from attachment to the form realm enters meditative attainment of the formless realm.

original: de'i phyir gang gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral ba de thams cad gzugs med pa zhi ba rnam par thar pa la snyoms par 'jug par byed la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral ba de thams cad gzugs med pa zhi ba rnam par thar pa la snyoms par 'jug par byed la /
translated: Therefore, all who are free from attachment to form enter meditative attainment in the peaceful liberation of the formless realm.

original: gang yang gzugs med pa zhi ba rnam par thar pa la snyoms par 'jug par byed pa de thams cad gzugs las 'dod chags dang bral ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gang yang gzugs med pa zhi ba rnam par thar pa la snyoms par 'jug par byed pa de thams cad gzugs las 'dod chags dang bral ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: But do all who enter meditative attainment in the peaceful liberation of the formless realm become free from attachment to form?

original: mu bzhir 'gyur te mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral ba ni mu dang po'o //
analyzed: mu bzhir 'gyur te mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral ba ni mu dang po'o //
translated: There are four possibilities: One who is free from attachment to form through dependence on unrestricted access concentration is the first possibility.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa'i 'phags pa gzugs med par skye ba don du mi gnyer ba la spong ba'i lam bsal nas khyad par can gyi lam la gnas te gzugs med pa zhi ba rnams par thar pa la snyoms par 'jug par byed pa ni mu gnyis
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa thob pa'i 'phags pa gzugs med par skye ba don du mi gnyer ba la spong ba'i lam bsal nas khyad par can gyi lam la gnas te gzugs med pa zhi ba rnams par thar pa la snyoms par 'jug par byed pa ni mu gnyis
translated: Noble beings who obtain the fourth absorption but do not seek to be born in the formless realm enter meditative attainment in the peaceful liberation of the formless realm by abiding on the special path, having eliminated the path of elimination. This is the second possibility.

original: pa'o // de nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba don du gnyer zhing spong ba'i lam la gnas te gzugs med pa zhi ba rnam par thar pa la snyoms par 'jug par byed pa ni mu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // de nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba don du gnyer zhing spong ba'i lam la gnas te gzugs med pa zhi ba rnam par thar pa la snyoms par 'jug par byed pa ni mu gsum pa'o //
translated: The third alternative is the person who, seeking to be free from attachment, abiding in the path of elimination, enters into the meditative attainment of the liberation of the formless realm, which is peaceful.

original: rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa ni mu bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa ni mu bzhi pa'o /
translated: The fourth alternative is the person who does not have these modes.

original: gzugs med par skyes pa rnams la ci'i phyir mngon sum du mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs med par skyes pa rnams la ci'i phyir mngon sum du mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why do those born in the formless realm not manifest the meditative attainment of the formless realm?

original: zhi bar gnas pas gnas par 'dod pa'i 'phags pa rnams mi'i nang du de @60a * //
analyzed: zhi bar gnas pas gnas par 'dod pa'i 'phags pa rnams mi'i nang du de @60a * //
translated: Aryans who wish to abide in the peaceful state manifest it in the desire realm.

original: mngon par bsgrubs nas mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: mngon par bsgrubs nas mngon sum du byed do //
translated: They manifest it in the desire realm and then manifest it.

original: gzugs med par skyes pa de dag ni bsgrim mi dgos par rnam par smin pa las byung ba mchog tu zhi ba rnam par thar pa la gnas pas gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs med par skyes pa de dag ni bsgrim mi dgos par rnam par smin pa las byung ba mchog tu zhi ba rnam par thar pa la gnas pas gnas pa ste /
translated: Those born in the formless realm abide in the peaceful state of the meditative attainment of the formless realm that arises from karmic maturation without exertion.

original: de'i phyir de mngon sum du bya ba'i don du yang 'bad pa mi rtsom mo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de mngon sum du bya ba'i don du yang 'bad pa mi rtsom mo //
translated: Therefore, they do not strive to manifest it.

original: lam chung du dang 'bring dang chen po re re la yang chung du la sogs pas rnam pa gsum du phye nas rnam pa dgur rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: lam chung du dang 'bring dang chen po re re la yang chung du la sogs pas rnam pa gsum du phye nas rnam pa dgur rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Each of the small, medium and great paths is divided into small and so on, making nine aspects.üîΩ

original: bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba rnam pa rim gyis spang ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba rnam pa rim gyis spang ba bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Each of the small, medium and great paths is divided into three types, small and so on, and are posited as nine types because it is taught that objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation are serially abandoned.

original: ci'i phyir lam chung ngu'i chung dus nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po spang zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lam chung ngu'i chung dus nyon mongs pa chen po'i chen po spang zhe na /
translated: Why does the small of the small path abandon the great of the great afflictions?

original: de ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang shin tu bral zhing 'dzem pa med pa'i sems kyi rgyud la kun du 'byung bas de rtogs par sla zhing yongs su gcad par sla ba ste /
analyzed: de ni ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang shin tu bral zhing 'dzem pa med pa'i sems kyi rgyud la kun du 'byung bas de rtogs par sla zhing yongs su gcad par sla ba ste /
translated: It arises in a mindstream that is utterly devoid of shame and embarrassment and is free of scruple, so it is easy to realize and easy to eliminate.

original: de'i phyir de ni dri ma che long bzhin du gnyen po chung ngus sel to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni dri ma che long bzhin du gnyen po chung ngus sel to //
translated: Therefore it is removed by a small antidote, like a great stain.

original: gang yongs su gcad par dka' bar kun tu 'byung zhing phra la rgyud la zhen pa'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chung ngu de ni dri ma chung ngu bzhin du gnyen po chen po'i stobs kyis sel te /
analyzed: gang yongs su gcad par dka' bar kun tu 'byung zhing phra la rgyud la zhen pa'i nyon mongs pa chung ngu'i chung ngu de ni dri ma chung ngu bzhin du gnyen po chen po'i stobs kyis sel te /
translated: That which is difficult to eliminate, which arises, is subtle, and is the small of the small afflictions that are adhered to in the continuum, is removed by the power of the great antidote, like a small stain.

original: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa las bzlog nas gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi rnam pa las bzlog nas gnyen po'i phyogs kyi rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the antidote is established in the aspect that is the opposite of the aspect of the discordant class.

original: sbyor ba'i lam ni lam gang bsgoms pas chen po'i yang chen po la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag dang phyogs kyi gnas ngan len gyi cha shas re re dang bral ba'i phyir rim gyis gnas gyur pa de ni bsgom pa'i lam la sbyor ba'i
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam ni lam gang bsgoms pas chen po'i yang chen po la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa'i bye brag dang phyogs kyi gnas ngan len gyi cha shas re re dang bral ba'i phyir rim gyis gnas gyur pa de ni bsgom pa'i lam la sbyor ba'i
translated: The path of application is the path that is applied to the path of cultivation because it is gradually transformed by being free from each part of the negative tendencies of the classes and the specific aspects of the afflictions, such as the great of the great.

original: lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lam zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the path of application.

original: gang gi 'og tu de nyon mongs pa'i bye brag gi rnam pa dang / phyogs kyi gnas ngan len ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir des gnas ngan len med par gnas gyur pa de ni bar chad med pa'i lam lo //
analyzed: gang gi 'og tu de nyon mongs pa'i bye brag gi rnam pa dang / phyogs kyi gnas ngan len ma lus pa dang bral ba'i phyir des gnas ngan len med par gnas gyur pa de ni bar chad med pa'i lam lo //
translated: The uninterrupted path is the path by which one is separated from all the negative tendencies of the specific categories of the afflictions.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam ni gang gis gnas gyur pa de so sor rang gis myong ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam ni gang gis gnas gyur pa de so sor rang gis myong ba'o //
translated: The path of liberation is the path by which one experiences the transformation of one's state for oneself.

original: khyad par gyi lam ni de'i 'og tu nyon mongs pa lhag ma spong par byed pa'i sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par gyi lam ni de'i 'og tu nyon mongs pa lhag ma spong par byed pa'i sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam gang yin pa'o //
translated: The special path is the path that is the application, the uninterrupted path, and the path of liberation that eliminates the remaining afflictions after that.

original: rnam grangs gzhan du na khyad par gyi lam ni nyon mongs pa spong bar sbyor ba btang ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan du na khyad par gyi lam ni nyon mongs pa spong bar sbyor ba btang ste /
translated: In another enumeration, the special path is the path that is the application to the elimination of the afflictions,

original: mdo la sogs pa'i chos sems pa'am sdar bsam pa dang khong du chud pa'i chos la so sor rtog pa'i @60b gnas pas gnas pa'am /
analyzed: mdo la sogs pa'i chos sems pa'am sdar bsam pa dang khong du chud pa'i chos la so sor rtog pa'i @60b gnas pas gnas pa'am /
translated: the path of meditative equipoise that is the contemplation of the Dharma of the s≈´tras and so on, or the path of meditative equipoise that is the discernment of the Dharma that is understood.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan la snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan pa snyoms par 'jug pa'i lam gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan la snyoms par 'jug pa gzhan pa snyoms par 'jug pa'i lam gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the path of meditative development that is concerned with other meditative attainments.

original: yang mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub pa'am de dag gi gnas pa'i lam gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang mngon par shes pa la sogs pa yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub pa'am de dag gi gnas pa'i lam gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the path of meditative development that is concerned with the special qualities such as the higher knowledges, or with the states of spiritual realization.

original: de ltar bsgom pa'i lam rgya cher bshad nas de'i zhar la byung ba'i lam bsgom pa brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsgom pa'i lam rgya cher bshad nas de'i zhar la byung ba'i lam bsgom pa brjod par bya'o //
translated: Having thus explained the path of meditative development in detail, the path of meditative development that is pertinent to the present discussion will now be described.üîΩThe path of meditative development is fourfold:

original: lam bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi ni yang dag par spong pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /üîΩji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //üîΩde la thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa ni thob par bya ba'i don du bsgom pa ste /üîΩdes dge ba'i chos ma thob pa rnams thob pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbrten pa bsgom pa ni brten pa nyid bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: lam bsgom pa rnam pa bzhi ni yang dag par spong pa'i dbang du byas pa ste / ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro // de la thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa ni thob par bya ba'i don du bsgom pa ste / des dge ba'i chos ma thob pa rnams thob pa'i phyir ro // brten pa bsgom pa ni brten pa nyid bsgom pa ste /
translated: in accordance with the four right efforts.üîΩThe four right efforts are:üîΩThe meditative development that is undertaken in order to obtain is the meditative development of the obtainment of those wholesome dharmas that have not yet been obtained.

original: dge ba'i chos thob pa goms par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thob pa goms par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meditative development of the maintenance of those wholesome dharmas that have been obtained is the meditative development of the maintenance.

original: bsal ba'i phyir bsgom pa ni bsal ba'i don du bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: bsal ba'i phyir bsgom pa ni bsal ba'i don du bsgom pa ste /
translated: Meditation for the purpose of elimination is meditation for the purpose of eliminating the afflictions.

original: kun 'byung ba'i gnas skabs su mi dge ba'i chos sel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i gnas skabs su mi dge ba'i chos sel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the elimination of nonvirtuous phenomena at the time of the origin of suffering.

original: gnyen po bsgom pa ni gnyen po la bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: gnyen po bsgom pa ni gnyen po la bsgom pa ste /
translated: Meditation on the antidote is meditation on the antidote.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i mi dge ba'i chos mi skye ba'i chos can du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i mi dge ba'i chos mi skye ba'i chos can du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the nonarising of future nonvirtuous phenomena, which are made into phenomena that do not arise.

original: rnam grang gzhan du na 'phags pa'i lam skye ba na rang gi bag chags 'jog pa de ni bag chags thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: rnam grang gzhan du na 'phags pa'i lam skye ba na rang gi bag chags 'jog pa de ni bag chags thob par bya ba'i phyir bsgom pa ste /
translated: In another way, the arising of the ƒÅrya path is the meditation for the purpose of obtaining imprints,

original: de las de'i rgyu las byung ba rnams cher 'bar bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las de'i rgyu las byung ba rnams cher 'bar bar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because from that, those that arise from its cause arise greatly.

original: lam de nyid mngon du byed pa ni brten pa'i bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: lam de nyid mngon du byed pa ni brten pa'i bsgom pa'o //
translated: The manifestation of that path is the meditation of support.

original: des rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len 'gog par byed pa ni bsal ba'i phyir bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: des rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len 'gog par byed pa ni bsal ba'i phyir bsgom pa'o //
translated: The elimination of the negative tendencies that are its discordant class is meditation for the purpose of elimination.

original: gnas 'gyur ba'i phyir phyi ma la mi skye ba'i chos can du 'jog pa de ni gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: gnas 'gyur ba'i phyir phyi ma la mi skye ba'i chos can du 'jog pa de ni gnyen po bsgom pa'o //
translated: The future non-arising of the object of elimination is posited as the future non-arising of that object of elimination, because its basis has changed.

original: yang gnyen po ni rnam par sun 'byin pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhir rab tu dbye bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang gnyen po ni rnam par sun 'byin pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhir rab tu dbye bar rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the antidote should be known as being divided into four types:

original: de la rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po ni /
analyzed: de la rnam par sun 'byin pa'i gnyen po ni /
translated: the antidote of elimination,üîΩthe antidote of separation,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams la nyes dmigs su lta ba ste /üîΩdes nad dang 'bras la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis nye bar len pa'i phung po sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'du byed rnams la nyes dmigs su lta ba ste / des nad dang 'bras la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis nye bar len pa'i phung po sun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the antidote of holding andüîΩthe antidote of distance.

original: spong ba'i gnyen po ni sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa'i lam rnams te /
analyzed: spong ba'i gnyen po ni sbyor ba dang bar chad med pa'i lam rnams te /
translated: The antidote of elimination is the path of application and the uninterrupted path,

original: de dag gi nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi nyon mongs pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they eliminate the afflictions.

original: rten gnyis po ni rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams te /
analyzed: rten gnyis po ni rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams te /
translated: The antidote of separation is the path of liberation,üîΩbecause it is the first to separate from the bonds of the afflictions.üîΩThe antidote of holding is the path of liberation,

original: de dag gis spong ba'i thob pa kun tu 'dzin pa'i phyir @61a * //
analyzed: de dag gis spong ba'i thob pa kun tu 'dzin pa'i phyir @61a * //
translated: because it holds the obtainment of elimination.

original: ro ; / thag bsring ba'i gnyen po ni de'i gong ma'i lam ste /
analyzed: ro ; / thag bsring ba'i gnyen po ni de'i gong ma'i lam ste /
translated: The antidote of distance is the path that is higher than that,üîΩbecause it is distant from the bonds of the afflictions.

original: des sngon spangs pa'i nyon mongs pa thag bsring ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des sngon spangs pa'i nyon mongs pa thag bsring ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is distant from the defilements that have been abandoned.

original: yang byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs ba'i bye brag gis lam rnam pa bcu gcig tu rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: yang byang chub kyi phyogs la sogs ba'i bye brag gis lam rnam pa bcu gcig tu rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Moreover, the path is determined as being of eleven kinds, according to the specific categories of the elements leading to enlightenment, etc.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: dngos po la yongs su rtog pa'i lam ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams te /
analyzed: dngos po la yongs su rtog pa'i lam ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams te /
translated: The path of thorough analysis of the entities is the four close mindfulnesses,

original: des thog ma nyid du mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i rnam gyi lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos kyi dngos po la yongs su rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des thog ma nyid du mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i rnam gyi lus dang / tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos kyi dngos po la yongs su rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, at the very outset, one thoroughly analyzes the entities of the body, sensations, mind and the dharmas through the aspects of impurity, etc.

original: rtsol ba las byung ba'i lam ni yang dag par spong ba rnams te /
analyzed: rtsol ba las byung ba'i lam ni yang dag par spong ba rnams te /
translated: The path of the arising of effort is the four right efforts,

original: de ltar dngos po rnams la yongs su brtags nas des sgrib pa spangs pa'i don du brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po rnams la yongs su brtags nas des sgrib pa spangs pa'i don du brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, having thus thoroughly analyzed the entities, one makes effort for the sake of abandoning the obscurations.

original: ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i lam ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i lam ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams te /
translated: The path of the purification of meditative concentration is the four bases of supernatural power,üîΩbecause, by means of the meditative concentration that is purified in this way, one accomplishes the supernatural knowledges, etc.

original: de ltar sgrib pa yongs su sbyangs pa ni 'dis 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus dang sems dang dpyod pa'i sgo nas ting nge 'dzin rnams kyis las su rung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar sgrib pa yongs su sbyangs pa ni 'dis 'dun pa dang brtson 'grus dang sems dang dpyod pa'i sgo nas ting nge 'dzin rnams kyis las su rung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the complete purification of obscurations is by means of these concentrations, since they render the mind serviceable through aspiration, effort, mind and investigation.

original: mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i sbyor ba'i lam ni dbang po rnams te /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs par bya ba'i sbyor ba'i lam ni dbang po rnams te /
translated: The path of preparation for realization is the faculties.

original: de ltar ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyang ba byas pa ni des 'phags pa'i lam yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir dbang byed par gyur pa dro bar gyur pa dang rtse mo la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ting nge 'dzin yongs su sbyang ba byas pa ni des 'phags pa'i lam yang dag par sgrub pa'i phyir dbang byed par gyur pa dro bar gyur pa dang rtse mo la sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, one who has purified the concentrations through them becomes dominant, since they establish the ƒÅrya path, because they prepare for heat and the peak.

original: mngon par rtogs pa dang 'dres pa'i lam ni stobs rnams te /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa dang 'dres pa'i lam ni stobs rnams te /
translated: The path mixed with realization is the powers.

original: de ltar dbang byed pa thob pa ni lnga po 'dis de ma thag tu bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ma dang pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis mi non pa bzod pa dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog la sbyor ba'i phyir ro
analyzed: de ltar dbang byed pa thob pa ni lnga po 'dis de ma thag tu bden pa rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ma dang pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis mi non pa bzod pa dang 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog la sbyor ba'i phyir ro
translated: Thus, one who has obtained dominance through these five is prepared for the forbearance and supreme mundane quality that immediately realizes the truth, since they overpower the discordant class of faith and so on.

original: // mngon par rtogs pa'i lam ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams te /
analyzed: // mngon par rtogs pa'i lam ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams te /
translated: The path of clear knowledge is the limbs of enlightenment.

original: des thog ma kho nar so so rang gis de kho nar mngon du yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des thog ma kho nar so so rang gis de kho nar mngon du yang dag par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, for the first time, one has clear knowledge of reality for oneself.

original: rnam par dag pa nges par 'byin pa'i lam ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa nges par 'byin pa'i lam ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste /
translated: The path of deliverance that is purification is the eightfold path of the noble ones.

original: de'i 'og tu des bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par dag par bya bar nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu des bsgoms pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams rnam par dag par bya bar nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, after that, one is delivered to the purification of the afflictions that are to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: de'i phyir de ltar byang chub kyi phyogs 'di dag gi go rims ni 'di lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar byang chub kyi phyogs 'di dag gi go rims ni 'di lta bu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the order of these factors of enlightenment should be understood in this way.

original: gnas dang dbang po tha @61b dad pa'i lam ni lam bzhi ste /
analyzed: gnas dang dbang po tha @61b dad pa'i lam ni lam bzhi ste /
translated: The path of the different abodes and faculties is the four paths.

original: de la dka' ba'i lam ni mi lcogs pa med pa dang / gzugs med pa la brten pa ste /
analyzed: de la dka' ba'i lam ni mi lcogs pa med pa dang / gzugs med pa la brten pa ste /
translated: Among them, the difficult path is based on the unrestricted and formless states,

original: go rims bzhin du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zhan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because calm abiding and insight are weak, respectively.

original: sla ba ni bsam gtan la brten pa ste /
analyzed: sla ba ni bsam gtan la brten pa ste /
translated: The easy path is based on the meditative absorptions.

original: zung ngu 'brel par 'jug pa'i phyir ro ;üîΩ/ mngon par shes pa bul ba ni dka' ba dang sla ba'i gnas 'di gnyis la ste /üîΩdbang po rtul po rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: zung ngu 'brel par 'jug pa'i phyir ro ; / mngon par shes pa bul ba ni dka' ba dang sla ba'i gnas 'di gnyis la ste / dbang po rtul po rnams kyi'o //
translated: because they are united in their practice.

original: mngon par shes pa myur ba ni 'di gnyis nyid la ste /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa myur ba ni 'di gnyis nyid la ste /
translated: The quick superknowledge is in these two,

original: dbang po rnon po rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po rnams kyi'o //
translated: for those of sharp faculties.

original: bslab pa gsum yongs su sbyong ba'i lam ni chos kyi gnas bzhi ste /
analyzed: bslab pa gsum yongs su sbyong ba'i lam ni chos kyi gnas bzhi ste /
translated: The path of purification of the three trainings is the four stations of brahma.

original: de la brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa gnyis kyis ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yongs su sbyong ba ste /
analyzed: de la brnab sems med pa dang / gnod sems med pa gnyis kyis ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa yongs su sbyong ba ste /
translated: Among them, the two, non-covetousness and non-ill will, purify the training in superior morality,

original: rjes su chags pa dang / khang khro ba spangs pa'i bslab pa'i gnas mi nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang / khang khro ba spangs pa'i bslab pa'i gnas mi nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they prevent the loss of the station of training which is the abandonment of attachment and hostility.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pas ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yongs su spyod pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pas ni lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa yongs su spyod pa ste /
translated: Right mindfulness purifies the training in superior mind,

original: dmigs pa ma brjed pa ni sems mnyam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa ma brjed pa ni sems mnyam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the undistracted object causes the mind to settle in equipoise.

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yongs su sbyong ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yongs su sbyong ste /
translated: Through right concentration, the training in wisdom is purified.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pa las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pa las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one who has settled the mind knows things as they really are.

original: yon tan thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i rnal 'byor gyi lam ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ste /
analyzed: yon tan thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i rnal 'byor gyi lam ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ste /
translated: The path of yoga that accomplishes all virtues is serenity and insight,

original: de las 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan thams cad mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan thams cad mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all mundane and transcendental virtues are accomplished from them.

original: lam sdud pa'i lam ni dbang po gsum po dag ste /
analyzed: lam sdud pa'i lam ni dbang po gsum po dag ste /
translated: The path that subsumes the path is the three faculties,

original: de la mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang pos ni sbyor ba dang mthong ba'i lam sdud do //üîΩkun shes pa'i dbang pos ni bsgom pa'i lam sdud do //
analyzed: de la mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang pos ni sbyor ba dang mthong ba'i lam sdud do // kun shes pa'i dbang pos ni bsgom pa'i lam sdud do //
translated: because the faculty producing complete knowledge subsumes the path of application and seeing;üîΩthe faculty of complete knowledge subsumes the path of cultivation;

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang pos ni mthar phyin pa'i lam sdud do //
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang pos ni mthar phyin pa'i lam sdud do //
translated: and the faculty of possession of complete knowledge subsumes the path of conclusion.

original: yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams ni rnam par lngas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams ni rnam par lngas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the factors of enlightenment are to be understood as being established in five ways:

original: dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bus so //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / ngo bo nyid dang / grogs dang / bsgom pa dang / bsgoms pa'i 'bras bus so //
translated: by way of object, nature, aids, cultivation, and result of cultivation.

original: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ni lus dang / tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams te /
analyzed: de la dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams kyi dmigs pa ni lus dang / tshor ba dang sems dang chos rnams te /
translated: Among them, the objects of the foundations of mindfulness are the body, sensations, the mind, and the dharmas.

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are in that order.

original: ci'i phyir 'di dag dmigs par rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di dag dmigs par rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why are they established as objects?

original: @62a * // 'di ltar byis pa phyin ci log gi blo can rnams ni phal cher dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la brten nas bde ba la sogs pa la spyod pa na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang rnam par byang bar 'gyur bar rtogs te /
analyzed: @62a * // 'di ltar byis pa phyin ci log gi blo can rnams ni phal cher dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus la brten nas bde ba la sogs pa la spyod pa na dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang rnam par byang bar 'gyur bar rtogs te /
translated: Thus, fools with erroneous minds, for the most part, in dependence on the body with its faculties, when they experience pleasure and so forth, conceive of a self characterized by the object and become afflicted by attachment and so on and faith and so forth.

original: de'i phyir thog ma nyid du dngos po'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir thog ma nyid du dngos po'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Therefore, first of all, the characteristics of things are to be thoroughly examined.

original: legs par yongs su brtags pa'i phyir dmigs pa rnam pa bzhi rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: legs par yongs su brtags pa'i phyir dmigs pa rnam pa bzhi rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the four kinds of objects are to be understood as being established.

original: ngo bo nyid ni shes rab dang dran pa ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni shes rab dang dran pa ste /
translated: The essence of the applications of mindfulness is wisdom and memory.

original: lus la sogs pa la rjes su lta ba zhes 'byung ba dang ; dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: lus la sogs pa la rjes su lta ba zhes 'byung ba dang ; dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes 'byung ba'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are called the applications of mindfulness of the body, etc., and the establishments of mindfulness, respectively.

original: grogs ni de gnyi ga dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: grogs ni de gnyi ga dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
translated: The associates of the applications of mindfulness are the mind and mental activities associated with both wisdom and memory.

original: bsgom pa ni nang dang phyi'i lus la sogs pa la lus la sogs pa'i rjes su lta ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni nang dang phyi'i lus la sogs pa la lus la sogs pa'i rjes su lta ba'o //
translated: The cultivation of the applications of mindfulness is the observation of the internal and external body, etc., as body, etc.

original: de la nang gi lus ni mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus kyi dbang po rnams te /
analyzed: de la nang gi lus ni mig dang rna ba dang sna dang lce dang lus kyi dbang po rnams te /
translated: The internal body refers to the faculties of eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.

original: nang gi skye mched kyis bsdus pa dang sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nang gi skye mched kyis bsdus pa dang sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are included in the internal sense bases and belong to the category of sentient beings.

original: phyi'i lus ni phyi rol gyi gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams te /
analyzed: phyi'i lus ni phyi rol gyi gzugs dang sgra dang dri dang ro dang reg bya rnams te /
translated: The external body is external form, sound, odor, taste, and tactile objects.

original: phyi'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa dang / sems can gyi grangs sum gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi'i skye mched kyis bsdus pa dang / sems can gyi grangs sum gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is included in the external sense bases and is not counted as a sentient being.

original: nang dang phyi'i lus ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched dang 'brel ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched dbang po'i gnas su gyur pa rnams te /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i lus ni mig la sogs pa'i skye mched dang 'brel ba'i gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched dbang po'i gnas su gyur pa rnams te /
translated: The internal and external body is the form, etc., sense bases associated with the eye, etc., sense bases, which are the bases of the faculties.

original: sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa dang phyi'i skye mched kyis sdud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa dang phyi'i skye mched kyis sdud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is counted as a sentient being and is included in the external sense bases.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i nang gi skye mched gzugs can rnams kyang nang dang phyi'i lus te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i nang gi skye mched gzugs can rnams kyang nang dang phyi'i lus te /
translated: The physical internal sense bases that exist in another‚Äôs stream of consciousness are also the internal and external body.

original: skye mched rnam par gzhag pa dang / rgyud rnam par gzhag pa brtson par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye mched rnam par gzhag pa dang / rgyud rnam par gzhag pa brtson par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are counted as a sentient being and are included in the external sense bases.

original: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba ni lus la lus dang 'dra bar lta ba ste /
analyzed: lus la lus kyi rjes su lta ba ni lus la lus dang 'dra bar lta ba ste /
translated: The observation of the body is the observation of the body as a body.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs mthong ba dang mthun par rang gzhin gyi gzugs kyi lus nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi gzugs mthong ba dang mthun par rang gzhin gyi gzugs kyi lus nges par 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the body of form that is naturally perceived in accordance with the seeing of the reflection of form.

original: nang gi tshor ba la sogs pa ni nang gi lus la brten nas 'byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: nang gi tshor ba la sogs pa ni nang gi lus la brten nas 'byung ba rnams te /
translated: Internal feelings, etc., arise in dependence on the internal body,

original: mig la sogs pa la dmigs pa dang rang gi gnas las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la dmigs pa dang rang gi gnas las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have the eyes, etc., as their objects and because they arise from their own bases.

original: phyi'i tshor ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi lus la brten @62b nas 'byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: phyi'i tshor ba la sogs pa ni phyi rol gyi lus la brten @62b nas 'byung ba rnams te /
translated: External feelings, etc., arise in dependence on the external body,

original: gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa dang gzhan gyi gnas las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa dang gzhan gyi gnas las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have form, etc., as their objects and because they arise from other bases.

original: nang dang phyi'i tshor ba la sogs pa ni nang dang phyi'i lus la brten nas 'byung ba rnams te /
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i tshor ba la sogs pa ni nang dang phyi'i lus la brten nas 'byung ba rnams te /
translated: Internal-external feelings, etc., arise in dependence on the internal-external body,

original: rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i phyi'i skye mched la dmigs pa dang / gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i nang gi skye mched la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la yod pa'i phyi'i skye mched la dmigs pa dang / gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa'i nang gi skye mched la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have external sense bases that exist in one‚Äôs own continuum and because they have internal sense bases that exist in the continua of others.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa'i rjes su lta ba yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa'i rjes su lta ba yang de bzhin te /
translated: The same applies to the contemplation of feeling, etc.

original: ci rigs su sbyar ro zhes ba ni blo la snang ba dang khyad par med pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ci rigs su sbyar ro zhes ba ni blo la snang ba dang khyad par med pa bsgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúas is appropriate‚Äù means that this is called the cultivation of the absence of distinction between what appears to the mind and what is distinguished.

original: 'dun pa la sogs pa dgu po 'di dag ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: 'dun pa la sogs pa dgu po 'di dag ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i yan lag go //
translated: These nine, beginning with will, are the members of the applications of mindfulness.

original: sems zhum pa ni khyad par thob par bya ba la bdag dman par sems pa'i sgo nas sgyid lug pa'o //
analyzed: sems zhum pa ni khyad par thob par bya ba la bdag dman par sems pa'i sgo nas sgyid lug pa'o //
translated: Depression is the discouragement of the mind that occurs when one thinks oneself unworthy of attaining the distinctive qualities of enlightenment.

original: gnod pas yongs su skyo ba ni sha sbrang dang sbrang bu la sogs pa'i gnod pas nyen pa mi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pas yongs su skyo ba ni sha sbrang dang sbrang bu la sogs pa'i gnod pas nyen pa mi bzod pa'o //
translated: Discouragement with regard to harm is the inability to bear the annoyance caused by gadflies, mosquitoes, etc.

original: cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa ni dge ba'i phyogs 'di tsam gyis chog go zhes phyir bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: cung zad tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa ni dge ba'i phyogs 'di tsam gyis chog go zhes phyir bzlog pa'o //
translated: Satisfaction with mere moral discipline and mere ritual is the turning away from the wholesome side with the thought, ‚ÄúThis much is enough.‚Äù

original: ltung bas yid la gcags pas ni 'gro ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa la shes bzhin med par spyod pa ste /
analyzed: ltung bas yid la gcags pas ni 'gro ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa la shes bzhin med par spyod pa ste /
translated: Lack of vigilance is the practice of going and returning, etc., without awareness.

original: sngar bslab pa dang 'gal nas phyis 'gyod pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bslab pa dang 'gal nas phyis 'gyod pa'o //
translated: Remorse is the regret that follows the violation of a rule of moral training.

original: brtson pa 'dor ba ni bag med pa'i nyes pas dge ba'i phyogs ji ltar brtsams pa la sbyor ba mthar mi 'byin pa'o //
analyzed: brtson pa 'dor ba ni bag med pa'i nyes pas dge ba'i phyogs ji ltar brtsams pa la sbyor ba mthar mi 'byin pa'o //
translated: Abandoning striving is the fault of heedlessness, because it does not bring to completion the application to whatever virtuous side has been begun.

original: 'bras bu ni go rims bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / rtag pa dang / bdag tu phyin ci log spang ba ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni go rims bzhin du dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams la gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / rtag pa dang / bdag tu phyin ci log spang ba ste /
translated: The results are, respectively, the abandonment of the four errors with regard to the applications of mindfulness: purity, happiness, permanence, and a self.

original: mi sdug pa bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi sdug pa bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one cultivates the perception of foulness.

original: gang ci tshor yang rung ste /
analyzed: gang ci tshor yang rung ste /
translated: Whatever is felt is suffering,

original: de ni 'di ltar sdug bsngal bar shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar sdug bsngal bar shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is recognized as such.

original: gnas dang dmigs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam par shes pa skad cig re re la gzhan du 'gyur bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas dang dmigs pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam par shes pa skad cig re re la gzhan du 'gyur bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one understands that consciousness changes from instant to instant due to the differences of abode, object, etc.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba chos tsam du zad de byed pa med par yongs su rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba chos tsam du zad de byed pa med par yongs su rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one understands that defilement and purification are merely phenomena, without an agent.

original: yang 'di dag gi 'bras bu ni go rims bzhin du bden pa bzhi la 'jug ste /
analyzed: yang 'di dag gi 'bras bu ni go rims bzhin du bden pa bzhi la 'jug ste /
translated: Moreover, their results are, respectively, the four noble truths,

original: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pas ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pas ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la 'jug ste /
translated: By the application of mindfulness to the body, one enters into the truth of suffering,

original: lus ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid gnas ngan len gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid gnas ngan len gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the body is characterized by the suffering of the formative forces and is distinguished by its impure nature.

original: 'di ltar de'i gnyen por gyur pa shin tu sbyangs pa ni lus nyid la khyad par can du 'byung ngo //üîΩtshor ba dran pa nye bar @63a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i gnyen por gyur pa shin tu sbyangs pa ni lus nyid la khyad par can du 'byung ngo // tshor ba dran pa nye bar @63a * //
translated: Thus, its antidote, namely, suppleness, arises in the body itself.

original: gzhag pas ni kun 'byung gi bden pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: gzhag pas ni kun 'byung gi bden pa la 'jug ste /
translated: By the application of mindfulness to sensation, one enters into the truth of origination,

original: phrad pa la sogs par srid pa ni bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phrad pa la sogs par srid pa ni bde ba la sogs pa'i tshor ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because craving for contact etc. is the basis of pleasant etc. sensation.

original: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag bas ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug ste /üîΩbdag med cing rnam par shes pa tsam med par 'gyur ba lta bas na /
analyzed: sems dran pa nye bar gzhag bas ni 'gog pa'i bden pa la 'jug ste / bdag med cing rnam par shes pa tsam med par 'gyur ba lta bas na /
translated: By the application of mindfulness to mind, one enters into the truth of cessation,

original: bdag chad par 'dogs pa'i sgo nas mya ngan las 'das pa la skrag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag chad par 'dogs pa'i sgo nas mya ngan las 'das pa la skrag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is not afraid of nirvƒÅ·πáa by way of the imputation of the annihilation of the self, since one sees that the non-existence of the self is merely the non-existence of consciousness.üîΩBy the application of mindfulness to the dharmas, one enters into the truth of the path, because one is not afraid of the path by way of the imputation of the selflessness of dharmas.

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas ni lam gyi bden pa la 'jug ste /
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pas ni lam gyi bden pa la 'jug ste /
translated: Through the application of mindfulness to dharmas, one enters the truth of the path,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos spong ba dang / gnyen po'i chos la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos spong ba dang / gnyen po'i chos la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one abandons dharmas that are counteragents and one relies on dharmas that are antidotes.

original: yang 'di dag gi 'bras bu ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos dang bral bar go rims bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang 'di dag gi 'bras bu ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dang chos dang bral bar go rims bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, their results should be understood as being the separation from body, sensation, thought, and dharmas, respectively,

original: de dag bsgoms pas lus la sogs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag bsgoms pas lus la sogs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because by cultivating those, one is separated from the negative tendencies of the categories of body and so on.

original: yang dag par spong ba rnams kyi dang po'i dmigs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs skyes pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag par spong ba rnams kyi dang po'i dmigs pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs skyes pa ste /
translated: The first of the right efforts focuses on the arising of counteragents,

original: des sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba'i phyir 'dun pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one generates aspiration in order to abandon arisen negative dharmas and nonvirtues.

original: gnyis pa'i dmigs pas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma skyes pa dang / gsum pa'i dmigs pa ni gnyen po ma skyes pa dang / bzhi pa'i dmigs pa ni gnyen po skyes pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i dmigs pas ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma skyes pa dang / gsum pa'i dmigs pa ni gnyen po ma skyes pa dang / bzhi pa'i dmigs pa ni gnyen po skyes pa ste /
translated: The second focuses on the nonarising of counteragents, the third focuses on the nonarising of antidotes, and the fourth focuses on the arising of antidotes.

original: ji ltar mdo sde las 'byung ba bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mdo sde las 'byung ba bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply them as they occur in the sutras.

original: 'dun pa skyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyis ni brtson 'grus bsgom pa gnas dang bcas pa yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: 'dun pa skyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams kyis ni brtson 'grus bsgom pa gnas dang bcas pa yongs su bstan to //
translated: The words ‚Äúarousing zeal‚Äù and so on indicate the cultivation of effort together with its basis.

original: de la gnas ni 'dun pa ste /
analyzed: de la gnas ni 'dun pa ste /
translated: Here, the basis is zeal.

original: de ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it precedes the undertaking of effort.

original: gang gi tshe zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pas gnyen po skyon med pa 'ba' zhig sgom pa de'i tshe 'bad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhi gnas kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pas gnyen po skyon med pa 'ba' zhig sgom pa de'i tshe 'bad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one cultivates only the faultless antidote by attention to the sign of serenity, then it is called ‚Äúexertion.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bying ba 'byung ba de bsal ba'i phyir dga' bar gyur pa la sogs pa'i yid la byed pa rnams kyis sems 'bar bar byed pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rgod pa byung ba na nang du sdud pa'i sgo nas sems 'dzin pa de'i tshe brtson 'grus rtsom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bying ba 'byung ba de bsal ba'i phyir dga' bar gyur pa la sogs pa'i yid la byed pa rnams kyis sems 'bar bar byed pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rgod pa byung ba na nang du sdud pa'i sgo nas sems 'dzin pa de'i tshe brtson 'grus rtsom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: When one stimulates the mind with the attentions of joy, etc., in order to dispel the fault of laxity that has arisen, and when one fixes the mind internally by way of collecting it in order to dispel the fault of excitedness that has arisen, then it is called ‚Äúthe undertaking of effort.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir bying ba dang rgod pa bsal ba'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu sems rab tu 'dzin pa dang / rab tu 'jog pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bying ba dang rgod pa bsal ba'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir de'i 'og tu sems rab tu 'dzin pa dang / rab tu 'jog pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the method for removing laxity and excitement, immediately after that, he mentions the utmost fixing and utmost placing of the mind.

original: 'bras bu ni yang dag pa'i spong ba dang po dang gnyis pa'i ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus @63b par nyams pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni yang dag pa'i spong ba dang po dang gnyis pa'i ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus @63b par nyams pa ste /
translated: The result of the first and second right efforts is the destruction of all the unfavorable side.

original: de gnyis kyis ji ltar mthun mthun du sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i chos rnams nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis ji ltar mthun mthun du sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'i chos rnams nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of them, one destroys, in whatever way is appropriate, the unfavorable and unwholesome dharmas that have arisen and those that have not yet arisen.

original: gsum pa'i ni gnyen po thob pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa'i ni gnyen po thob pa ste /
translated: The result of the third is the attainment of the antidote.

original: des dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of it, one generates the wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen.

original: bzhi pa'i ni gnyen po thob bas 'phel ba ste//
analyzed: bzhi pa'i ni gnyen po thob bas 'phel ba ste//
translated: The result of the fourth is the increase of the antidote.

original: des dge ba'i chos skyes pa spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des dge ba'i chos skyes pa spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of it, one causes the wholesome dharmas that have arisen not to be abandoned.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba rnams kyi dmigs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyis grub pa'i bya ba rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i bye brag gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba rnams kyi dmigs pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyis grub pa'i bya ba rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i bye brag gang yin pa'o //
translated: The object of the bases of psychic power is the specific action that is accomplished by concentration, such as the various kinds of psychic power.

original: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni gang gus par sbyor ba la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa ste /
analyzed: 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni gang gus par sbyor ba la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa ste /
translated: The concentration of aspiration is the touching of one-pointedness of mind based on devoted application.

original: gus par sbyor ba ni 'dun pa drag po dang rim gro cher byas te sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gus par sbyor ba ni 'dun pa drag po dang rim gro cher byas te sbyor ba'o //
translated: Devoted application is the application with intense aspiration and great respect.

original: brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin ni gang rgyun du sbyor ba la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi ting nge 'dzin ni gang rgyun du sbyor ba la brten nas sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa ste /
translated: The concentration of effort is the touching of one-pointedness of mind based on continuous application.

original: gang rtag tu sbyor zhing nam yang mi sbyor ba ma yin pa de ni brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang rtag tu sbyor zhing nam yang mi sbyor ba ma yin pa de ni brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is always applied and never not applied is called effort.

original: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin ni sngon gang gi tshe rabs gzhan na ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa la brten nas des sems kyi sa bon yongs su brtas pa'i phyir rang gi ngang gis ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes su mthun par gyur na sems rtse gcig pa nyid la
analyzed: sems kyi ting nge 'dzin ni sngon gang gi tshe rabs gzhan na ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa la brten nas des sems kyi sa bon yongs su brtas pa'i phyir rang gi ngang gis ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes su mthun par gyur na sems rtse gcig pa nyid la
translated: The concentration of mind is the one-pointedness of mind that occurs naturally in accordance with concentration, due to the development of the seed of mind from the cultivation of concentration in other lives in the past.

original: reg pa'o // rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa mngon par sgrub pa'i rgyu yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir yang dag par spong ba bsgom pa la 'dun pa skyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: reg pa'o // rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa mngon par sgrub pa'i rgyu yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir yang dag par spong ba bsgom pa la 'dun pa skyed do zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate the cause for the accomplishment of the bases of psychic power, he says: ‚Äúone generates will for the cultivation of the correct exertions.‚Äù

original: sems rab tu 'jog pa dang rab tu 'dzin zhes bya ba de ni 'dir brjod pa'i lugs kyi go rims su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'jog pa dang rab tu 'dzin zhes bya ba de ni 'dir brjod pa'i lugs kyi go rims su rig par bya'o //
translated: The statement: ‚Äúone settles the mind and one holds the mind‚Äù should be understood here in the order in which they are mentioned.üîΩTherein, the concentration of mind is that by which one settles the mind; the contact is the one-pointedness of mind.

original: de la sems kyi ting nge 'dzin ni gang sems rab tu 'jog pa ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems nyid kyis sems nang du 'dzin zhing zhi bar byed /
analyzed: de la sems kyi ting nge 'dzin ni gang sems rab tu 'jog pa ni sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg pa'o zhes bya ba ni sems nyid kyis sems nang du 'dzin zhing zhi bar byed /
translated: The mind itself holds the mind internally, it pacifies it,

original: sdud par byed /
analyzed: sdud par byed /
translated: it collects it,

original: 'thob par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'thob par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it obtains it‚Äîthis is the meaning.

original: dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni sems rab tu 'dzin pa na zhes bya ba ni chos la lhag mthong gi sgo nas sems 'bar bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni sems rab tu 'dzin pa na zhes bya ba ni chos la lhag mthong gi sgo nas sems 'bar bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The concentration of investigation is that by which one holds the mind; it is the burning up of the mind by means of the investigation of the dharmas‚Äîthis is the meaning.

original: bsgom pa ni 'dun pa la sogs pa spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni 'dun pa la sogs pa spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad goms par byed pa'o //
translated: Meditation is the cultivation of the eight formative forces of abandonment, such as will-power.

original: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad po de dag ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad po de dag ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: These eight formative forces of abandonment should be known as being of four types:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Cause,üîΩapplication,üîΩbenefit,üîΩand connection.

original: 'bad pa ni 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba dang dad pa'o //
analyzed: 'bad pa ni 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba dang dad pa'o //
translated: Cause refers to will-power, vigour, and faith.

original: de la 'dun pa ni rtsol ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa ni rtsol ba'i gnas so //
translated: Herein, will-power is the basis of vigour.

original: 'dun pa'i rgyu ni dad pa ste /üîΩ'di @64a * //
analyzed: 'dun pa'i rgyu ni dad pa ste / 'di @64a * //
translated: The cause of will-power is faith,üîΩbecause one who has faith is eager for the object.

original: ltar gang zag gang zhig don du gnyer bar 'gyur ba de ni de thob par bya ba'i phyir rtsol lo //
analyzed: ltar gang zag gang zhig don du gnyer bar 'gyur ba de ni de thob par bya ba'i phyir rtsol lo //
translated: One who is eager for the object exerts vigour in order to attain it.

original: de yod pa nyid la sogs pa yid ches pa med na don du gnyer bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod pa nyid la sogs pa yid ches pa med na don du gnyer bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one has no faith in the existence of the object, etc. one is not eager for it.

original: phan 'dogs pa ni shin tu sbyangs pa ste /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa ni shin tu sbyangs pa ste /
translated: Benefit refers to serenity,

original: des lus dang sems la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des lus dang sems la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it benefits the body and mind.

original: nye bar 'dogs pa ni dran pa dang shes bzhin te /
analyzed: nye bar 'dogs pa ni dran pa dang shes bzhin te /
translated: Connection refers to mindfulness and full awareness.

original: dmigs pa ma brjed pas sems rtse gcig pa nyid la 'jug pa dang / de la bag med par gyur na yongs su gcod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dmigs pa ma brjed pas sems rtse gcig pa nyid la 'jug pa dang / de la bag med par gyur na yongs su gcod pa'i phyir te /
translated: and because of the absence of heedlessness, there is the complete cutting off of the latter.

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: In due order.

original: gnyen po ni sems pa dang btang snyoms te /
analyzed: gnyen po ni sems pa dang btang snyoms te /
translated: The counteragent is will-power and equanimity.

original: sems rab tu 'dzin pa dang rab tu 'jog pa mngon bar 'du byed pas bying ba dang rgod pa 'byung ba yongs su spong ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa ni zhi gnas la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems rab tu 'dzin pa dang rab tu 'jog pa mngon bar 'du byed pas bying ba dang rgod pa 'byung ba yongs su spong ba dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa ni zhi gnas la sogs pa'i mtshan ma rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of the secondary defilements is due to the absence of torpor and excitability, because of the non-abandonment of the signs of calm etc.

original: yang 'dun pa la sogs pa'i sdud pa dang / g-yeng ba bzhi dang bcas par yongs su spangs pa la sogs pa sgom pa de la sdud pa'i gzhi ni lhag mthong dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: yang 'dun pa la sogs pa'i sdud pa dang / g-yeng ba bzhi dang bcas par yongs su spangs pa la sogs pa sgom pa de la sdud pa'i gzhi ni lhag mthong dang bral ba ste /
translated: Moreover, the basis of the latter is the absence of insight.

original: le lo'i sgo nas bying bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: le lo'i sgo nas bying bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes torpid through laziness.

original: g-yeng ba'i gzhi ni mi sdug pa'i 'du shes dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: g-yeng ba'i gzhi ni mi sdug pa'i 'du shes dang bral ba ste /
translated: The basis of distraction is the absence of the ideation of the unpleasant.

original: rgod pa'i sgo nas yang dag par rab tu mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: rgod pa'i sgo nas yang dag par rab tu mi 'dzin to //
