original: phyi ma dang snga ma'i 'du shes dang / steng dang 'og gi 'du shes su bya'o snyam pa dang / de ltar rnam par phye ba'i sems kun nas dkris pa med pas snang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bsgom par bya'i bdag gi sems mun pa can gyi tshul du ni mi 'gyur bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: phyi ma dang snga ma'i 'du shes dang / steng dang 'og gi 'du shes su bya'o snyam pa dang / de ltar rnam par phye ba'i sems kun nas dkris pa med pas snang ba dang ldan pa'i sems bsgom par bya'i bdag gi sems mun pa can gyi tshul du ni mi 'gyur bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Thus, one should cultivate the mind endowed with light, without the entanglement of the mind that is differentiated in this way, so that one's mind does not become like darkness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis go rims bzhin du @64b gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis go rims bzhin du @64b gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One taught this in order,

original: 'bras bu ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i yon tan bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i yon tan bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the result is the accomplishment of the qualities such as supernormal power, just as one wishes.

original: dbang po rnams kyi dmigs pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams te /
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi dmigs pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams te /
translated: The objects of the faculties are the four noble truths,

original: bden ba mngon par rtogs pa la sbyor bas bsdus pas de'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden ba mngon par rtogs pa la sbyor bas bsdus pas de'i rnam par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are included in the application to the realization of the truths, since they are transformed into that.

original: 'bras bu ni de'i dbang gis ring por mi thogs par mthong ba'i lam skye ba dang / de nyid kyi dus na nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la brten pa'i sems kyi rgyud do //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni de'i dbang gis ring por mi thogs par mthong ba'i lam skye ba dang / de nyid kyi dus na nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la brten pa'i sems kyi rgyud do //
translated: The result is that, by its power, the path of insight arises without delay, and at that time, the mind-stream is supported by the factors that contribute to enlightenment.

original: stobs rnams kyis dmigs pa la sogs pa ni dbang po rnams dang mthun no //
analyzed: stobs rnams kyis dmigs pa la sogs pa ni dbang po rnams dang mthun no //
translated: The objective supports, etc. of the powers are the same as those of the faculties.

original: 'bras bu la ni bye brag yod de /üîΩ'di ltar de dag gi 'bras bu de ni ji skad du /
analyzed: 'bras bu la ni bye brag yod de / 'di ltar de dag gi 'bras bu de ni ji skad du /
translated: But there is a difference in their results.

original: ma dad pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsrabs pas lhag par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: ma dad pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsrabs pas lhag par bstan pa ste /
translated: For, their result is taught as preeminent because the resistant tendencies of lack of faith, etc. are diminished.

original: de'i phyir 'di dag gis dmigs pa dang ngo bo nyid la sogs pa mthun du zin yang mi brdzi ba'i don gyi bye brag gis byang chub kyi phyogs gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag gis dmigs pa dang ngo bo nyid la sogs pa mthun du zin yang mi brdzi ba'i don gyi bye brag gis byang chub kyi phyogs gzhan nyid do //
translated: Therefore, although their objective supports, essential natures, etc. are the same, they are different from the factors that contribute to enlightenment because they have the special meaning of being invincible.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyi dmigs pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag gi yang dag pa nyid ji lta ba'o zhes bya ba ni don dam pa rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams kyi dmigs pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag gi yang dag pa nyid ji lta ba'o zhes bya ba ni don dam pa rnam par dag pa'i dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The object of the limbs of enlightenment is the reality of the four noble truths just as it is. This is the ultimate, pure object.

original: ngo bo nyid ni dran pa la sogs pa'i chos bdun no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni dran pa la sogs pa'i chos bdun no //
translated: The nature of the limbs of enlightenment is the seven factors of enlightenment, beginning with mindfulness.

original: de la dran pa ni gnas kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: de la dran pa ni gnas kyi yan lag ste /
translated: Among them, mindfulness is the limb of establishment,

original: dran pa nye bar gnas pa ni dge ba'i chos thams cad mngon bar brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gnas pa ni dge ba'i chos thams cad mngon bar brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when mindfulness is present, all wholesome factors are expressed.

original: chos rnam par 'byed pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: chos rnam par 'byed pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi yan lag ste /
translated: Discernment of phenomena is the limb of nature,

original: byang chub kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the characteristic of enlightenment.

original: brtson 'grus ni nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni nges par 'byung ba'i yan lag ste /

original: des bgrod pa ji srid par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bgrod pa ji srid par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //

original: dga' ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: dga' ba ni phan yon gyi yan lag ste /

original: des sems kyi rgyud tshim par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des sems kyi rgyud tshim par byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: shin tu sbyangs pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang btang snyoms ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang btang snyoms ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i yan lag ste /

analyzed: de la shin tu sbyangs pas ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur te /

original: des gnas ngan len 'jig pa'i phyir ro //

original: ting nge 'dzin ni kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur te /

original: de la gnas 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

original: btang snyoms ni kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ste /

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyor ba'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa rnam par sbyor ba'i yan lag ste /

analyzed: des mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par sgrub pa'i phyir ro //

original: bsgom pa ni byang chub kyi yan lag bzhin te /

translated: Meditation is like the limbs of enlightenment.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is said:

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dben pa la gnas pa bsgom pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dben pa la gnas pa bsgom pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe right view is meditation that is based on seclusion.‚Äù

original: lam dang chos kyi gnas rnams kyi don ni snga ma bzhin du bshad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lam dang chos kyi gnas rnams kyi don ni snga ma bzhin du bshad par rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the path and the stations of the Dharma should be understood as explained above.

original: zhi gnas ni sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas ni sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: Tranquility is the nine states of mind that are settled.

original: de la phyi rol gyi dmigs pa rnams las phyir blan nas nang du mi g-yeng bar gang dang po nyid du sems nye bar 'dogs pa ni 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: de la phyi rol gyi dmigs pa rnams las phyir blan nas nang du mi g-yeng bar gang dang po nyid du sems nye bar 'dogs pa ni 'jog pa'o //
translated: Among them, first of all, the mind is placed by being drawn in from external objects and not distracted outwardly.

original: de ltar sems g-yo ba rags pa thog ma nyid du nye bar brtags pa de dmigs pa de nyid la rgyun gyi tshul dang phra bar byed pas mngon par bsdus pa ni rgyun du 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar sems g-yo ba rags pa thog ma nyid du nye bar brtags pa de dmigs pa de nyid la rgyun gyi tshul dang phra bar byed pas mngon par bsdus pa ni rgyun du 'jog pa'o //
translated: When the coarse agitation of the mind is first examined in this way, it is placed continuously by making it subtle in relation to that very object.

original: brjed nas phyi rol tu g-yengs par gyur pa de yang phyir bkug pa ste /
analyzed: brjed nas phyi rol tu g-yengs par gyur pa de yang phyir bkug pa ste /
translated: When it is distracted outwardly by forgetfulness, it is drawn back in again.

original: brlan te 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: brlan te 'jog pa'o //
translated: It is placed by being moistened.

original: sems phyi rol tu mi 'phro bar bya ba'i phyir thog ma nyid du dran ba nye bar gnas pa ni nye bar 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: sems phyi rol tu mi 'phro bar bya ba'i phyir thog ma nyid du dran ba nye bar gnas pa ni nye bar 'jog pa'o //
translated: In order to prevent the mind from scattering externally, first of all one should establish mindfulness, which is the placing.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i rgyu gzugs la sogs pa la nyes dmigs kyi 'du shes kyi dbang du byas nas thog ma nyid du sems rab tu 'phror mi ster ba ni dul bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i rgyu gzugs la sogs pa la nyes dmigs kyi 'du shes kyi dbang du byas nas thog ma nyid du sems rab tu 'phror mi ster ba ni dul bar byed pa'o //
translated: Having taken hold of the idea of the danger in form, etc., which is the cause of distraction, one should not allow the mind to scatter in the beginning, which is the taming.

original: sems 'khrug par byed pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par rtog par byed pa la nyes dmigs su lta bas 'phror mi ster ba ni zhi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems 'khrug par byed pa nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par rtog par byed pa la nyes dmigs su lta bas 'phror mi ster ba ni zhi bar byed pa'o //
translated: By seeing the danger in the discursive thoughts which are the secondary defilements that disturb the mind, one should not allow it to scatter, which is the pacification.

original: brjed nas rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa kun tu 'byung ba na de dang du mi len ba ni rnam par zhi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: brjed nas rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa kun tu 'byung ba na de dang du mi len ba ni rnam par zhi bar byed pa'o //
translated: When discursive thought, etc., arise through forgetfulness, one should not consent to them, which is the complete pacification.

original: mngon par 'du byed pas skabs med cing @66a * //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pas skabs med cing @66a * //
translated: One should not allow the mind to scatter in the beginning, which is the taming.üîΩBy seeing the danger in the discursive thoughts which are the secondary defilements that disturb the mind, one should not allow it to scatter, which is the pacification.

original: bar chad med par ting nge 'dzin rgyun du brlan te 'jog pa ni rtse gcig tu byed pa'o //
analyzed: bar chad med par ting nge 'dzin rgyun du brlan te 'jog pa ni rtse gcig tu byed pa'o //
translated: When discursive thought, etc., arise through forgetfulness, one should not consent to them, which is the complete pacification.

original: shin tu goms pa'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa med cing lhun gyis grub par sems kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun g-yeng ba med par 'byung ba ni mnyam par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu goms pa'i phyir mngon par 'du byed pa med cing lhun gyis grub par sems kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyun g-yeng ba med par 'byung ba ni mnyam par 'jog pa'o //
translated: It is concentration of mind, which occurs without distraction, in a stream that is effortless and spontaneous, because of complete familiarity.üîΩInsight is as follows:

original: lhag mthong ni 'di lta ste ;
analyzed: lhag mthong ni 'di lta ste ;
translated: It is the discernment of phenomena, etc.üîΩHere, discernment is the discernment of the multiplicity of phenomena.üîΩIt is the discernment of the specific characteristics of phenomena.

original: chos rnams la rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams la rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is the discernment of the general characteristics of phenomena.üîΩIt is the discernment of the investigation of meanings.üîΩIt is the discernment of the investigation of phenomena.üîΩIt is the discernment of the investigation of reasoning.üîΩIt is the discernment of the investigation of g√±osis.üîΩIt is the discernment of the investigation of superknowledge.

original: de la dpyod pa rnam par sbyong ba la dmigs pa'am //üîΩmkhas pa la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: de la dpyod pa rnam par sbyong ba la dmigs pa'am // mkhas pa la dmigs pa'am /
translated: It is the discernment of the investigation of the direct realization of that which is to be directly realized.üîΩIt is the discernment of the investigation of the path.

original: nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'ang rung ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'ang rung ste /
translated: It is the discernment of the investigation of the accomplishment of the purpose.üîΩIt is the discernment of the investigation of the accomplishment of one‚Äôs own aim.üîΩIt is the discernment of the investigation of the accomplishment of the aims of others.üîΩIt is the discernment of the investigation of the accomplishment of the aims of both oneself and others.

original: ji snyed yod pas rnam par 'byed pa'o //üîΩji lta ba bzhin du yod pas rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //üîΩrnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid la byed pa shes rab dang bcas pas mtshan mar byed pa ni yongs su rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ji snyed yod pas rnam par 'byed pa'o // ji lta ba bzhin du yod pas rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o // rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid la byed pa shes rab dang bcas pas mtshan mar byed pa ni yongs su rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: It is the discernment of the investigation of the accomplishment of the aim of the aim.üîΩIt is the discernment of the investigation of the accomplishment of the aim of the accomplishment.üîΩIt is the discernment of the investigation of the accomplishment of the aim of the path.üîΩIt is the discernment of the investigation of the accomplishment of the aim of direct realization.üîΩIt is the discernment of the investigation of the accomplishment of the aim of the investigation.üîΩIt is the discernment of the investigation of the accomplishment of the aim of the accomplishment of the aim.

original: kun tu rtog pa ni yongs su dpyod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa ni yongs su dpyod par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the discernment of the investigation of the accomplishment of the aim of the accomplishment of the accomplishment.üîΩIt is the discernment of the investigation of the accomplishment of the aim of the path of the accomplishment of the accomplishment of the accomplishment.üîΩIt is the discernment of the investigation of the accomplishment of the aim of the accomplishment of the accomplishment of the accomplishment.üîΩIt is the discernment of the investigation of the accomplishment of the aim of the accomplishment of the accomplishment of the accomplishment of the accomplishment.üîΩIt is the discernment of the investigation of the accomplishment of the aim of the accomplishment of the accomplishment of the accomplishment of the accomplishment of the accomplishment.üîΩIt is the discernment of the investigation of the accomplishment of the aim of the accomplishment of the accomplishment of the accomplishment of the accomplishment of the accomplishment of the accomplishment.

original: yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la brten nas lam bzhir 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni lam bzhi bsten pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: yang zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la brten nas lam bzhir 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni lam bzhi bsten pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: This is from the perspective of cultivating the four paths.

original: de la dang po ni zhi gnas thob pa'i phyir 'dug bzhin du sems 'jog pa nas mnyam par 'jog pa'i bar dang / lhag mthong ma thob pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin de la brten nas phyis de bzhin du 'dug ste /
analyzed: de la dang po ni zhi gnas thob pa'i phyir 'dug bzhin du sems 'jog pa nas mnyam par 'jog pa'i bar dang / lhag mthong ma thob pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin de la brten nas phyis de bzhin du 'dug ste /
translated: The first is when, in order to obtain calm abiding, you place the mind in meditative equipoise, up to and including mental stabilization, but you have not obtained insight.

original: chos de dag la rnam par 'byed pa nas yongs su dpyod par byed pa'i bar ngu'o ;
analyzed: chos de dag la rnam par 'byed pa nas yongs su dpyod par byed pa'i bar ngu'o ;
translated: In dependence on that concentration, later you sit in that way and you discern those phenomena, up to and including fully discerning them.

original: / gnyis pa ni de las zlog par byed par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: / gnyis pa ni de las zlog par byed par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should understand that the second is the opposite of that.

original: gsum pa ni gnyi ga ma thob pa ste gnyi ga la brtson par byed do //
analyzed: gsum pa ni gnyi ga ma thob pa ste gnyi ga la brtson par byed do //
translated: The third is when you have not obtained either, and you strive for both.

original: ji ltar zhe na thos pa 'dzin pa'i sgo nas lhag mthong la brtson par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na thos pa 'dzin pa'i sgo nas lhag mthong la brtson par byed do //
translated: How is that? You strive for insight by way of retaining what you have heard.

original: de sngon du 'gro bas zhi gnas la brtson par byed do //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro bas zhi gnas la brtson par byed do //
translated: That precedes your striving for calm abiding.

original: bzhi ba ni gnyi ga thob pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi ba ni gnyi ga thob pa'o //
translated: The fourth is when you have obtained both.

original: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po ni sbyor ba'i lam nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pas bsdus pa dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig bco lnga po dag la dbang po gang yin pa ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po ni sbyor ba'i lam nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pas bsdus pa dang / mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig bco lnga po dag la dbang po gang yin pa ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The faculty producing complete knowledge of the unknown is the faculty of those on the path of preparation subsumed by the factors conducive to penetrative insight and the faculty of the fifteen moments of the path of seeing.

original: yid kyi dbang po dang dad pa la sogs pa lnga dang mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa gnas kyi bye brag gis ji ltar mthun mthun du bde ba dang yid mi bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyi dbang po dang dad pa la sogs pa lnga dang mi lcogs pa med pa la sogs pa gnas kyi bye brag gis ji ltar mthun mthun du bde ba dang yid mi bde ba dang btang snyoms kyi dbang po rnams las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: They are the five faculties of the mental faculty and faith and so on and any one of the faculties of pleasure, mental satisfaction and equanimity according to the specific level such as unrestricted access concentration and so on.

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ni sbyor ba'i dus na nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i rjes la rnam par thar pa mchog 'dod pas bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ni sbyor ba'i dus na nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i rjes la rnam par thar pa mchog 'dod pas bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: The faculty of mental dissatisfaction is to be known as the faculty of those on the path of preparation subsumed by the factors conducive to penetrative insight that arise after the state of heat.

original: de dag @66b ni srid pas dbang po rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: de dag @66b ni srid pas dbang po rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: They are the ten faculties that exist.

original: de kho na sngon mi shes pa kun shes par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pas mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de kho na sngon mi shes pa kun shes par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pas mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the faculty producing complete knowledge of the unknown because it is engaged in producing complete knowledge of all that is unknown.

original: dbang po rnam pa bcu po 'di dag nyid mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig bcu drug pa nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba'i bar du slob pa'i lam de la kun shes pa'i dbang po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dbang po rnam pa bcu po 'di dag nyid mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig bcu drug pa nas rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin ces bya ba'i bar du slob pa'i lam de la kun shes pa'i dbang po zhes bya ste /
translated: These ten faculties are called the faculty of complete knowledge on the learner‚Äôs path from the sixteenth moment of mind of the path of seeing until the vajra like concentration.

original: sngon ma mthong ba'i shes bya med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon ma mthong ba'i shes bya med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no object of knowledge that was not previously seen.

original: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ma rtogs par dbang po rnam pa dgu po de dag nyid mi slob pa'i lam la kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i dbang po ma rtogs par dbang po rnam pa dgu po de dag nyid mi slob pa'i lam la kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po zhes bya ste /
translated: When the faculty of mental dissatisfaction is not realized, these nine faculties are called the faculty possessing complete knowledge on the path of no learning.

original: kun shes pa dang ldan pa ni dgra bcom pa'i dbang po yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: kun shes pa dang ldan pa ni dgra bcom pa'i dbang po yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because the faculty of an arhat possesses complete knowledge.

original: / bsgom pa'i lam gyi skabs su 'di yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: / bsgom pa'i lam gyi skabs su 'di yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: This should be stated in the context of the path of meditation.

original: gong ma'i sa pa'i lam la mngon du byed pa bsgom pa na sa 'og ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon sum du ma gyur pa rnams kyang bsgom par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gong ma'i sa pa'i lam la mngon du byed pa bsgom pa na sa 'og ma'i dge ba'i rtsa ba mngon sum du ma gyur pa rnams kyang bsgom par 'gyur te /
translated: When one cultivates the path of the higher stages, one also cultivates the roots of virtue of the lower stages that have not yet been actualized.

original: de dag la dbang 'byor ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la dbang 'byor ba thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one attains mastery over them.

original: dbang 'byor ba ni mchog tu sbyangs pa thob pa ste /
analyzed: dbang 'byor ba ni mchog tu sbyangs pa thob pa ste /
translated: Mastery is the attainment of supreme purification.

original: mngon sum du byed pa ni dbang du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa ni dbang du rig par bya'o //
translated: Actualization should be understood as mastery.üîΩThe path of conclusion is the termination of all negative reflex actions.

original: mthar phyin pa'i lam ni gnas ngan len thams cad rgyun chad pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba de la gnas ngan len thams cad ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi yin te /
analyzed: mthar phyin pa'i lam ni gnas ngan len thams cad rgyun chad pa zhes rgya cher 'byung ba de la gnas ngan len thams cad ni nyi shu rtsa bzhi yin te /
translated: There are twenty four negative reflex actions.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mngon par brjod pa'i gnas ngan len ni kun tu 'gro ba ni mig la sogs pa chos thams cad kyi ming la mngon bar zhen pa'i bag chags kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa thog ma med pa'i dus nas rjes su zhugs pa gang yin pa
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa'i gnas ngan len ni kun tu 'gro ba ni mig la sogs pa chos thams cad kyi ming la mngon bar zhen pa'i bag chags kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la gnas pa thog ma med pa'i dus nas rjes su zhugs pa gang yin pa
translated: The negative reflex action of verbal expression is the habitual propensity for attachment to the names of all things, eyes, etc., which is based in the store consciousness and has operated since beginningless time.

original: ste / de las mig la sogs pa'i chos ming la mngon par zhen pa dang bcas pa rnams yang dang yang 'byung ba'i phyir te de ni spros pa'i bag chags zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ste / de las mig la sogs pa'i chos ming la mngon par zhen pa dang bcas pa rnams yang dang yang 'byung ba'i phyir te de ni spros pa'i bag chags zhes bya'o //
translated: because the phenomena of the eye, etc. , which are associated with the adherence to the nominal, arise again and again. This is called the latent impressions of conceptual differentiation.

original: tshor ba'i gnas ngan len ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i tshor ba rnams kyi bag chags so //
analyzed: tshor ba'i gnas ngan len ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i tshor ba rnams kyi bag chags so //
translated: The latent impressions of feeling are the latent impressions of contaminated feelings.

original: nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi bag la nyal lo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i gnas ngan len ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi bag la nyal lo //
translated: The latent impressions of the afflictions are the proclivities of the afflictions.

original: las kyi gnas ngan len ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i las rnams kyi bag chags so //
analyzed: las kyi gnas ngan len ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i las rnams kyi bag chags so //
translated: The latent impressions of karma are the latent impressions of contaminated karma.

original: rnam par smin pa'i gnas ngan len ni rnam par smin pa'i lus las su mi rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i gnas ngan len ni rnam par smin pa'i lus las su mi rung ba nyid do //
translated: The latent impressions of karmic maturation are the unserviceability of the body that is the karmic maturation.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len ni nyon mongs pa mi bzad cing rgyun ring ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len ni nyon mongs pa mi bzad cing rgyun ring ba'o //
translated: The latent impressions of the obscuration of the afflictions are the afflictions that are intense and long-lasting.

original: las kyi sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len ni lam gyi bar chad byed pa mtshams med pa la sogs pa'i las kyi sgrib pa nyid do //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len ni lam gyi bar chad byed pa mtshams med pa la sogs pa'i las kyi sgrib pa nyid do //
translated: The latent impressions of the obscuration of karma are the obscurations of karma, such as the actions of immediate retribution, that create obstacles to the path.

original: rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan @67a * //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa'i gnas ngan @67a * //
translated: The obscurations to the fully ripenedüîΩ

original: len ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang mi mthun pa sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i lus thob pa'o //üîΩsgrib pa'i gnas ngan len ni dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'i bar chad byed pa 'dod pa la 'dun pa la sogs pas zil gyis gnon pa nyid do //
analyzed: len ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang mi mthun pa sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'i lus thob pa'o // sgrib pa'i gnas ngan len ni dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba'i bar chad byed pa 'dod pa la 'dun pa la sogs pas zil gyis gnon pa nyid do //
translated: The 'habitual tendencies of the maturation-obstruction' are the acquisition of a body in the hells, etc. , which is not in accord with the realization of the Truths.üîΩThe 'habitual tendencies of the obstruction-obstruction' are the subjugation by craving for sense-objects, etc. , which are obstacles to the application to the side of virtue.

original: rtog pa'i gnas ngan len ni rab tu 'byung ba la gags byed pa 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas zil byis gnon pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtog pa'i gnas ngan len ni rab tu 'byung ba la gags byed pa 'dod pa la rnam par rtog pa la sogs pas zil byis gnon pa nyid do //
translated: The 'habitual tendencies of the discursive thought' are the subjugation by discursive thoughts about sense-objects, etc. , which are obstacles to going forth.

original: zas kyi gnas ngan len ni za ha cang nyung ba dang mang du zos pas sbyor ba'i 'os sum gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: zas kyi gnas ngan len ni za ha cang nyung ba dang mang du zos pas sbyor ba'i 'os sum gyur ba nyid do //
translated: The 'habitual tendencies of food' are the unfitness for application due to eating too little or too much.

original: 'khrig pa'i gnas ngan len ni gnyis kyis gnyis phrad pa las gyur pa dang / lus dang sems la gnod pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrig pa'i gnas ngan len ni gnyis kyis gnyis phrad pa las gyur pa dang / lus dang sems la gnod pa'o //
translated: The 'habitual tendencies of sexual intercourse' are the harm to body and mind which results from the union of two with two.

original: rmi lam gyi gnas ngan len ni gnyid las gyur ba'i lus sems po nyid do //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gnas ngan len ni gnyid las gyur ba'i lus sems po nyid do //
translated: The 'habitual tendencies of dreams' are the unfitness of body and mind which results from sleep.

original: nad kyi gnas ngan len ni khams ma snyoms pa las gyur ba'i nyams rab tu mi bde ba nyid do //
analyzed: nad kyi gnas ngan len ni khams ma snyoms pa las gyur ba'i nyams rab tu mi bde ba nyid do //
translated: The negative reflex is the extreme discomfort that results from an imbalance of the elements.

original: rga ba'i gnas ngan len ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba las gyur ba'i dbang med pa nyid do //
analyzed: rga ba'i gnas ngan len ni 'byung bar 'gyur ba las gyur ba'i dbang med pa nyid do //
translated: The negative reflex of aging is the loss of control that results from the change in the primary elements.

original: 'chi ba'i gnas ngan len ni 'chi ba na dbang po thams cad 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i gnas ngan len ni 'chi ba na dbang po thams cad 'khrug pa'o //
translated: The negative reflex of death is the disturbance of all the faculties at the moment of death.

original: yongs su ngal ba'i gnas ngan len ni ha cang 'gro ba las gyur ba'i lus dub pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su ngal ba'i gnas ngan len ni ha cang 'gro ba las gyur ba'i lus dub pa'o //
translated: The negative reflex of fatigue is the exhaustion of the body that results from overexertion.üîΩThe negative reflex of verbal expression is the agitation of the mind that results from the desire to speak.

original: gnas ngan len bstan pa ni mngon par brjod pa'i gnas ngan len la sogs pa 'di dag dang ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar te /
analyzed: gnas ngan len bstan pa ni mngon par brjod pa'i gnas ngan len la sogs pa 'di dag dang ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar te /
translated: The negative reflex of the passions is the agitation of the mind that results from the passions.

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de yang bar chad med pa ste /

analyzed: khyab pa ni shes bya thams cad kyi spyi'i de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //

translated: The BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúFor example, it is like a great rock that is not rotten, not cracked, not hollow, and is very solid.‚Äù

original: gnas ma lus par gyur pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gnas ma lus par gyur pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The transformation of the basis is threefold:

analyzed: de bzhin nyid du gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: bya ba'i lhag ma yod pa'i phyir slob pa zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i lhag ma yod pa'i phyir slob pa zhes kyang bya'o //

original: gang gi tshe khams gsum pa la 'dod chags dang bral ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma lus par gyur bar bsal ba de'i tshe lam gyi ngo bo nyid kyi gnas gyur pa yongs su rdzogs par rnam par gzhag go //

translated: When one is free from attachment to the three realms, and when the entire class of adverse elements has been eliminated, then the transformation of the nature of the path is fully accomplished.

original: gnas ngan len gyi gnas gyur pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi bag la nyal gyi bag chags dang bral bar gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas ngan len gyi gnas gyur pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi bag la nyal gyi bag chags dang bral bar gyur bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The transformation of the basis of depravity should be understood as the transformation of the store consciousness, which is free from the propensities of all the passions.

original: zad par gyur nas shes pa'am /
analyzed: zad par gyur nas shes pa'am /
translated: It is knowledge of extinction when there is extinction.

original: yul de la shes pa gang yin pa de ni zad pa shes pa ste /üîΩde ni 'di skad du kun nas 'byung ba ma lus par spangs nas shes pa gang yin pa dang / de'i gnas skabs na rgyu 'gog pa la dmigs pa @68a * //

translated: It is knowledge of extinction when there is knowledge of that object.

original: ni zad pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ni zad pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is what is meant: when there is knowledge of the extinction of all the outflows, and when there is knowledge that has as its object the cessation of the cause of the outflows, that is called knowledge of extinction.

original: de bzhin du mi skye bar gyur nas shes pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi skye bar gyur nas shes pa'am /
translated: It is knowledge of nonproduction when there is nonproduction.

original: yul de la shes pa gang yin pa de ni mi skye ba shes pa ste /
analyzed: yul de la shes pa gang yin pa de ni mi skye ba shes pa ste /
translated: That knowledge of the object is knowledge of nonarising.

original: phyi ma la sdug bsngal thams cad gtan du mi skye ba'i chos nyid du gyur nas shes pa gang yin pa de ni bden pa gzhan la dmigs pa yang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma la sdug bsngal thams cad gtan du mi skye ba'i chos nyid du gyur nas shes pa gang yin pa de ni bden pa gzhan la dmigs pa yang yin pa'o //
translated: That knowledge of the object is knowledge of the other truths.

original: yang na gang sdug bsngal gyi bden ba la mi skye bar dmigs pa de mi skye bar shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na gang sdug bsngal gyi bden ba la mi skye bar dmigs pa de mi skye bar shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or, that knowledge of the truth of suffering as nonarising is called knowledge of nonarising.

original: mi slob pa'i chos bcu ni mi slob pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po lnga'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i chos bcu ni mi slob pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i phung po lnga'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The ten qualities of no more learning are from the perspective of the five aggregates of morality and so on of no more learning.

original: de la mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba rnams ni mi slob pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: de la mi slob pa'i yang dag pa'i ngag dang las kyi mtha' dang 'tsho ba rnams ni mi slob pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po'o //
translated: Among them, right speech, right action and right livelihood of no more learning are the aggregate of morality of no more learning.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin ni ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po'o //
translated: Right mindfulness and right samadhi are the aggregate of samadhi of no more learning.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang rtog pa dang rtsol ba rnams ni shes rab kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang rtog pa dang rtsol ba rnams ni shes rab kyi phung po'o //
translated: Right view, right thought, and right effort are the aggregate of wisdom.

original: yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba ni rnam par grol ba'i phung po'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i rnam par grol ba ni rnam par grol ba'i phung po'o //
translated: Right liberation is the aggregate of liberation.

original: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po'o //
translated: Right knowledge is the aggregate of the vision of the awareness of liberation.

original: yang lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang mtshan nyid bzhi'o //
analyzed: yang lam gyi bden pa'i rnam pa bzhi dang mtshan nyid bzhi'o //
translated: There are also four aspects and four characteristics of the truth of the path.

original: de la 'dis de kho na'i lam tshol bas lam mo //
analyzed: de la 'dis de kho na'i lam tshol bas lam mo //
translated: Here, it is the path because it seeks thatness.

original: rigs pa ma yin par gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa sa rigs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin par gyur pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi gnyen por gyur pa sa rigs pa'o //
translated: It is right because it is the antidote to the afflictions that have become wrong.

original: de kho na khong du ma chud pa'i nyes pas mi rtag pa la rtag pa la sogs par phyin ci log pa rnams kyis phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i sems phyin ci log med pa de kho na khong du ma chud pa la 'jog pas sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na khong du ma chud pa'i nyes pas mi rtag pa la rtag pa la sogs par phyin ci log pa rnams kyis phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i sems phyin ci log med pa de kho na khong du ma chud pa la 'jog pas sgrub pa'o //
translated: It is accomplishment because it establishes the mind that has become wrong, which is mistaken about impermanence as permanence, etc., due to the fault of not understanding thatness, in thatness, which is not mistaken.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i gnas rtag pa brtan du bar 'gro bas nges par 'byin ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i gnas rtag pa brtan du bar 'gro bas nges par 'byin ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúdefinite release‚Äù because it goes to the place of definite release, which is permanent and stable.

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa rnams la mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnam pa bcu drug ni 'jig rten pa yang yod 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yod de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa rnams la mi rtag pa la sogs pa rnam pa bcu drug ni 'jig rten pa yang yod 'jig rten las 'das pa yang yod de /
translated: The sixteen aspects of the truths of suffering, etc., such as impermanence, exist both in the mundane and supramundane paths.

original: de la 'jig rten pa rnams ni shes bya la legs par ma zhugs pa dang / sgrub pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa rnams ni shes bya la legs par ma zhugs pa dang / sgrub pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa ste /

original: de bzhin nyid ma rtogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal yod pa dang / mngon par brjod pa'i sgo nas spros pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ma rtogs pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal yod pa dang / mngon par brjod pa'i sgo nas spros pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are not the realization of reality, they have the latent potential for the afflictions, and they are elaborated through verbal description.

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are, respectively.

original: bzlog pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ste /
translated: The supramundane ones are the opposite of those.

original: rgas par zhugs pa dang / sgrib pa med par gyur nas rnam par mi rtog pas 'jig rten pa @68b rnams las khyad par du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgas par zhugs pa dang / sgrib pa med par gyur nas rnam par mi rtog pas 'jig rten pa @68b rnams las khyad par du 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de dag rnam par mi rtog na ji ltar shes bya la legs par zhugs par gyur zhe na /

analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to the aspects of suffering, etc.

original: bden pa rnam par nges pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa rnam par nges pa'o //
translated: This is the determination of the truths.

original: chos rnam par nges pa la chos ni gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis te /
analyzed: chos rnam par nges pa la chos ni gsung rab tu gtogs pa yan lag bcu gnyis te /

original: de la mdo'i sde ni gang bzhed pa'i don smos pa'i tshul gyis rkyang bar gsungs pa'o //üîΩci'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas bzhed pa'i don rnam par phye ste /

original: ma gsungs she na /
analyzed: ma gsungs she na /

analyzed: smas pa / phan yon bcu gzigs nas de bzhin gshegs pa smos pa'i tshul gyis chos ston te /

analyzed: rnam par gzhag par sla ba ni ston pas go bar bya ba'i don rnam pa mang du rnam par gzhag pa mdor bsdus te /
translated: It is easy to set forth, because the many topics to be understood by the teacher are set forth in brief,

original: tshegs chung ngus rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshegs chung ngus rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: bshad sla ba ni tshig nyung ngus don chen po rgyas par go bar byed pa'i phyir te /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: 'jog pa dang / rgyun du 'jog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //

analyzed: nyen pas kyang gzung sla ba'o // chos la gus pas myur du tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa ni chos 'di dag bsgoms pas shes par bya ba yin par rtogs nas gus pa skyes pa chos de la gces spras su bya ba'i sgo nas dad pa la sogs pa'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs par
translated: It is easy to grasp even for the dull-witted.

original: byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It quickly brings about the completion of the stores, because, having understood that these teachings are to be known through meditation, one generates respect, and then, by cherishing those teachings, one completes the stores of merit and wisdom.

original: myur du chos nyid rtogs par 'gyur ba ni de ltar gces spras su bya ba sbyor ba'i shes rab rno bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myur du chos nyid rtogs par 'gyur ba ni de ltar gces spras su bya ba sbyor ba'i shes rab rno bar gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One quickly realizes reality because one has become sharp in the wisdom of application which is so cherished.

original: dkon mchog rnams la shes nas dad pa thob pa ni bstan pa la legs par rnam par gnas par khong du chud nas ston pa la sogs pa la dad pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkon mchog rnams la shes nas dad pa thob pa ni bstan pa la legs par rnam par gnas par khong du chud nas ston pa la sogs pa la dad pa skye ba'i phyir ro //

translated: Great action refers to the accomplishment of the deeds of a buddha through the correct teaching of enlightenment and so on for as long as samsara exists.üîΩThe Vaibhasikas say that the category of texts that clearly teaches the nature of the four truths is the category of sutra.üîΩThe category of texts that teaches the nature of the four truths indirectly is the category of giramatikas.üîΩThe category of texts that teaches the nature of the four truths through stories is the category of nidana.üîΩThe category of texts that teaches the nature of the four truths through stories that are related to the subject matter is the category of avadana.

original: gleng gzhi'i sde ni byung ba dang bcas pa'i bslab pa bcas pa gsungs pa bsdus pa ni 'dul ba'i sde snod do //üîΩrtogs pa brjod pa la sogs pa ni de'i 'khor du rigs par bya'o //

analyzed: de ni gzhan gyi sgra las shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Consciousness arises from the sound of another‚Äôs words.

original: de'i 'og tu dran pa gnas te ji ltar thos pa bzhin du rjes su dran pas goms par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dran pa gnas te ji ltar thos pa bzhin du rjes su dran pas goms par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: After that, memory is the base, because one becomes familiar with the teaching by remembering it as it was heard.

original: de'i 'og tu bag chags gnas te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bag chags gnas te /
translated: After that, the habitual tendencies are the base.

original: de'i rjes su dran pa med kyang goms pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis phyis snang bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes su dran pa med kyang goms pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis phyis snang bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and later, even without mindfulness, they appear again by the power of habitual tendencies.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams gcig gi grogs gcig yin pa'i tshul gyis phung po la sogs pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i don gyi rnam pa rnams kyi mdo sde la sogs pa'i dmigs pa yang dag par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams gcig gi grogs gcig yin pa'i tshul gyis phung po la sogs pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i don gyi rnam pa rnams kyi mdo sde la sogs pa'i dmigs pa yang dag par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Association is the correct understanding of the objective supports of the sutras, etc. by the mind and mental factors in the manner of mutual assistance.

original: chos la dmigs pa rab tu dbye ba ni khyab pa'i dmigs pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: chos la dmigs pa rab tu dbye ba ni khyab pa'i dmigs pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The classification of objective supports in regard to the Dharma is fourfold: the objective supports of pervasiveness, of the accomplishment of purpose, of the absence of error, and of the counteragent.

original: khyab pa'i dmigs pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: khyab pa'i dmigs pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gzugs brnyan la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The objective support of pervasiveness is fourfold, due to the distinctions of the conceptual image, etc.

original: de la mos pa yid la byed pa ni gang gcig tu 'jig rten pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la mos pa yid la byed pa ni gang gcig tu 'jig rten pa'i yid la byed pa'o //
translated: Among them, attention given to devotion is that which is exclusively mundane.

original: de kho na yid la byed pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / de kho na'i rjes las thob pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na yid la byed pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / de kho na'i rjes las thob pa'o //
translated: Attention given to reality is supramundane and the aftermath of that.

original: chos rnams kyi ji snyed yod pa ni chos thams cad kyi dngos po 'di dag tu zad do zhes gang zhes bya rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi ji snyed yod pa ni chos thams cad kyi dngos po 'di dag tu zad do zhes gang zhes bya rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: The diversity of things is the classification of all things into these categories.

original: 'di ltar phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ltar phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams so //
translated: Thus, the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa ni rnam par 'di dag tu de shes par bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du yod pa ni rnam par 'di dag tu de shes par bya ba ste /
translated: The reality of things is to be known by way of these categories.

original: 'di ltar bden pa'i sgo nas phung po dang khams dang skye mched de dag nyid ji ltar mthun mthun du sdug bsngal nyid du shes par bya ba nas lam gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bden pa'i sgo nas phung po dang khams dang skye mched de dag nyid ji ltar mthun mthun du sdug bsngal nyid du shes par bya ba nas lam gyi bar du'o //
translated: Thus, those very aggregates, elements, and sense bases are to be known as suffering, etc., according to the four noble truths.

original: rnam pa'i sgo nas bden pa re re la yang rnam pa bzhi bzhis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa'i sgo nas bden pa re re la yang rnam pa bzhi bzhis shes par bya'o //
translated: And by way of the aspects, each truth is to be known by four aspects.

original: bye brag med par na thams cad kyang de bzhin nyid kyis rnam par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bye brag med par na thams cad kyang de bzhin nyid kyis rnam par shes par bya'o //
translated: And without distinction, all are to be known by suchness.

original: chos kyi sdom gyi skabs kyis na 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa nyid du shes par bya ba nas /
analyzed: chos kyi sdom gyi skabs kyis na 'du byed thams cad mi rtag pa nyid du shes par bya ba nas /
translated: And by way of the summary of the Dharma, all formations are to be known as impermanent,üîΩetc.

original: mya ngan las 'das bzhi ba nyid kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das bzhi ba nyid kyi bar du'o //
translated: up to the four noble truths.

original: rnam par thar pa'i rnam pa'i skabs kyis na stong ba nyid nas mtshan ma med pa'i bar du'i //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i rnam pa'i skabs kyis na stong ba nyid nas mtshan ma med pa'i bar du'i //
translated: By the occasion of the aspects of liberation, there are the aspects of emptiness, up to the aspects of signlessness.

original: dgos pa yongs su grub pa ni gnas gyur pa grub pa ste /
analyzed: dgos pa yongs su grub pa ni gnas gyur pa grub pa ste /
translated: The accomplishment of the purpose is the accomplishment of the transformation.

original: gnas gyur pa la dmigs pa phyin ci ma log par snang ba nyid do //üîΩji lta ba @71a * //
analyzed: gnas gyur pa la dmigs pa phyin ci ma log par snang ba nyid do // ji lta ba @71a * //
translated: The transformation is the nonerroneous appearance of the object.

original: bzhin du yod par bstan pa rnam pa bcu drug dang / rnam par thar pa rnam pa gsum bstan pa de dag ni gcig gis gcig sdud do //
analyzed: bzhin du yod par bstan pa rnam pa bcu drug dang / rnam par thar pa rnam pa gsum bstan pa de dag ni gcig gis gcig sdud do //
translated: The sixteen aspects of the four noble truths and the three doors of liberation are included in one another.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: rnam pa bcu drug gi nang nas gnyis ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu drug gi nang nas gnyis ni stong pa nyid kyi rnam pa ste /
translated: From among the sixteen aspects, two are the aspects of emptiness:

original: stong pa'i rnam pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa'i rnam pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: the aspect of emptiness and the aspect of selflessness.

original: drug ni smon pa med pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: drug ni smon pa med pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Six are the aspects of wishlessness:

original: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dang / rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rnam pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dang / rgyu dang / kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: The aspects of impermanence, of frustration, of cause, of origination, of strong generation, and of condition.

original: de dag gis khams gsum pa la smon pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis khams gsum pa la smon pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absence of aspiration for the three realms.

original: lhag ma brgyad ni mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: lhag ma brgyad ni mtshan ma med pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The remaining eight aspects are the aspects of signlessness,

original: 'gog pa dang lam la mtshan mar byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam la mtshan mar byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is unable to make the cessation and the path into signs.

original: spyod pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa ni 'dod chags la spyod pa la sogs pa'i mi sdug pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: spyod pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa ni 'dod chags la spyod pa la sogs pa'i mi sdug pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The object of the purification of the practice is the unattractiveness, etc.

original: des 'dod chags la sogs pa'i shas che ba nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des 'dod chags la sogs pa'i shas che ba nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it calms the predominance of passion, etc.

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni 'du byed la sogs pa'i chos rnams mngon du 'byin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams ni 'du byed la sogs pa'i chos rnams mngon du 'byin te /
translated: The dharmas of ignorance, etc. bring forth the dharmas of the formative forces, etc.

original: 'di dag rgyu med pa las byung par ma yin zhing dbang phyug la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba yang ma yin par shes pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'di dag rgyu med pa las byung par ma yin zhing dbang phyug la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i rgyu las byung ba yang ma yin par shes pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which is the knowledge that these do not arise without a cause, nor from a cause that is not in accordance with them, such as a divine creator,

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba la mkhas pa'o //
translated: is skill regarding dependent origination.

original: chos tsam gyi rgyu las byung ba yin du zin kyang mthun pa'i rgyu las mthun pa'i 'bras bu nyid 'byung ste /
analyzed: chos tsam gyi rgyu las byung ba yin du zin kyang mthun pa'i rgyu las mthun pa'i 'bras bu nyid 'byung ste /
translated: Even though they arise from a cause that is merely a phenomenon, a result that is in accordance with its cause arises,

original: 'di lta ste legs par spyod pa'i rnam par smin pa sdug pa dang nyes par spyod pa'i rnam par smin pa mi sdug pa zhes bya ba la sogs par shes pa gang yin pa de ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste legs par spyod pa'i rnam par smin pa sdug pa dang nyes par spyod pa'i rnam par smin pa mi sdug pa zhes bya ba la sogs par shes pa gang yin pa de ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas par rig par bya'o //
translated: such as the knowledge that the pleasant is the evolutionary impetus of good conduct and the unpleasant is the evolutionary impetus of bad conduct. That is skill regarding the possible and impossible.

original: nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs su sa 'og ma dang / gong ma rnams kyis rags pa dang zhi ba nyid des kun nas dkris pa rnam par gnon pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi skabs su ni bsdu na de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnam par sbyong ba'i dmigs pa ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs su sa 'og ma dang / gong ma rnams kyis rags pa dang zhi ba nyid des kun nas dkris pa rnam par gnon pa'i phyir ro // 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi skabs su ni bsdu na de bzhin nyid do //
translated: In the context of the supramundane path, it is reality,

original: spros na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: spros na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ste /
translated: if condensed, or the four noble truths,

original: des bag la nyal legs par bcom pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos dpyad pa dang 'brel bas rig pa bzhir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: des bag la nyal legs par bcom pa'i phyir ro // mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos dpyad pa dang 'brel bas rig pa bzhir brjod par bya ste /
translated: if expanded, because they thoroughly destroy the propensities.üîΩThe four investigations are called the four knowledges, because they investigate the Dharma of the sutra class, etc.üîΩThe reasonings that depend on them are the reasonings that investigate the Dharma of the sutra class, etc.üîΩThe reasonings that depend on them are the reasonings that investigate the Dharma of the sutra class, etc.

original: de dag gis de dpyad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis de dpyad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reasonings that depend on them are the reasonings that investigate the Dharma of the sutra class, etc.üîΩThe reasonings that depend on them are the reasonings that investigate the Dharma of the sutra class, etc.üîΩThe reasonings that depend on them are the reasonings that investigate the Dharma of the sutra class, etc.üîΩThe reasonings that depend on them are the reasonings that investigate the Dharma of the sutra class, etc.üîΩThe reasonings that depend on them are the reasonings that investigate the Dharma of the sutra class, etc.üîΩThe reasonings that depend on them are the reasonings that investigate the Dharma of the sutra class, etc.üîΩThe reasonings that depend on them are the reasonings that investigate the Dharma of the sutra class, etc.üîΩThe reasonings that depend on them are the reasonings that investigate the Dharma of the sutra class, etc.üîΩThe reasonings that depend on them are the reasonings that investigate the Dharma of the sutra class, etc.üîΩThe reasonings that depend on them are the reasonings that investigate the Dharma of the sutra class, etc.üîΩThe reasonings that depend on them are the reasonings that investigate the Dharma of the sutra class, etc.üîΩThe reasonings that depend on them are the reasonings that investigate the Dharma of the sutra class, etc.üîΩThe reasonings that depend on them are the reasonings that investigate the Dharma of the sutra class, etc.üîΩThe reasonings that depend on them are the reasonings that investigate the Dharma of the sutra class, etc.

original: de la ltos pa'i rigs pa ni gang 'du byed rnams 'byung ba na rkyen la ltos pa ste /
analyzed: de la ltos pa'i rigs pa ni gang 'du byed rnams 'byung ba na rkyen la ltos pa ste /
translated: The reasonings that depend on them are the reasonings that investigate the Dharma of the sutra class, etc.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The reasonings

original: myu gu 'byung ba nas sa bon dang dus dang chu @71b dang ; zhing rnams la ltos pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i dbang po dang / don dang yid la byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: myu gu 'byung ba nas sa bon dang dus dang chu @71b dang ; zhing rnams la ltos pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i dbang po dang / don dang yid la byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: consciousness arises in dependence upon the sense-faculty, the object, and mental attention.

original: bya ba byed pa'i rigs la ni 'di lta ste mig la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i gnas kyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: bya ba byed pa'i rigs la ni 'di lta ste mig la sogs pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i gnas kyi dngos po'o //
translated: The logical mark of causal process is, for example, the eye, etc., which are the basis of visual consciousness, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa ni dmigs pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa ni dmigs pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: Form, etc., are the objects of apprehension.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa so sor rnam par rig par byed do //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ni gzugs la sogs pa so sor rnam par rig par byed do //
translated: Visual consciousness, etc., are the individual awareness of form, etc.

original: gser mgar la sogs pa'i lag bzo ba rnams ni gser la sogs pa byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gser mgar la sogs pa'i lag bzo ba rnams ni gser la sogs pa byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The goldsmith, etc., are the makers of ornaments, etc., from gold, etc.

original: gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni sgrub pa'i don ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyis bsdus pa mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma dang mi 'gal bar dam bcas pa la sogs par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs sgrub pa'i rigs pa ni sgrub pa'i don ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyis bsdus pa mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad ma dang mi 'gal bar dam bcas pa la sogs par bstan pa'o //
translated: The logical mark of proof is the demonstration of the thesis, etc., which is not contradicted by perception, etc., and which is included in the nature of the object to be established, whether it be an entity or a particular.

original: chos nyid kyi rigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: chos nyid kyi rigs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The principle of reality is as follows:

original: mes ni tshig chus ni 'drul zhes bya ba la sogs par grags pa'i chos rnams kyi chos nyid de /
analyzed: mes ni tshig chus ni 'drul zhes bya ba la sogs par grags pa'i chos rnams kyi chos nyid de /
translated: The reality of things that are well known, such as fire burns and water wets.

original: ji skad du 'byor ldan mig ni rtag pa nas bdag gi pa'i bar gyis stong ngo //
analyzed: ji skad du 'byor ldan mig ni rtag pa nas bdag gi pa'i bar gyis stong ngo //
translated: As it is said, the eye is empty of permanence, etc., up to and including being a self.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di'i rang bzhin ni 'di'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin ni 'di'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Its nature is such.

original: ming kun tu tshol ba ni ming gi tshogs la sogs pa btags pa'i yod pa yin pa'i phyir 'di dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su grub pa med par dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: ming kun tu tshol ba ni ming gi tshogs la sogs pa btags pa'i yod pa yin pa'i phyir 'di dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su grub pa med par dpyod pa'o //
translated: The investigation of names is the investigation of the non-establishment of their own natures, since the collections of names, etc. are only imputed to exist.

original: dngos po kun tu tshol ba ni ji ltar ming gi tshogs la sogs pa brjod pa de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su grub pa med par gang rtog pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po kun tu tshol ba ni ji ltar ming gi tshogs la sogs pa brjod pa de bzhin du phung po la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid yongs su grub pa med par gang rtog pa ste /
translated: The investigation of things is the investigation of the non-establishment of the natures of the aggregates, etc., just as they are described in the collections of names, etc.

original: yongs su rtog ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yongs su rtog ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the investigation of the thoroughly imagined, that is, the thoroughly imagined natures.

original: ngo bo nyid du 'dogs pa kun tu tshol ba ni brjod pa dang brjod par bya ba 'brel pa la ngo bo nyid du 'dogs pa tsam gyi tha snyad kyi rgyu nyid du rtog pa'o zhes bya ba la brjod pa dang brjod par bya ba 'brel ba ni
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du 'dogs pa kun tu tshol ba ni brjod pa dang brjod par bya ba 'brel pa la ngo bo nyid du 'dogs pa tsam gyi tha snyad kyi rgyu nyid du rtog pa'o zhes bya ba la brjod pa dang brjod par bya ba 'brel ba ni
translated: The investigation of the designation of intrinsic reality is the conception that the connection between the expression and the object of expression is the cause of the conventional designation of intrinsic reality.

original: rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: The connection between the expression and the object of expression is the cause of understanding.

original: 'di ltar tha snyad la bya ba ni brjod pa tsam du thos pas de'i brjod par bya ba la dran pa'i sgo nas rtogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar tha snyad la bya ba ni brjod pa tsam du thos pas de'i brjod par bya ba la dran pa'i sgo nas rtogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, in regard to the conventional, the activity is merely the expression, and through hearing that, understanding arises in regard to its object of expression through memory.

original: brjod par bya ba dmigs na yang de brjod pa la rtogs pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba dmigs na yang de brjod pa la rtogs pa 'byung ste /
translated: And when the object of expression is observed, understanding arises in regard to its expression.

original: rnam pa de lta bur 'brel bar grags pa la mig la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid du btags pa tsam ni de brjod pa sha sna gu la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyur gyur par gang kun tu rtog pa de ni ngo bo nyid du 'dogs paüîΩkun tu tshol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bur 'brel bar grags pa la mig la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid du btags pa tsam ni de brjod pa sha sna gu la sogs pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyur gyur par gang kun tu rtog pa de ni ngo bo nyid du 'dogs paüîΩkun tu tshol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The mere designation of the intrinsic identity of the eye, etc., in that sort of well-known connection is the cause of the conventional expressions ‚Äúeye,‚Äù etc., and the conception of that is called the investigation of the designation of intrinsic reality.

original: khyad par du 'dogs pa kun tu tshol ba ni gang de bzhin @72a * //
analyzed: khyad par du 'dogs pa kun tu tshol ba ni gang de bzhin @72a * //
translated: In particular, the investigation of designations is as follows.üîΩ

original: du brjod pa dang brjod par bya ba 'brel ba rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang / bla na yod pa dang / bla na med pa dang / gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa dang / bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa khyad par gyi mtshan nyid du 'dogs pa tsam gyi tha snyad kyi rgyu nyid du rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: du brjod pa dang brjod par bya ba 'brel ba rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang / bla na yod pa dang / bla na med pa dang / gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa dang / bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa khyad par gyi mtshan nyid du 'dogs pa tsam gyi tha snyad kyi rgyu nyid du rtogs pa'o //
translated: In particular, the investigation of the designation of particularities is the understanding that the cause of the conventional expression of the connection between the expression and the expressed is the mere designation of the particularity of the permanent and impermanent, the surpassable and unsurpassable, the corporeal and incorporeal, the demonstrable and the indemonstrable.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gzhi ni ji ltar kun du brtsal ba rnams kyis ming la sogs pa mi dmigs par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa gzhi ni ji ltar kun du brtsal ba rnams kyis ming la sogs pa mi dmigs par shes pa rnams so //
translated: The bases of the correct understanding of reality are the understandings that the seeker does not apprehend name, etc.

original: chos la ting nge 'dzin bar brtson pa'i rnal 'byor gyi sa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: chos la ting nge 'dzin bar brtson pa'i rnal 'byor gyi sa ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The stage of yoga of one who is intent on the meditative concentration of the teaching is fivefold:

original: gzhi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi la sogs pa'o //
translated: the basis, etc.

original: de la gzhi ni mang du thos pa ci 'dra bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi gnas su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gzhi ni mang du thos pa ci 'dra bar dmigs pa'i tshul gyis zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi gnas su 'gyur te /
translated: Therein, the basis is the object of the meditative concentration of the teaching, which is the cause of the meditative development of calm and insight, since it is the cause of the meditative development of calm and insight.

original: de ni gzhi zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gzhi zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called the basis.

original: de yang tshogs bsags pa'i bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: de yang tshogs bsags pa'i bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is from the perspective of the realization of the truths of those who have accumulated the collections.

original: gang mdo sde la sogs pa thos pas bzung ba'o //
analyzed: gang mdo sde la sogs pa thos pas bzung ba'o //
translated: It is that which is retained by listening to the sutra collection and so on.

original: bskyed pa ni de la dmigs pa'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: bskyed pa ni de la dmigs pa'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pa ste /
translated: Generation is proper mental contemplation that focuses on that.

original: nges mang du thos pa de la phyi ci ma log par don sems pa'i tshul gyis sems 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: nges mang du thos pa de la phyi ci ma log par don sems pa'i tshul gyis sems 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the retention of the mind through the method of unmistakenly contemplating the meaning of that extensive listening.

original: me long lta bu ni mang du thos pa de nyid la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin mtshan ma dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: me long lta bu ni mang du thos pa de nyid la dmigs pa'i ting nge 'dzin mtshan ma dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The mirror-like is the meditative stabilization that focuses on that extensive listening and possesses signs.

original: shes bya'o dngos po dang mthun pa gzugs brnyan lta bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes bya'o dngos po dang mthun pa gzugs brnyan lta bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called the reflection that accords with the object of knowledge.

original: 'di'i mi long lta bu nyid ni des shes bya'i gzugs brnyan la yongs su rtog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i mi long lta bu nyid ni des shes bya'i gzugs brnyan la yongs su rtog par rig par bya'o //
translated: Its mirror-like nature should be understood as the thorough analysis of the reflection of the object of knowledge by that.

original: snang ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mi dmigs par shes pa ste /
analyzed: snang ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa mi dmigs par shes pa ste /
translated: Illumination is the knowledge that does not observe the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: mngon sum du 'byung ba'i phyir mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du 'byung ba'i phyir mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: It is included in the path of insight because it occurs in a manifest manner.

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnal 'byor gyis 'di la brtson pa mi dmigs pa la reg ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' rnal 'byor gyis 'di la brtson pa mi dmigs pa la reg ce na /
translated: How does the bodhisattva who is engaged in this yoga touch the nonapprehension of objects?

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni bskal pa grangs med pa tshar phyin nas de bzhin nyid rtogs pa dang mthun pa'i chos thos pa tshul bzhin yid la byed cing ting nge 'dzin sgrub ste /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni bskal pa grangs med pa tshar phyin nas de bzhin nyid rtogs pa dang mthun pa'i chos thos pa tshul bzhin yid la byed cing ting nge 'dzin sgrub ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who has accumulated the collections of merit and knowledge, having completed three incalculable eons, hears the teachings that accord with the realization of thusness, properly reflects on them, and accomplishes meditative concentration.

original: de de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis shes bya'i gzugs brnyan gang yin pa la brten nas bsam gtan du byed do /
analyzed: de de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis shes bya'i gzugs brnyan gang yin pa la brten nas bsam gtan du byed do /
translated: In that way, on the basis of the image of the object of knowledge that is the mind in meditative equipoise, he practices meditative concentration.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems de las de gzhan ma yin par mthong nas gzugs brnyan de la yul gyi 'du shes bzlog ste /
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems de las de gzhan ma yin par mthong nas gzugs brnyan de la yul gyi 'du shes bzlog ste /
translated: Seeing that it is not different from the mind in meditative equipoise, he reverses the notion that the image is an object.

original: de'i rnam pa rang gi 'du shes tsam du 'dzin to //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa rang gi 'du shes tsam du 'dzin to //
translated: He apprehends it as merely his own idea.

original: de'i tshe rang gi sems tsam la gnas ba'i phyir sems nang du gnas par @72b gyur pas gzung ba rnam pa thams cad du med par rab tu rtogs so //
analyzed: de'i tshe rang gi sems tsam la gnas ba'i phyir sems nang du gnas par @72b gyur pas gzung ba rnam pa thams cad du med par rab tu rtogs so //
translated: At that time, because of abiding in mind only, the mind abides inwardly, and one fully understands that the object is completely nonexistent.

original: de'i 'og tu gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa yang yongs su ma grub bo zhes de yang med par rab tu rtogs so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gzung ba med pas 'dzin pa yang yongs su ma grub bo zhes de yang med par rab tu rtogs so //
translated: After that, because the object does not exist, the subject is also not established, and one fully understands that it also does not exist.

original: de'i 'og tu so so rang la de gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du dmigs pa dang bral nas dmigs pa med par khong du chud do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu so so rang la de gnyi ga'i rang bzhin du dmigs pa dang bral nas dmigs pa med par khong du chud do //
translated: After that, each one is free from the apprehension of the nature of both of those, and one comprehends the absence of an object.

original: de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis //
analyzed: de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis //
translated: With that in mind, the BhagavƒÅn said:

original: byang chub sems dpa' mnyam gzhag pa //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mnyam gzhag pa //
translated: The bodhisattva who is equipoised

original: yid kyi gzugs brnyan mthong bas na //
analyzed: yid kyi gzugs brnyan mthong bas na //
translated: sees the mental image.

original: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: And so on at length.

original: gnas ni gnas gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gnas ni gnas gyur pa ste /
translated: The basis is the transformation of the basis,

original: gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir gnas yongs su dag zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas ngan len dang bral ba'i phyir gnas yongs su dag zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because it is free from negative tendencies. It is called the complete purification of the basis.

original: rnal 'byor gyi sa 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bus bstan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor gyi sa 'di ni rgyu dang 'bras bus bstan par rig par bya ste /
translated: This stage of yoga should be understood as taught by way of cause and effect.

original: de la gzhi la sogs pa bzhis ni rgyu bstan to //
analyzed: de la gzhi la sogs pa bzhis ni rgyu bstan to //
translated: The four beginning with the basis indicate the cause.

original: tha ma gcig gis ni 'bras bu bstan to //
analyzed: tha ma gcig gis ni 'bras bu bstan to //
translated: The last one indicates the result.üîΩThe Sthavira Ananda said: ‚ÄúVenerable Sariputra, a monk who possesses five qualities is quickly accepted.‚Äù

original: gnas brtan kun dga' bos tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu chos lnga dang ldan pa'i dge slong myur du 'dzin to zhes gang smras pa'i mdo de la chos lnga po 'di dag gis myur du 'dzin pa la sogs pa bzhin du ci rigs su rig par bya'o
analyzed: gnas brtan kun dga' bos tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu chos lnga dang ldan pa'i dge slong myur du 'dzin to zhes gang smras pa'i mdo de la chos lnga po 'di dag gis myur du 'dzin pa la sogs pa bzhin du ci rigs su rig par bya'o
translated: In that Sutra, the five qualities should be understood as appropriate for the five qualities of being quickly accepted, etc.

analyzed: // ji ltar na chos la mkhas pas myur du 'dzin zhe na /

analyzed: mang du thos pas tshig dang yi ge phal cher lcigs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: chos mngon pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa'i phyir te ;

analyzed: phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i gtam gyi gzhi'i skabs su tshig le'u mang du bzlums pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: yi ge la mkhas pa dang nges pa'i tshig la mkhas pas ni tshig dang don ma nor bar 'dzin pas legs par zin par 'dzin te /
translated: One who is skilled in letters and skilled in etymologies grasps well, because one grasps without error the words and meanings.

original: nges pa'i tshig bzang po'i yi ge shes pa dang ; bdag go zhes yul gyi mi'i nges pa'i tshig la mngon par zhen pa rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa shes pa nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩsngon gyi mtha' dang phyi ma'i mtha' la dgongs pa la mkhas pa ni ril gyis byed na chos la gnas pa yin gyi /

original: sbyor ba gang brten nas phyis 'byung bar bya bar shes te /
analyzed: sbyor ba gang brten nas phyis 'byung bar bya bar shes te /
translated: One who is skilled in the intention regarding the prior limit and the later limit is one who abides in the Dharma, because one knows that the entire Dharma is to be produced in dependence on the application.

analyzed: dgongs pa shes pa'i phyir khong du chud pas de'i snying po len pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: btsun pa chos la gnas pa'i dge slong zhes bya ba'i do der ni bcom ldan 'das kyis thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa ni ril gyis byed na chos la gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: In the Sutra of the Monk Who Abides in the Dharma, the Bhagavat said: ‚ÄúThe monk who abides in the Dharma is one who listens, reflects, and meditates.

analyzed: sbyor ba gang yang rung ba tsam gyis ni ma yin par bstan to // de la kun @73a * //

analyzed: bsgom pa la zhugs pa ma yin te /

original: rnal 'byor la sogs pa bor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor la sogs pa bor ba'i phyir ro //

original: de'i phyir chos la gnas pa ma yin par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos la gnas pa ma yin par rnam par gzhag go //

analyzed: gang la la zhig gis thos pa dang sems pa la ma brten par bsgom pa 'ba' zhig la zhugs pa de yang chos la gnas pa ma yin par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: One who is intent on meditative development alone, without relying on learning and reflection, is also not established in the Dharma.

analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis chos la gnas pa'i dge slong las brtsams te /
translated: Therefore, the Lord, in the context of the monk who is established in the Dharma,

original: ci nas thos pa dang bsam pa dang / bsgom pa la brten nas de gnyi ga la gnas pas chos la gnas pa yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir 'di la dge slong mdo'i sde dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde'i chos kun chub bar byed pa zhes rgya cher bka' stsal nas de'i 'og tu rnal 'byor
analyzed: ci nas thos pa dang bsam pa dang / bsgom pa la brten nas de gnyi ga la gnas pas chos la gnas pa yin par shes par bya ba'i phyir 'di la dge slong mdo'i sde dang dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde'i chos kun chub bar byed pa zhes rgya cher bka' stsal nas de'i 'og tu rnal 'byor
translated: In order to understand that one should abide in the Dharma by abiding in both of those through learning, reflection, and meditation, the Buddha said, ‚ÄúHere, monks, you should master the Dharma of the sutra collection and the melody collection.‚Äù

original: mi 'dor ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: mi 'dor ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: After that, he said, ‚ÄúDo not abandon yoga,‚Äù and so on.

original: rnal 'byor mi 'dor ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: rnal 'byor mi 'dor ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: ‚ÄúDo not abandon yoga,‚Äù and so on,

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la sbyor ba dang chog par mi 'dzin pas bsgom pa las 'byung ba bstan to //
translated: indicate the arising of meditation through not being satisfied with preparation for concentration.

original: ting nge 'dzin la sbyor ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la sbyor ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Preparation for concentration is twofold:
