analyzed: rgyun du chud pa dang gus par sbyor bas bsdus pa ni rnal 'byor mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
translated: That which is included in continuous and respectful preparation is indicated by ‚Äúdo not abandon yoga.‚Äù

original: ma log par sbyor bas bsdus pa ni yid la byed pa mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
analyzed: ma log par sbyor bas bsdus pa ni yid la byed pa mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
translated: That which is included in unmistaken preparation is indicated by ‚Äúdo not abandon mental attention.‚Äù

original: chog par mi 'dzin pa ni nang du sems zhi gnas su byed pa mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba 'dis bstan te de'i ro mi myang ba dang / gang du zhi gnas la sbyor bas mi 'dor bar blta'o //
analyzed: chog par mi 'dzin pa ni nang du sems zhi gnas su byed pa mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba 'dis bstan te de'i ro mi myang ba dang / gang du zhi gnas la sbyor bas mi 'dor bar blta'o //
translated: Non-satisfaction is indicated by the phrase ‚Äúnot forsaking the internal pacification of mind.‚Äù One should understand that one does not forsake it by applying oneself to pacification, without savoring its flavor.

original: ci'i phyir mdo sde gzhan las shin tu rgyas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i sde snod ces bya zhe na /

analyzed: der pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyi grangs bstan pa nas gcig la gcig rnam par nges pa'i bar du bstan pa'i phyir ro //

original: de la grangs ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la grangs ni rnam pa gnyis te /

analyzed: bgrangs ba'i grangs dang / de tsam gyi grangs so //

analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug ces bya ba ni bgrang ba'i grangs so //
translated: The statement ‚Äúsix perfections‚Äù is enumeration as counting.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa gnyis gsum gsum gyis bsdus pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam mngon par mtho ba dang nges par legs pa rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa gnyis gsum gsum gyis bsdus pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug nyid de /

translated: The result of the perfection of patience is the attainment of the great region, because one attains the state of being the object of all beings' respect.

analyzed: nges par legs pa'i lam yang rnam pa gsum ste /

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa las bzlog ste /

original: 'khor ba na gnas pa las bzlog ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba na gnas pa las bzlog ste /

original: der nyon mongs pa med par bya'o //
analyzed: der nyon mongs pa med par bya'o //

original: de'i phyir gsum ni mngon par mtho ba thob pa'i thabs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsum ni mngon par mtho ba thob pa'i thabs so //

analyzed: gsum ni de na nyon mongs pa med pa'i thabs te /

original: shes rab kyis ni bag la nyal legs par 'joms so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni bag la nyal legs par 'joms so //
translated: One thoroughly conquers their latent potential through wisdom.

original: sems can rjes su 'dzin pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnyen pa'i phyir yang rnam grangs gzhan te /
analyzed: sems can rjes su 'dzin pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnyen pa'i phyir yang rnam grangs gzhan te /
translated: There is another explanation: in order to take care of sentient beings and in order to remedy the addictions.

original: de la sbyin pas ni byang chung sems dpa' sems can rnams la yo byad nye bar sgrub pa'i phan 'dogs pas rjes su 'dzin to //
analyzed: de la sbyin pas ni byang chung sems dpa' sems can rnams la yo byad nye bar sgrub pa'i phan 'dogs pas rjes su 'dzin to //
translated: In this regard, the bodhisattva takes care of sentient beings by means of giving, by helping them with material things.

original: tshul khrims kyis ni phongs pa dang / gnod pa dang rnam par 'tshe ba mi byed pa'i tshul gyis rjes su 'dzin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis ni phongs pa dang / gnod pa dang rnam par 'tshe ba mi byed pa'i tshul gyis rjes su 'dzin te /
translated: By means of morality, he takes care of them by not harming them, by not injuring them, by not afflicting them.

original: go rims bzhin du logs spyod dang lus dang sems la gnod pa mi sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du logs spyod dang lus dang sems la gnod pa mi sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, respectively, he does not fail in enjoyment, does not fail in body, and does not fail in mind.

original: @74a * // bzod pas ni phongs pa dang gnod pa la ji mi snyam par rjes su 'dzin to //
analyzed: @74a * // bzod pas ni phongs pa dang gnod pa la ji mi snyam par rjes su 'dzin to //
translated: By means of patience, he takes care of them by putting up with injuries.

original: gzhan dag gis bdag gi longs spyod la sogs pa la gnod pa la mi mjed pa'i phyir te /üîΩde gsum gyis rjes su 'dzin to //
analyzed: gzhan dag gis bdag gi longs spyod la sogs pa la gnod pa la mi mjed pa'i phyir te / de gsum gyis rjes su 'dzin to //
translated: Because he is not disturbed by others‚Äô injuries to his enjoyment, etc.

original: brtson 'grus kyis ni nyon mongs pa rnam par ma mnan yang dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyis ni nyon mongs pa rnam par ma mnan yang dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ro //
translated: By means of effort, he takes care of them by joining them to virtue, even though he has not subdued the addictions.

original: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa rnam par gnon to //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis ni nyon mongs pa rnam par gnon to //
translated: By means of meditative concentration, one suppresses the afflictions.

original: shes rab kyis ni bag la nyal legs par 'joms par byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni bag la nyal legs par 'joms par byed do //
translated: By means of wisdom, one destroys the latent forms of the afflictions.

original: 'di gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di gsum ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por rig par bya'o //
translated: These three should be understood as the antidotes to the mental afflictions.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid ni gang zhe na /
translated: What are the defining characteristics of the perfections for a bodhisattva?

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems la brten nas snying rje sngon du btang ba'i sems kyis bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba la lus dang dag dang yid
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni gang byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i byang chub kyi sems la brten nas snying rje sngon du btang ba'i sems kyis bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba la lus dang dag dang yid
translated: The perfection of generosity is the act of giving away all one‚Äôs possessions with a mind that is preceded by compassion and that is supported by a bodhisattva‚Äôs spirit of enlightenment and by a bodhisattva‚Äôs way of life.

original: kyi las te /
analyzed: kyi las te /
translated: It is an act that is carried out with the body, speech, and mind.

original: de ltar byas na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid rigs dang ; smon lam dang / bsam pa dang dngos po dang / ngo bo nyid kyis bstan par rig par bya'o /
analyzed: de ltar byas na sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid rigs dang ; smon lam dang / bsam pa dang dngos po dang / ngo bo nyid kyis bstan par rig par bya'o /
translated: In this way, the defining characteristics of the perfection of generosity should be understood as having been taught by means of the following six elements: spiritual lineage, aspirational prayer, attitude, substance, essential nature, and field.

original: 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid ni rigs so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid ni rigs so //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva's reality is his spiritual gene.

original: byang chub kyi sems ni smon lam mo //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ni smon lam mo //
translated: The thought of enlightenment is his vow.

original: snying rje sngon du gtong ba'i sems ni bsam pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje sngon du gtong ba'i sems ni bsam pa'o //
translated: The thought which is preceded by compassion is his intention.

original: bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba ni dngos po'o //
analyzed: bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba ni dngos po'o //
translated: The giving of all possessions is his substance.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las ni ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las ni ngo bo nyid do //
translated: His essence is the actions of body, speech and mind.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la yang rgya cher rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la yang rgya cher rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand the other perfections up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'di ni bye brag yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bye brag yin te /
translated: This is the difference.

original: tshul khrims dang bzod pa dang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la ni sdom pa thams cad yang dag par len pa dang ; rjes su bsrung ba dang / gnod par byed pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang bzod pa dang brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la ni sdom pa thams cad yang dag par len pa dang ; rjes su bsrung ba dang / gnod par byed pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa dang /
translated: In the perfections of morality, patience and exertion, the taking up of all vows, the guarding of them, the injuring of them, and the indifference to suffering,

original: dang du len pa dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par bsgrub pa la lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las so zhes go rims bzhin du brjod par bya'o //üîΩbsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi rnam pa thams cad dang dbang 'byor ba la sems kyi gnas pa rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dang du len pa dang / dge ba'i chos thams cad yang dag par bsgrub pa la lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las so zhes go rims bzhin du brjod par bya'o // bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi rnam pa thams cad dang dbang 'byor ba la sems kyi gnas pa rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The activity of the perfection of morality is to be understood as the activity of the three moralities.üîΩThe activity of the perfection of patience is to be understood as the activity of the three patiences.üîΩThe activity of the perfection of vigor is to be understood as the activity of the three kinds of vigor.üîΩThe activity of the perfection of meditation is to be understood as the activity of the three kinds of meditation.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi rnam pa thams cad dang dbang 'byor pa la gang rnam pa thams cad du chos rab @74b tu rnam par 'byed pa'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi rnam pa thams cad dang dbang 'byor pa la gang rnam pa thams cad du chos rab @74b tu rnam par 'byed pa'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The activity of the perfection of wisdom is to be understood as the activity of the three kinds of wisdom.

original: lhag ma thams cad ni sbyin pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma thams cad ni sbyin pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The rest is to be understood as in the case of generosity.

original: yang sbyin pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la brtsams pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su 'dzin pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bya ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: yang sbyin pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid la brtsams pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su 'dzin pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bya ba byed pa ste /
translated: Moreover, generosity is undertaken in relation to omniscience, it leads to omniscience, it supports omniscience, and it performs the functions of omniscience.

original: de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the perfection of generosity.

original: tshig bzhi po de dag ni go rims bzhin du rtsom pa dang / bag chags dang / sku dang / rgyu mthun par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig bzhi po de dag ni go rims bzhin du rtsom pa dang / bag chags dang / sku dang / rgyu mthun par rig par bya'o //
translated: These four terms should be understood respectively as: undertaking, habitual propensities, embodiment, and natural outcome.

original: de la rtsom pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las brtsams te /
analyzed: de la rtsom pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid las brtsams te /
translated: Undertaking is the beginning of omniscience,

original: 'byung ba dang byung ba der yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang byung ba der yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the occurrence and arising of generosity is dedicated to that.

original: sbyin pa de nyid rgyud la bag chags su bsgos te /
analyzed: sbyin pa de nyid rgyud la bag chags su bsgos te /
translated: That generosity itself is the habitual propensities in the mind

original: de las phi ma la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las phi ma la thams cad mkhyen pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: because it leads to omniscience in the future.

original: gang gi tshe de nyid yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de nyid yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: When it is fully perfected,

original: chos kyi sku yongs su grub pa'i tshul gyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: chos kyi sku yongs su grub pa'i tshul gyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: By the method of perfecting the Dharma Body, he takes hold of omniscience.

original: de'i 'og tu longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i skus rgyu mthun pa'i sgo nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bya ba byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa'i skus rgyu mthun pa'i sgo nas thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi bya ba byed do //
translated: After that, by the Enjoyment Body and the Emanation Body, he performs the function of omniscience through natural outflow.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom should be understood in the same way.

original: go rims ni 'og ma 'og ma la brten pa'i phyir te /üîΩsbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas ni nang dang phyi'i dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong bar goms pas /
analyzed: go rims ni 'og ma 'og ma la brten pa'i phyir te / sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pas ni nang dang phyi'i dngos po thams cad yongs su gtong bar goms pas /
translated: The order is because the later ones are based on the earlier ones.üîΩBy the perfection of generosity, the bodhisattva, through the practice of giving away all inner and outer things,

original: lus dang srog la mi lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' longs spyod kyi phung po chen po yang spangs nas tshul khrims la yang dag par 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: lus dang srog la mi lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' longs spyod kyi phung po chen po yang spangs nas tshul khrims la yang dag par 'dzin par byed do //
translated: having abandoned even a great mass of wealth, takes up morality, not regarding body and life.

original: tshul khrims rjes su bsrung ba ni gshe yang bdag gis slar gshe bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis bzod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims rjes su bsrung ba ni gshe yang bdag gis slar gshe bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis bzod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The observance of morality is the patience that is the aspect of the thought, ‚ÄúEven if reviled, I will not revile in return.‚Äù

original: grang ba la sogs pa bzod pa ni de'i gzhi las sbyor ba mi nyams pas brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin no //
analyzed: grang ba la sogs pa bzod pa ni de'i gzhi las sbyor ba mi nyams pas brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin no //
translated: The patience of tolerating the pain of cold and so on is the vigor that is the non-degeneration of practice on that basis.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni sbyor ba'i mtha'i 'bras bu thob pas bsam gtan bsgrub bo //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa ni sbyor ba'i mtha'i 'bras bu thob pas bsam gtan bsgrub bo //
translated: The vigor of undertaking is the meditation that is the attainment of the fruit of the culmination of practice.

original: bsam gtan phun sum tshogs te sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab thob po //
analyzed: bsam gtan phun sum tshogs te sems mnyam par gzhag pa ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab thob po //
translated: The perfection of meditation, with the mind well-equipoised, is the attainment of supramundane wisdom through knowledge of reality as it is.

original: yang gong ma gong ma ni gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: yang gong ma gong ma ni gzhi yin pa'i phyir ro /
translated: Moreover, the latter is the basis of the former.

original: tshul khrims ni sbyin pa'i gzhi yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni sbyin pa'i gzhi yin no //
translated: Morality is the basis of generosity.

original: de bzhin du shes rab ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzhi yin pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i gzhi yin pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Similarly, up to wisdom is the basis of the perfection of meditation.

original: 'di ltar @75a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar @75a * //
translated: It is so,

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni sbyin pas phan btags pa la tshul khrims kyis gnod pa'i byed pa'i phyir sbyin pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni sbyin pas phan btags pa la tshul khrims kyis gnod pa'i byed pa'i phyir sbyin pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: The one who has morality, by means of morality, prevents the harm that is done to those who are helped by generosity, and thus generosity becomes purified.

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' len pa po de la rnam par 'tshe ba dang bral bar yo byad kyis bde bar sbyor bas tshul khrims kyi stobs kyis sbyin pa rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' len pa po de la rnam par 'tshe ba dang bral bar yo byad kyis bde bar sbyor bas tshul khrims kyi stobs kyis sbyin pa rnam par dag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattva, by means of morality, should be known as having purified generosity through the power of morality, by means of the equipment of happiness, free from violence, for that recipient.

original: de ltar bzod pa dang ldan pa ni gzhan gnod par byed pa dag gis bslab pa'i gzhi mi 'dral bas tshul khrims rnam par dag go //
analyzed: de ltar bzod pa dang ldan pa ni gzhan gnod par byed pa dag gis bslab pa'i gzhi mi 'dral bas tshul khrims rnam par dag go //
translated: Thus, the one who has patience, by means of patience, does not break the basis of training through the harm done by others, and thus morality becomes purified.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pas spro ba'i stobs kyi ched du 'khor ba khas blangs pa ni sems can log par sgrub pa'i sdug bsngal bde blag tu bzod pas bzod pa rnam par dag go //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pas spro ba'i stobs kyi ched du 'khor ba khas blangs pa ni sems can log par sgrub pa'i sdug bsngal bde blag tu bzod pas bzod pa rnam par dag go //
translated: The one who has undertaken perseverance, by means of perseverance, easily endures the suffering of sentient beings who are wrongly behaved, and thus patience becomes purified.

original: bsam gtan pa ni bde ba dang bcas pa dang yid bde pa dang bcas par dge ba'i chos thams cad la sbyor bas brtson 'grus rnam par dag go //
analyzed: bsam gtan pa ni bde ba dang bcas pa dang yid bde pa dang bcas par dge ba'i chos thams cad la sbyor bas brtson 'grus rnam par dag go //
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattva is pure because it is applied to all virtuous qualities with pleasure and mental joy.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pas shes rab dang ldan pa ni chos rnam pa mang po la rnam par bltas nas nang du zhi bar byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin rnam par 'phel bas bsam gtan rnam par dag ste /üîΩshes rab med la bsam gtan med //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pas shes rab dang ldan pa ni chos rnam pa mang po la rnam par bltas nas nang du zhi bar byed pa ni ting nge 'dzin rnam par 'phel bas bsam gtan rnam par dag ste / shes rab med la bsam gtan med //
translated: The meditation of the bodhisattva is pure because it is applied to the development of concentration by means of the wisdom that is endowed with the practice of effort and by means of the inner tranquility that is attained by means of the insight that is gained by means of the many kinds of views of the Dharma.üîΩIt is stated in verse:

original: ces tshig su bcad pa las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces tshig su bcad pa las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no meditation without wisdom.‚Äù

original: ji ltar rags pa'i rim gyis yang go rims kyis yang go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rags pa'i rim gyis yang go rims kyis yang go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The order of the perfections should be understood according to their coarseness.

original: sbyin pa ni thams cad kyi nang nas rags ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa ni thams cad kyi nang nas rags ste /
translated: Generosity is the coarsest of all,

original: de'i phyir sbyin pa thog mar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyin pa thog mar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: therefore it is presented first.

original: de'i 'og tu bzod pa la sogs pas tshul khrims rags so //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bzod pa la sogs pas tshul khrims rags so //
translated: After that, morality is coarser than patience,

original: de bzhin du shes rab pas bsam gtan rags pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab pas bsam gtan rags pa'i bar du'o //
translated: and similarly, up to meditation being coarser than wisdom.

original: shes rab ni thams cad kyi nang na phra ste /
analyzed: shes rab ni thams cad kyi nang na phra ste /
translated: Wisdom is the most subtle of all.

original: de'i phyir thams cad kyi tha mar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad kyi tha mar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, it is established as the last of all.

original: nges tshig ni ci'i phyir sbyin pa la sbyin pa'i pha rol du phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: nges tshig ni ci'i phyir sbyin pa la sbyin pa'i pha rol du phyin pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: What is the verbal definition? Why is generosity called the perfection of generosity?

original: sbyin pa chen po dang / skyon med pa dang / dri ma med pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa chen po dang / skyon med pa dang / dri ma med pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Great generosity, faultless generosity, and stainless generosity is called the perfection of generosity.

original: de la sbyin pa chen po ni nang dang phyi'i dngos po'i rnam pa thams cad sbyin pa dang / yun ring du sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa chen po ni nang dang phyi'i dngos po'i rnam pa thams cad sbyin pa dang / yun ring du sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, great generosity is the generosity of all aspects of internal and external things, and the generosity for a long time.

original: skyon med pa ni gnod pas kun tu tshol ba la sogs pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyon med pa ni gnod pas kun tu tshol ba la sogs pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Faultless generosity is the generosity that is free from the faults of seeking harm and so on.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las sbyin pa'i zad pa las brtsams te bstan pa /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las sbyin pa'i zad pa las brtsams te bstan pa /
translated: As it is taught in the noble Aksayamatinirdesha-sutra, beginning with the inexhaustibility of generosity:

original: btsun pa shar dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' @75b rnams kyi sbyin pa yang mi zad pa ste /
analyzed: btsun pa shar dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' @75b rnams kyi sbyin pa yang mi zad pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúVenerable Subhuti, the generosity of the bodhisattvas is also inexhaustible.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is immeasurable.

original: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa yongs su sbyang ba yang tshad med pa ste /
analyzed: btsun pa sha ra dva ti'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sbyin pa yongs su sbyang ba yang tshad med pa ste /
translated: Venerable ≈öƒÅradvatƒ´putra, the bodhisattvas‚Äô purification of generosity is also immeasurable.

original: tshe dang spobs pa dang bde ba dang stobs dang kha dog nye bar brtan pa'i phyir zas 'dod pa rnams la zas sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang spobs pa dang bde ba dang stobs dang kha dog nye bar brtan pa'i phyir zas 'dod pa rnams la zas sbyin pa'o //
translated: For those who desire food, they give food in order to stabilize life, eloquence, happiness, strength, and complexion.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sred pa bsal ba'i phyir btung ba 'dod pa rnams la btung ba sbyin pa'o //üîΩbde ba dang 'byor ba'i dngos po thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sred pa bsal ba'i phyir btung ba 'dod pa rnams la btung ba sbyin pa'o // bde ba dang 'byor ba'i dngos po thams cad bsdu ba'i phyir //
translated: For those who desire drink, they give drink in order to remove the craving of afflictions.

original: bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la bzhon pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: bzhon pa 'dod pa rnams la bzhon pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: For those who desire vehicles, they give vehicles in order to gather all the things that are pleasant and prosperous.

original: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang mdog gser gyi kha dog yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir gos 'dod pa rnams la gos sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang mdog gser gyi kha dog yongs su sbyang ba'i phyir gos 'dod pa rnams la gos sbyin pa'o //
translated: For those who desire clothing, they give clothing in order to purify shame and embarrassment and the golden color of the skin.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i sbyan yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir mar me 'dod pa rnams la mar me sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i sbyan yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir mar me 'dod pa rnams la mar me sbyin pa'o //
translated: In order to perfect the divine eye of the Tathagatas, one gives lamps to those who want lamps.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i snyan yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir sil snyan 'dod pa rnams la sil snyan sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i snyan yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir sil snyan 'dod pa rnams la sil snyan sbyin pa'o //
translated: In order to purify the divine ear of the Tathagatas, one gives musical instruments to those who want musical instruments.

original: tshul khrims dang thos pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi dris byug pa'i phyir spos dang byug pa 'dod pa rnams la spos dang byug pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang thos pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi dris byug pa'i phyir spos dang byug pa 'dod pa rnams la spos dang byug pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: In order to perfume morality, learning and concentration, one gives perfumes and ointments to those who want perfumes and ointments.

original: gzugs dang spobs pa dang byang chub kyi yan lag gi me tog thob par bya ba'i phyir phreng ba 'dod pa rnams la phreng ba sbyin pa'i //
analyzed: gzugs dang spobs pa dang byang chub kyi yan lag gi me tog thob par bya ba'i phyir phreng ba 'dod pa rnams la phreng ba sbyin pa'i //
translated: In order to obtain the flowers of form, eloquence and the factors of enlightenment, one gives garlands to those who want garlands.

original: lus kyi dri yid du 'ong ba thob par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lus kyi dri yid du 'ong ba thob par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to obtain a pleasant bodily scent,

original: phye ma 'dod pa rnams la phye ma sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: phye ma 'dod pa rnams la phye ma sbyin pa'o //
translated: one gives powders to those who want powders.

original: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan ro bro ba'i mchog yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro bro ba thams cad 'dod pa la ro bro ba thas cad sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu chen po'i mtshan ro bro ba'i mchog yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro bro ba thams cad 'dod pa la ro bro ba thas cad sbyin pa'o //
translated: The gift of taste is the giving of all tastes to those who desire them, in order to perfect the supreme taste of the major marks of a great person.

original: sems can thams cad kyi gnas dang / skyabs dang / gon dang / dpung gnyen bya ba'i phyir gnas 'dod pa rnams la gnas sbyin pa'o //üîΩsgrib pa thams cad rab tu spangs pa dang / lha dang tshangs pa'i gnas pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzims cha thob par bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi gnas dang / skyabs dang / gon dang / dpung gnyen bya ba'i phyir gnas 'dod pa rnams la gnas sbyin pa'o // sgrib pa thams cad rab tu spangs pa dang / lha dang tshangs pa'i gnas pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzims cha thob par bya ba'i phyir //
translated: The gift of shelter is the giving of shelter to those who desire shelter, in order to be a shelter, a protection, a refuge, and a support for all beings.

original: mal cha 'dod pa rnams la mal cha sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: mal cha 'dod pa rnams la mal cha sbyin pa'o //
translated: The gift of bedding is the giving of bedding to those who desire bedding, in order to attain the bed of the Tathagata, which is the state of the gods and Brahma, and the complete abandonment of all obscurations.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi sa thams cad kyi byang chub kyi snying rdo rdo rje'i gdan thob par bya ba'i phyir stan 'dod pa rnams la stan sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi sa thams cad kyi byang chub kyi snying rdo rdo rje'i gdan thob par bya ba'i phyir stan 'dod pa rnams la stan sbyin pa'o //
translated: The gift of a seat is the giving of a seat to those who desire a seat, in order to attain the vajra seat in the center of the earth, the site of enlightenment in the great trichiliocosm.

original: byang chub kyi yo byad thams cad yongs su bskang bar bya ba'i phyir yo byad 'dod pa rnams la yo byad sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yo byad thams cad yongs su bskang bar bya ba'i phyir yo byad 'dod pa rnams la yo byad sbyin pa'o //
translated: Giving one's possessions to those who want possessions in order to fulfill all the requisites for enlightenment.

original: mi rga mi 'chi ba'i bdud rtsi'i bde bas yongs su bskang ba'i phyir na ba dang sman 'dod pa rnams la sman sbyin @76a * //
analyzed: mi rga mi 'chi ba'i bdud rtsi'i bde bas yongs su bskang ba'i phyir na ba dang sman 'dod pa rnams la sman sbyin @76a * //
translated: Giving medicine to those who want medicine in order to fulfill them with the bliss of immortality and deathlessness.

original: pa'o // rang dbang dang rang nyams dang rang byung gi ye shes yongs su bskang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bran po dang bran mo yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o zhes rgya cher 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: pa'o // rang dbang dang rang nyams dang rang byung gi ye shes yongs su bskang ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bran po dang bran mo yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa'o zhes rgya cher 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: Giving up one's male and female servants in order to fulfill them with self-mastery, self-enjoyment, and self-arisen wisdom.

original: dri ma med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: dri ma med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: It is stainless because it abandons the opposing side along with its traces.

original: / dam pa rnam pa 'di gsum gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: / dam pa rnam pa 'di gsum gyis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: Giving is called the perfection of giving because of these three kinds of excellence.

original: dam pa rnam pa gsum ni 'dris pa dang bcas pa'i ngo bo nyid dam pa dang / thabs dam pa dang / 'bras bu dam pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa rnam pa gsum ni 'dris pa dang bcas pa'i ngo bo nyid dam pa dang / thabs dam pa dang / 'bras bu dam pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of supremacy are: supremacy of the nature of being endowed with familiarity, supremacy of the means, and supremacy of the result.

original: 'dris pa ni yun ring po nas sbyin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dris pa ni yun ring po nas sbyin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Familiarity should be understood as the practice of generosity for a long time.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be understood for the other perfections up to the perfection of wisdom.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i skyon med pa ni bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa rnam par spangs pa la sogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i skyon med pa ni bdag tu sgro 'dogs pa rnam par spangs pa la sogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The absence of faults in morality and so on is due to the abandonment of the superimposition of self and so on.

original: ci rigs su blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ci rigs su blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa las blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be understood according to the Ak·π£ayamatis≈´tra, as appropriate.

original: yang dam pa rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o //üîΩdam pa rnam pa bcu gnyis la /
analyzed: yang dam pa rnam pa bcu gnyis dang ldan pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya'o // dam pa rnam pa bcu gnyis la /
translated: Again, it is called perfection because it possesses twelve kinds of supremacy.

original: rgya che ba dam pa ni 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mi 'dod pa dang mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgya che ba dam pa ni 'jig rten gyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad mi 'dod pa dang mchog tu gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The supremacy of vastness is because it does not desire any mundane excellence and is supreme.

original: yun ring ba dam pa ni bskal ba grangs med pa gsum du yongs su bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring ba dam pa ni bskal ba grangs med pa gsum du yongs su bsgom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Supreme in duration, because it is cultivated for three measureless kalpas.

original: ched du bya ba dam pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i ched kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ched du bya ba dam pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don bya ba'i ched kyi phyir ro //
translated: Supreme in aim, because it is for the sake of the benefit of all beings.

original: zad mi shes pa dam pa ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pas gtan du yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrgyun mi 'chad pa dam pa ni bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du mos pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi sbyin pa la sogs pas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zad mi shes pa dam pa ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pas gtan du yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro // rgyun mi 'chad pa dam pa ni bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid du mos pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi sbyin pa la sogs pas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Supreme in inexhaustibility, because it is never exhausted, being dedicated to great enlightenment.üîΩSupreme in continuity, because the perfections are completed by the generosity, etc. of all beings, through the conviction of the sameness of self and others.

original: chogs med pa dam pa ni gzhan gyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba tsam gyis pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chogs med pa dam pa ni gzhan gyi sbyin pa la sogs pa la rjes su yi rang ba tsam gyis pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Supreme in non-possession, because the perfections are completed by mere sympathetic joy at the generosity, etc. of others.

original: dbang 'byor pa dam pa ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pas sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang 'byor pa dam pa ni nam mkha' mdzod kyi ting nge 'dzin la sogs pas sbyin pa la sogs pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The highest mastery is due to the meditative concentration of the sky treasury and so forth, because they perfect generosity and so forth.

original: yongs su bzung ba dam pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su bzung ba dam pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The highest possession is due to the possession of nonconceptual intuition.

original: rtsom pa dam pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la bzod pa chen por gyur pa la'o //
analyzed: rtsom pa dam pa ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa la bzod pa chen por gyur pa la'o //
translated: The highest undertaking is on the stage of action out of faith, in the great patience.

original: thob pa dam pa ni sa dang po la'o //
analyzed: thob pa dam pa ni sa dang po la'o //
translated: The highest attainment is on the first stage.

original: rgyu mthun pa dam pa ni de ma yin pa @76b gzhan brgyad po dag la'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa dam pa ni de ma yin pa @76b gzhan brgyad po dag la'o //
translated: The highest natural outcome is on the other eight stages.

original: 'grub pa dam pa ni sa bcu pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la byang chub sems dpa' 'grub pa dang / sangs rgyas 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'grub pa dam pa ni sa bcu pa dang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sa la byang chub sems dpa' 'grub pa dang / sangs rgyas 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The highest accomplishment is on the tenth stage and on the stage of the transcendent lord, because the bodhisattva is accomplished and the buddha is accomplished.

original: yang dam pa rnams kyis spyad pa dang bgrod pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: yang dam pa rnams kyis spyad pa dang bgrod pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Again, they are perfections because they are practiced and traversed by the highest beings.

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis spyad pa dang bgrod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis spyad pa dang bgrod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term ‚Äúpracticed‚Äù means ‚Äútraversed‚Äù by the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: yang shes bya'i pha rol tu son pas pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: yang shes bya'i pha rol tu son pas pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: Moreover, they are perfections because they reach the other shore of the knowable.

original: sangs rgyas nyid la gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid la gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term ‚Äúreached the other shore‚Äù means ‚Äúabiding in buddhahood.‚Äù

original: yang gzhan dang bdag mchog tu gnod pa las sgrol bar byed pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa rnams te /
analyzed: yang gzhan dang bdag mchog tu gnod pa las sgrol bar byed pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa rnams te /
translated: Moreover, they are perfections because they liberate others and oneself from the greatest harm.

original: gzhan dang bdag sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtsho las 'da' bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan dang bdag sdug bsngal gyi rgya mtsho las 'da' bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term ‚Äúliberate others and oneself‚Äù means ‚Äúto cross the ocean of suffering.‚Äù

original: 'di ni re zhig thun mong gi nges pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig thun mong gi nges pa'i tshig go //
translated: This is the common explanation of the term.

original: so so'i nges pa'i tshig ni sbyin bdag gi dbul ba sel ba dang / len pa po rnams kyi gdung ba sel ba'i phyir sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i nges pa'i tshig ni sbyin bdag gi dbul ba sel ba dang / len pa po rnams kyi gdung ba sel ba'i phyir sbyin pa'o //
translated: The individual explanations are as follows: Generosity is so called because it removes the poverty of benefactors and the distress of recipients.

original: dbang po zhi ba thob pa dang / 'gro ba bzang por sbyor ba dang / bsil pa'i gnas yin pas tshul khrims te /
analyzed: dbang po zhi ba thob pa dang / 'gro ba bzang por sbyor ba dang / bsil pa'i gnas yin pas tshul khrims te /
translated: Morality is so called because it obtains the pacification of the faculties, it connects one with good destinies, and it is the abode of coolness.

original: go rims bzhin du dbang po rnams kyi sgo sdom par byed pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyur gyur pa dang 'gyod pa med pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa'i bar gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du dbang po rnams kyi sgo sdom par byed pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba'i rgyur gyur pa dang 'gyod pa med pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa'i bar gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the basis for the faculties, respectively, because it closes the doors of the senses, it is the cause for going to good rebirths, and it is the basis for the stages of non-remorse and so on up to nirvana.

original: khro ba'i tsha ba sel ba dang / rma 'byin pa'i sems 'ongs pa sel ba dang / zhi bar brjod pa'i phyir bzod pa'o //
analyzed: khro ba'i tsha ba sel ba dang / rma 'byin pa'i sems 'ongs pa sel ba dang / zhi bar brjod pa'i phyir bzod pa'o //
translated: It is patience because it removes the heat of anger, it removes the occurrence of a harmful thought, and it is called peace.

original: rma 'byin pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni gang gis gnod pa byed pa rnams la lan du gnod pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: rma 'byin pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni gang gis gnod pa byed pa rnams la lan du gnod pa byed pa ste /
translated: A harmful thought is one that retaliates against those who have harmed one.

original: de 'ongs pa 'dis 'bral bar byed pa ni sel bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de 'ongs pa 'dis 'bral bar byed pa ni sel bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Its occurrence is removed by this patience, which should be understood as removing it.

original: rma 'byin pa ni 'di dag la shar gnyer ba yod pas rma 'byin pa can te /
analyzed: rma 'byin pa ni 'di dag la shar gnyer ba yod pas rma 'byin pa can te /
translated: Those who have harmful thoughts are harmful people.

original: de dag la mi 'jigs pa sgrogs pa ni bde bar brjod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag la mi 'jigs pa sgrogs pa ni bde bar brjod par rig par bya'o //
translated: To proclaim fearlessness to them is to be called peaceful.

original: sel ba dang / 'phel bar byed pa dang ldan pas brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: sel ba dang / 'phel bar byed pa dang ldan pas brtson 'grus te /
translated: It is effort because it is endowed with the removal of non-virtue and the increase of virtue.

original: de la sel ba'i phyir spyod pa ni yang dag par spong ba gnyis kyis mi dge ba'i chos dang bral bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la sel ba'i phyir spyod pa ni yang dag par spong ba gnyis kyis mi dge ba'i chos dang bral bar byed pa'o //
translated: Practice for the sake of elimination is the two right efforts that eliminate nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: 'phel ba'i phyir spyod pa ni yang dag par spong ba gnyis kyis dge ba'i chos yang dag par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'phel ba'i phyir spyod pa ni yang dag par spong ba gnyis kyis dge ba'i chos yang dag par sgrub pa'o //
translated: Practice for the sake of increase is the two right efforts that accomplish virtuous dharmas.

original: 'dzin pa dang / sdom pa dang / 'dul ba dang / 'thob par byed pas bsam gtan te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang / sdom pa dang / 'dul ba dang / 'thob par byed pas bsam gtan te /
translated: Dhyana is the retention, restraint, control, and attainment of the mind.

original: de la 'dzin pa ni dmigs pa la sems 'dzin pa'o //üîΩsdom pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba las sems yang dag @77a * //
analyzed: de la 'dzin pa ni dmigs pa la sems 'dzin pa'o // sdom pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba las sems yang dag @77a * //
translated: Among them, retention is the holding of the mind to the object.

original: par sdom pa'o //
analyzed: par sdom pa'o //
translated: Restraint is the correct restraint of the mind from distraction.

original: 'dul ba ni kun nas dkris pa rnams rnam par gnod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba ni kun nas dkris pa rnams rnam par gnod pa'o //
translated: Control is the control of the fetters.

original: thob par byed pa ni dbang 'byor pa thob par byed par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thob par byed pa ni dbang 'byor pa thob par byed par rig par bya'o //
translated: Attainment is the attainment of mastery.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa shes pa dang / so so rang gis shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / rab tu zhi ba thob pa dang ; / yon tan mchog tu phyin par shes pas shes rab ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa shes pa dang / so so rang gis shes pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / rab tu zhi ba thob pa dang ; / yon tan mchog tu phyin par shes pas shes rab ste /
translated: Wisdom is knowing what others say, knowing for oneself, consciousness, attaining peace, and knowing the perfection of supreme qualities.

original: de la gzhan gyis smras pa shes pa ni gzhan gyi sgra'i rgyu las byung ba'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: de la gzhan gyis smras pa shes pa ni gzhan gyi sgra'i rgyu las byung ba'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: Among them, knowing what others say is wisdom associated with proper mental attention that arises from the cause of the words of others.

original: so so rang gis shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: so so rang gis shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: Knowing for oneself is supramundane.

original: rnam par shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes las thob ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes las thob ba'o //
translated: Consciousness is attained after the supramundane.

original: zhi ba thob par bya ba'i phyir shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam la nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba thob par bya ba'i phyir shes pa ni bsgom pa'i lam la nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa'o //
translated: Knowledge for attaining peace is on the path of cultivation, becoming an antidote to afflictions.

original: yon tan mchog tu phyin par bya ba'i phyir shes pa ni yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub pa'i shes rab tu rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan mchog tu phyin par bya ba'i phyir shes pa ni yon tan khyad par can mngon par sgrub pa'i shes rab tu rig par bya'o //
translated: Knowledge for perfecting supreme qualities is the wisdom that accomplishes special qualities.

original: bsgom pa ni rnam lnga ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa ni rnam lnga ste /
translated: Cultivation is fivefold:

original: phung po la gnas pa nas dbang 'byor pa la gnas pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: phung po la gnas pa nas dbang 'byor pa la gnas pa'i bar du'o //
translated: from the stage of the aggregates up to the stage of mastery.

original: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: 'dir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: Here is a verse:

original: phung por brten nas bsgom pa ste //
analyzed: phung por brten nas bsgom pa ste //
translated: 1. Meditation is based on the aggregates,üîΩon attention, aspiration,

original: yid la byed dang bsams pa dang // thabs dang dbang 'byor de bzhin te //
analyzed: yid la byed dang bsams pa dang // thabs dang dbang 'byor de bzhin te //
translated: means, and mastery.

original: de dag thams cad brjod pa yin //
analyzed: de dag thams cad brjod pa yin //
translated: All of these are mentioned.

original: ji skad du /üîΩrgyu dang smin dang smon lam dang // so sor brtags pas phung por dran //
analyzed: ji skad du / rgyu dang smin dang smon lam dang // so sor brtags pas phung por dran //
translated: As it is said:üîΩ‚ÄúThe aggregates are remembered through cause,

original: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: ripening, aspiration, and discernment.‚Äù

original: de la phung po la gnas pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la phung po la gnas pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The stage of the aggregates is fourfold:

original: de la rgyu la gnas pa ni gang rigs kyi stobs kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la nan tan gyis goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu la gnas pa ni gang rigs kyi stobs kyis pha rol tu phyin pa rnams la nan tan gyis goms par byed pa'o //
translated: The stage of cause is that by the power of lineage one practices the perfections.

original: rnam par smin pa la gnas pa ni gang lus phun sum tshogs pa'i stobs kyis so //
