analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgoms pa las byung ba nas /
translated: Therein, the bodhisattva delights in the maturation of the mass of merit arising from the cultivation of the perfection of morality,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po rnam par smin pa de lta bu yang sems can rnams kyi yin par mngon par dga' bar byed kyi bdag la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgoms pa las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi phung po rnam par smin pa de lta bu yang sems can rnams kyi yin par mngon par dga' bar byed kyi bdag la ni ma yin te /
translated: up to the maturation of the mass of merit arising from the cultivation of the perfection of wisdom for the sake of sentient beings, not for his own sake.

original: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byas nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo'o //
translated: Having made it common to all sentient beings, he dedicates it to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i bsam pa gang yin pa de ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa nas /
translated: The thought that is of that kind is the cultivation of the perfection of morality.üîΩ

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pa la byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du bsgom pa la byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: The intention of such a kind is the bodhisattvas virtuous intention in the cultivation of the transcendence of morality up to the cultivation of the transcendence of wisdom.

original: thabs la gnas te pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: thabs la gnas te pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cultivation of the transcendences based on means?

original: rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is threefold:

original: so sor rtog pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: the purity of the three sectors through the nondiscriminating intuition, because of the discrimination of the three sectors of the giver, the gift, and the receiver.

original: thabs de ni yid la byed pa thams cad mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs de ni yid la byed pa thams cad mngon par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This means is the accomplishment of all mental orientations.

original: dbang 'byor ba la gnas te pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dbang 'byor ba la gnas te pha rol tu phyin pa bsgom pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The cultivation of the transcendences based on mastery is threefold:

original: lus la dbang 'byor pa dang / spyod pa la dbang 'byor pa dang / bshad ba la dbang 'byor ba'o //
analyzed: lus la dbang 'byor pa dang / spyod pa la dbang 'byor pa dang / bshad ba la dbang 'byor ba'o //
translated: mastery over the body, mastery over conduct, and mastery over explanation.

original: lus la dbang 'byor pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: lus la dbang 'byor pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gnyis su blta bar bya ste /
translated: Mastery over the body should be seen as the two bodies of the Tathagata.

original: rang bzhin dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'o //üîΩde la spyod pa la dbang 'byor ba ni sprul pa'i skur blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'o // de la spyod pa la dbang 'byor ba ni sprul pa'i skur blta bar bya ste /
translated: The fourth is the essential body.

original: des sems can thams cad la spyod pa rnam pa thams cad kun tu ston to //
analyzed: des sems can thams cad la spyod pa rnam pa thams cad kun tu ston to //
translated: The first is the emanation body, because it is the basis of the performance of all actions for the benefit of all sentient beings.üîΩThe second is the enjoyment body, because it is the basis of the enjoyment of the great vehicle teachings.üîΩThe third is the emanation body, because it is the basis of the performance of various emanations.üîΩThe fourth is the essential body, because it is the basis of the mastery of the powers.

original: bshad pa la dbang 'byor ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnam pa thams cad du bshad pa la thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa la dbang 'byor ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug rnam pa thams cad du bshad pa la thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: The mastery of action is the emanation body, because it is the basis of the performance of all actions for the benefit of all sentient beings.üîΩThe mastery of enjoyment is the enjoyment body, because it is the basis of the enjoyment of the great vehicle teachings.üîΩThe mastery of birth is the emanation body, because it is the basis of the performance of various emanations.

original: rab tu dbye ba ni ston pa bco brgyad kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug rab tu dbye bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba ni ston pa bco brgyad kyis pha rol tu phyin pa drug rab tu dbye bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The mastery of power is the essential body, because it is the basis of the mastery of the ten masteries.üîΩThe ten masteries are:üîΩ1) mastery of life, because one remains for as long as one wishes;üîΩ2) mastery of mind, because one enters and emerges from meditative concentration at will;üîΩ3) mastery of necessities, because one has the necessities at will;

original: rtog pa bco brgyad ni lus rton pa dang ; sems rton pa dang / dge ba rton pa dang / bde 'gro rton pa dang / byang chub rton pa dang / snying rje rton pa dang / sems can yongs su mi gtong pa rton pa dang /
analyzed: rtog pa bco brgyad ni lus rton pa dang ; sems rton pa dang / dge ba rton pa dang / bde 'gro rton pa dang / byang chub rton pa dang / snying rje rton pa dang / sems can yongs su mi gtong pa rton pa dang /
translated: 4) mastery of action, because one performs actions at will;üîΩ5) mastery of birth, because one is born in the world at will;üîΩ6) mastery of aspiration, because one actualizes the world at will;üîΩ7) mastery of miraculous powers, because one displays various miraculous powers at will;üîΩ8) mastery of knowledge, because one displays knowledge at will;üîΩ9) mastery of the Dharma, because one teaches the Dharma at will;üîΩ10) mastery of the wheel, because one displays the wheel of the Dharma at will.

original: dman pa'i sems yongs su dor ba rton pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rton pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba la @79b sbyor ba rton pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par sgrub pa rton pa dang // dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa rton pa dang /
analyzed: dman pa'i sems yongs su dor ba rton pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa rton pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba la @79b sbyor ba rton pa dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par sgrub pa rton pa dang // dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa rton pa dang /
translated: the reliance of giving up the inferior attitude, the reliance of acquiescence in the non-arising of things, the reliance of application to the roots of virtue, the reliance of accomplishing the roots of virtue, the reliance of the inexhaustibility of the roots of virtue,

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba la yongs su mi skyo ba rton pa dang / bsam pa'i don thams cad 'byor ba rton pa dang / tshogs sdud pa rton pa dang / sa la 'jug pa rton pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par sgrub pa rton pa dang /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba la yongs su mi skyo ba rton pa dang / bsam pa'i don thams cad 'byor ba rton pa dang / tshogs sdud pa rton pa dang / sa la 'jug pa rton pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos yang dag par sgrub pa rton pa dang /
translated: the reliance of not being discouraged in the roots of virtue, the reliance of mastering all the aims of thought, the reliance of gathering the accumulations, the reliance of entering the stages, the reliance of accomplishing the qualities of a Buddha,

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa sgrub pa rton pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa sgrub pa rton pa ste /
translated: and the reliance of accomplishing the deeds of a Buddha.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum gsum du tha dad pas /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa gsum gsum du tha dad pas /
translated: The three kinds of generosity and so on are distinguished as threefold,

original: gsum gsum gyi go rims bzhin du bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gsum gsum gyi go rims bzhin du bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: and should be understood as included in the three kinds of reliance in the same order.

original: de la sbyin pa rnam pa gsum ni zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa rnam pa gsum ni zang zing gi sbyin pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa dang / chos kyi sbyin pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of generosity are: generosity with material things, generosity with fearlessness, and generosity with the Dharma.

original: tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ni sngom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ni sngom pa'i tshul khrims dang / dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The three kinds of morality are: the morality of restraint, the morality of gathering virtuous natures, and the morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: bzod pa rnam pa gsum ni /
analyzed: bzod pa rnam pa gsum ni /
translated: The three kinds of patience are:

original: gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: patience that is a form of tolerance of others‚Äô offenses, patience that is the acceptance of suffering, and patience that is the certainty about the Dharma.

original: brtson 'grus rnam pa gsum ni /
analyzed: brtson 'grus rnam pa gsum ni /
translated: The three kinds of effort are:

original: go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: go cha'i brtson 'grus dang / sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: the effort of great armor, the effort of instigation, and the effort of working for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: bsam gtan rnam pa gsum ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa mngon bar sgrub ba'i bsam gtan dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnam pa gsum ni mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i bsam gtan dang / mngon par shes pa mngon bar sgrub ba'i bsam gtan dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan no //
translated: The three kinds of contemplation are: contemplation for the sake of abiding in comfort in this life, contemplation for the sake of achieving the superknowledges, and contemplation for the sake of working the weal of beings.

original: shes rab rnam pa gsum ni kun rdzob la dmigs pa dang / don dam pa la dmigs pa dang / sems can gyi don la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: shes rab rnam pa gsum ni kun rdzob la dmigs pa dang / don dam pa la dmigs pa dang / sems can gyi don la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The three kinds of wisdom are: wisdom focused on the conventional, wisdom focused on the ultimate, and wisdom focused on working the weal of beings.

original: de la zang zing gi sbyin pa ni lus rton pa ste /
analyzed: de la zang zing gi sbyin pa ni lus rton pa ste /
translated: Of these, the giving of material things is a support for the body,

original: bza' ba dang btung ba la la sogs pa'i yo byad rnams kyis len pa'i lus la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bza' ba dang btung ba la la sogs pa'i yo byad rnams kyis len pa'i lus la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it benefits the body by providing such necessities as food and drink.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni sems rton pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni sems rton pa ste /
translated: The giving of freedom from fear is a support for the mind,

original: yid mi bde ba'i bye brag dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir sems kyi dbugs 'byin pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba'i bye brag dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir sems kyi dbugs 'byin pa nye bar bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it benefits the mind by providing relief from anxiety and sorrow.

original: gzhan la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same analysis applies to the other perfections.

original: dman pa'i sems ni byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis yongs su skyo bas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems te /
analyzed: dman pa'i sems ni byang chub sems dpa' 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis yongs su skyo bas nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi sems te /
translated: The inferior attitude is the attitude of the Disciples and Solitary Buddhas, because the Bodhisattva is completely discouraged by the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: de yongs su 'dor ba rton pa ni @80a * //
analyzed: de yongs su 'dor ba rton pa ni @80a * //
translated: The complete rejection of that is reliance.

original: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the patience of accepting suffering.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don du bya ba lhag par byed pas 'khor ba ji srid pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mi gtong ba ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don du bya ba lhag par byed pas 'khor ba ji srid pa dang / phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su yongs su mi gtong ba ste /
translated: The inexhaustible root of virtue is not relinquished until the end of cyclic existence and in the realm of nirvana without remainder, because of the superior activity for the sake of all sentient beings.

original: de rton pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i brtson 'grus su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de rton pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i brtson 'grus su rig par bya'o //
translated: This reliance is the effort for the sake of sentient beings.

original: tshogs sdud pa ni thob pa la brten nas 'dus pa rnams sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mnyam par gzhag par bya ba dang / sems mnyam par bzhag pa rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa rab tu sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: tshogs sdud pa ni thob pa la brten nas 'dus pa rnams sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa mnyam par gzhag par bya ba dang / sems mnyam par bzhag pa rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa rab tu sbyin pa ste /
translated: The gathering of a group is the giving of advice and instruction in order to cause those who have gathered through gain to enter into meditative concentration if their thought is not already concentrated, and in order to liberate those whose thought is concentrated.

original: de rton pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan no //üîΩsa la 'jug pa ni chos la mos pa sngon du btang ba'i bshad pa gang gis tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
analyzed: de rton pa ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan no // sa la 'jug pa ni chos la mos pa sngon du btang ba'i bshad pa gang gis tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byas nas /
translated: The reliance on that is the meditative absorption for the performance of the aims of beings.

original: rab tu dga' ba'i sa la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i sa la 'jug pa ste /
translated: The entry into the stages is the explanation preceded by the aspiration for the Dharma, through which the stores are completed and one enters the stage of joy.

original: de rton pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de rton pa ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: The reliance on that is the observation of the conventional truth.

original: lhag ma ni legs par sbyor ba'i phyir sbyar bar ma byas so //
analyzed: lhag ma ni legs par sbyor ba'i phyir sbyar bar ma byas so //
translated: The rest is not set forth because it is well known.

original: yang rab tu dbye ba ni sbyin pa bdun te /
analyzed: yang rab tu dbye ba ni sbyin pa bdun te /
translated: Again, there are seven kinds of generosity:

original: rtsa ba'i sbyin pa ni rigs kyi gnas skabs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i sbyin pa ni rigs kyi gnas skabs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The generosity of the root is the perfection of generosity of the bodhisattva in the stage of lineage.

original: rigs tsam la brten nas sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs tsam la brten nas sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one gives on the basis of mere lineage.

original: blangs pa'i sbyin pa ni sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs pa'i ste /
analyzed: blangs pa'i sbyin pa ni sems bskyed pa'i gnas skabs pa'i ste /
translated: Giving of acceptance is that of the stage of generating the mind of enlightenment,

original: smon lam yang dag par blangs pa la brten nas sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon lam yang dag par blangs pa la brten nas sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one gives on the basis of accepting the vow of aspiration.

original: rjes su 'dzin pa'i sbyin pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i gnas skabs pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'dzin pa'i sbyin pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don sgrub pa'i gnas skabs pa'o //
translated: Giving of support is that of the stage of accomplishing the aims of self and other.

original: 'dzin pa ngan pa med pa'i sbyin pa ni de kho na'i don la yongs su rtogs pa'i gnas skabs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dzin pa ngan pa med pa'i sbyin pa ni de kho na'i don la yongs su rtogs pa'i gnas skabs pa ste /
translated: Giving of no bad grasping is that of the stage of thorough understanding of reality,

original: sbyin bdag la sogs par rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa'i 'dzin pa ngan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin bdag la sogs par rnam par rtog pa la mngon par zhen pa'i 'dzin pa ngan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no bad grasping consisting of adherence to the discrimination of giver, etc.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i sbyin pa ni mthu'i gnas skabs pa ste /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa med pa'i sbyin pa ni mthu'i gnas skabs pa ste /
translated: Giving of no possession is that of the stage of power,üîΩbecause the bodhisattva has no possessions.

original: phyi rol gyi yo byad yongs su 'dzin pa med par yang nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyis nam mkha' la lag pa brkyang nas ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du rin po che la sogs pa'i char 'bebs pa'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yo byad yongs su 'dzin pa med par yang nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams kyis nam mkha' la lag pa brkyang nas ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du rin po che la sogs pa'i char 'bebs pa'o //
translated: And without holding on to external goods, by means of the meditative concentrations such as the sky treasure, one extends one's hand into space and causes a rain of jewels to fall, just as one wishes.

original: so sor rig pa'i sbyin pa ni yongs su smin pa'i gnas skabs pa'i ste /
analyzed: so sor rig pa'i sbyin pa ni yongs su smin pa'i gnas skabs pa'i ste /
translated: The generosity of the one who has understood is the generosity of the one who is in the stage of maturity.

original: sbyin pa 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du mthun par sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin du mthun par sbyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one gives in accordance with the discipline of generosity.

original: sbyin pa chen po ni byang chub mchog gi gnas skabs pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa chen po ni byang chub mchog gi gnas skabs pa ste /
translated: The generosity of the great being is the generosity of the one who is in the stage of supreme enlightenment.

original: bla na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is unsurpassed.

original: @80b de bzhin du shes rab kyi bar du ci rigs su sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: @80b de bzhin du shes rab kyi bar du ci rigs su sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should understand the others up to the perfection of wisdom in the same way, as appropriate.

original: bsdus pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa bsdus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsdus pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pas byang chub sems dpa'i sa bsdus pa'i phyir te /
translated: The summary is that the stages of the bodhisattva are summarized by the perfections of generosity and so on.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis rigs bsdus pa 'di ni dpe tsam mo //
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis rigs bsdus pa 'di ni dpe tsam mo //
translated: The summary of the lineage by the perfections is just an example.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ni rigs kyi rtags kyis bsdus par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa ni rigs kyi rtags kyis bsdus par shes par bya'o //
translated: The perfection of giving, etc. should be understood as included in the signs of the spiritual gene.

original: sems bskyed pas bsdus pa ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i sems bskyed pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems bskyed pas bsdus pa ni khyad par du 'phags pa'i sems bskyed pas bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are included in the generation of the resolve, because they are included in the special generation of the resolve.

original: sems bskyed pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The generation of the resolve is twofold:

original: khyad par can ma yin pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par can ma yin pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: non-special and special.

original: de la khyad par can ma yin pa ni kye ma'o bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar shog shig snyam pa'o //
analyzed: de la khyad par can ma yin pa ni kye ma'o bdag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar shog shig snyam pa'o //
translated: The non-special is the thought: ‚ÄúOh, may I fully awaken to supreme and perfect enlightenment!‚Äù

original: khyad par du 'phags pa de ni de ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par shog shig snyam pa nas /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa de ni de ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yongs su rdzogs par shog shig snyam pa nas /
translated: The special is the thought: ‚ÄúMay I perfect the perfection of giving in that way,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du'o //
translated: up to the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i sems bskyed pa 'dis ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bsdus par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i sems bskyed pa 'dis ni pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bsdus par rig par bya ste /
translated: The perfections should be understood as included in the special generation of the resolve.

original: de dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbdag dang gzhan gyi don bsdus pa las gang sbyin pas phyug po yongs su 'dzin pa 'di ni bdag gi don to //
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro // bdag dang gzhan gyi don bsdus pa las gang sbyin pas phyug po yongs su 'dzin pa 'di ni bdag gi don to //
translated: because they are the causes of those.üîΩThe summary of benefit for oneself and others: the maintenance of wealth by generosity is benefit for oneself.

original: gang gzhan la yo byad nye bar sgrub pas rjes su 'dzin pa 'di ni gzhan gyi don to //
analyzed: gang gzhan la yo byad nye bar sgrub pas rjes su 'dzin pa 'di ni gzhan gyi don to //
translated: The maintenance of others by providing them with the necessities of life is benefit for others.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis bsdus pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis bsdus pa yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The summary of the other perfections should be understood in the same way.

original: don dam pas bsdus pa chos kyi dbyings las brtsams pa ni de bzhin nyid sbyin pa la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩye shes kyi tshogs las brtsams pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi snod du sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pas bsdus pa chos kyi dbyings las brtsams pa ni de bzhin nyid sbyin pa la sogs pa spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // ye shes kyi tshogs las brtsams pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi snod du sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The summary of the ultimate is the establishment of the reality of the realm of the Dharma, because suchness is the universal characteristic of generosity, etc.üîΩThe summary of the accumulation of intuition is the establishment of the vessel of omniscience.

original: ye shes yongs su 'dzin pa las brtsams pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes yongs su 'dzin pa las brtsams pa ni thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yongs su sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The summary of the maintenance of intuition is the establishment of omniscience.

original: ye shes kyi rjes su 'jug pa las brtsams pa ni lnga po dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes kyi rjes su 'jug pa las brtsams pa ni lnga po dag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fifth is the beginning of the engagement of intuition, because it is the conformity to the perfection of wisdom.

original: ye shes kyi mtshan nyid las brtsams pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ye shes kyi mtshan nyid las brtsams pa ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: The sixth is the beginning of the characteristic of intuition, because the perfection of wisdom is the essence of correct intuition.

original: de ltar na de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid don dam pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pas bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de bzhin nyid dang yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo nyid don dam pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pas bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the ultimate, which is the essence of reality and correct intuition, is to be understood as being included in generosity, etc.

original: dpe brjod pa 'dis bsdus pa la lhag ma rnams brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: dpe brjod pa 'dis bsdus pa la lhag ma rnams brtag par bya'o //
translated: The remaining perfections are to be understood as included in the same way, as indicated by this example.

original: @81a * // mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ser sna dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / khro ba dang / le lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab ste sbyin pa la sogs pa dang go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: @81a * // mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni ser sna dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / khro ba dang / le lo dang / rnam par g-yeng ba dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab ste sbyin pa la sogs pa dang go rims bzhin no //
translated: The resistances to the transcendences are stinginess, corrupt morality, irritability, laziness, distraction, and false wisdom, in the appropriate order.

original: yang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis bsdus pa'i dge ba'i chos ji snyed pa de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang yin pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa gang yin pa de yang de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang pha rol tu phyin pa rnams kyis bsdus pa'i dge ba'i chos ji snyed pa de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang yin pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa gang yin pa de yang de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, all the virtues included in the transcendences should be understood as antidotes to their resistant tendencies and as antidotes to the cognitive obscurations.

original: phan yon ni 'bras bu rnam pa lnga'i gnas skabs su dpag tu med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phan yon ni 'bras bu rnam pa lnga'i gnas skabs su dpag tu med par rig par bya'o //
translated: The benefits should be understood as immeasurable in the context of the fivefold result.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: ji ltar 'di dag gi rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba bral ba'i 'bras bu dang / mthong ba'i chos la bdag dang gzhan rjes su 'dzin pa skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / phyi ma la gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa mchog dam pa 'byung ba rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di dag gi rang gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba bral ba'i 'bras bu dang / mthong ba'i chos la bdag dang gzhan rjes su 'dzin pa skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / phyi ma la gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa mchog dam pa 'byung ba rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang /
translated: The result of freedom is the abandonment of their resistant tendencies. The result of conscious effort is the support of self and other in this life. The result of natural outcome is the arising of the superior, holy, and special in the future.

original: byang chub chen po dbang gi 'bras bu dang / longs spyod chen po dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / khon med pa dang / dbye ba med pa dang / bde ba dang yid bde ba mang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang /
analyzed: byang chub chen po dbang gi 'bras bu dang / longs spyod chen po dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / khon med pa dang / dbye ba med pa dang / bde ba dang yid bde ba mang ba dang / sems la dbang ba dang /
translated: The result of the power of great enlightenment, the result of the power of great enjoyment, the result of the power of going to good rebirths, the result of the power of non-enmity, the result of the power of non-division, the result of the power of much happiness and joy, the result of the power of mental control,

original: lus la gnod pa med pa dang / dbang che bar grags pa ni go rims bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lus la gnod pa med pa dang / dbang che bar grags pa ni go rims bzhin du sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bur rig par bya'o //
translated: the result of the power of non-harm to the body, and the result of the power of great fame should be known as the maturation results of giving, etc., respectively.

original: gcig la gcig rnam par nges pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: gcig la gcig rnam par nges pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Mutual determination is threefold:

original: sbyor ba las gyur pa dang / rab tu dbye ba las gyur pa dang / rab tu phye nas bstan pa las gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba las gyur pa dang / rab tu dbye ba las gyur pa dang / rab tu phye nas bstan pa las gyur ba'o //
translated: from application, from classification, and from being taught after classification.

original: de la sbyor ba las gyur pa ni sbyin pa la sbyor bar thams cad 'dus par dmigs te /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba las gyur pa ni sbyin pa la sbyor bar thams cad 'dus par dmigs te /
translated: Among them, from application means that all are observed to be included in the application of giving.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: nang dang phyi'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: nang dang phyi'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba'i sbyin pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: Application to giving up inner and outer things.

original: de la gang yongs su btang ba de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang yongs su btang ba de ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of generosity is the giving of that which is to be given.

original: de la byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i phyir gang gzhan la kun nas ma nar sems pa dang gnod pa dang rnam par 'tshe ba sdom pa de ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa'i phyir gang gzhan la kun nas ma nar sems pa dang gnod pa dang rnam par 'tshe ba sdom pa de ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of morality is the restraint of malice, harmfulness, and violence toward others, because of having a loving mind.

original: de nyid la gang nye bar skor ba dang / phongs pa dang / skyo ba la ji mi snyam pa de ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la gang nye bar skor ba dang / phongs pa dang / skyo ba la ji mi snyam pa de ni bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of patience is the forbearance of the fatigue, weariness, and suffering that arise from that very giving.

original: de nyid la gang phyir zhing sems spro ba de ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la gang phyir zhing sems spro ba de ni brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of effort is the enthusiasm for that very giving again and again.

original: de nyid la gang sems rtse gcig pa nyid de dge ba las sems phyi rol tu mi 'phro ba de ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu @81b phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la gang sems rtse gcig pa nyid de dge ba las sems phyi rol tu mi 'phro ba de ni bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu @81b phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of meditation is the one-pointedness of mind in that very giving, the mind not being scattered externally from the wholesome.

original: de nyid la rgyu dang 'bras bu ji lta ba bzhin du legs par bzung ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid la rgyu dang 'bras bu ji lta ba bzhin du legs par bzung ba dang / lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa med pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the proper understanding of cause and effect in that very giving, etc., and the absence of the grasping of views as paramount.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la yang ci rigs su sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar la yang ci rigs su sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, the other perfections should be connected with the perfection of wisdom in the same way, as is appropriate.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni thams cad du yang sbyin pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde yang rab tu dbye ba las gyur pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis rab dbye ba dang / rjes su byed pas rab tu dbye ba dang / rjes su sbyor bas rab tu dbye ba dang / skyed pas rab tu dbye ba'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni thams cad du yang sbyin pa yin pa'i phyir ro // de yang rab tu dbye ba las gyur pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis rab dbye ba dang / rjes su byed pas rab tu dbye ba dang / rjes su sbyor bas rab tu dbye ba dang / skyed pas rab tu dbye ba'o //
translated: The giving of fearlessness is giving in all cases.üîΩMoreover, the analysis of giving, etc., is a fivefold analysis in terms of: intrinsic reality, conformity, application, generation, and supremacy.

original: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rnam par gtong ba dang / sdom pa dang / ji mi snyam pa dang / mngon par spro ba dang / sems gnas pa dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rnam par gtong ba dang / sdom pa dang / ji mi snyam pa dang / mngon par spro ba dang / sems gnas pa dang / rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: The intrinsic reality of giving, etc., is the relinquishment of one's own goods, the vow of morality, tolerance of injury by others, exertion in the three vehicles, the meditative concentration of one who is not indifferent to the suffering of others, and the wisdom of one who is not indifferent to the suffering of others.

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are in that order.

original: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la sbyor ba na /
analyzed: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rjes su byed pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa la sbyor ba na /
translated: All are the giving of the holy Dharma,

original: de las gzhan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rjes su 'jug ba ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa rnams rjes su 'jug ba ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: because they are generated in the mental continuum of another.üîΩThe practice of generosity, etc. is the practice of generosity, etc.üîΩThe generation of generosity, etc. is the establishment of the mental continuum of another.üîΩThe perfection of generosity is the giving of material things.üîΩThe other five are the giving of fearlessness.

original: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rjes su sbyor ba ni 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / bsngags pa brjod pa dang / rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rjes su sbyor ba ni 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / bsngags pa brjod pa dang / rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: All are the giving of the holy Dharma,üîΩbecause they are generated in the mental continuum of another.üîΩThe practice of generosity, etc. is the practice of generosity, etc.

original: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa skyed pa ni gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa skyed pa ni gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la 'jog pa'o //
translated: The generation of generosity, etc. is the establishment of the mental continuum of another.

original: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni zang zing gi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni zang zing gi sbyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of generosity is the giving of material things.üîΩThe other five are the giving of fearlessness.üîΩAll are the giving of the holy Dharma,

original: de ma yin pa gzhan lnga ni mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: de ma yin pa gzhan lnga ni mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: because they are generated in the mental continuum of another.üîΩThe practice of generosity, etc. is the practice of generosity, etc.üîΩThe generation of generosity, etc. is the establishment of the mental continuum of another.üîΩThe perfection of generosity is the giving of material things.üîΩThe other five are the giving of fearlessness.

original: thams cad ni dam pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad ni dam pa'i chos kyi sbyin pa ste /
translated: All are the giving of the holy Dharma,üîΩbecause they are generated in the mental continuum of another.üîΩThe practice of generosity, etc. is the practice of generosity, etc.

original: gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems kyi rgyud la skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The generation of generosity, etc. is the establishment of the mental continuum of another.üîΩThe perfection of generosity is the giving of material things.üîΩThe other five are the giving of fearlessness.üîΩAll are the giving of the holy Dharma,üîΩbecause they are generated in the mental continuum of another.üîΩThe practice of generosity, etc. is the practice of generosity, etc.

original: de la rab tu phye nas bstan pa las gyur pa ni gcig nas rtogs pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de la rab tu phye nas bstan pa las gyur pa ni gcig nas rtogs pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The generation of generosity, etc. is the establishment of the mental continuum of another.üîΩThe perfection of generosity is the giving of material things.üîΩThe other five are the giving of fearlessness.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: All are the giving of the holy Dharma,üîΩbecause they are generated in the mental continuum of another.üîΩThe practice of generosity, etc. is the practice of

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang de yin nam /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'ang de yin nam /
translated: Is the perfection of generosity the same as the perfection of morality?

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang de yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang de yin nam zhe na /
translated: Or is the perfection of morality the same as the perfection of generosity?

original: tshig 'og ma dang sbyar ba ste /
analyzed: tshig 'og ma dang sbyar ba ste /
translated: The following verse is stated in response.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang de'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'ang de'o //
translated: The perfection of morality is the perfection of generosity.

original: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin la /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin la /
translated: There is the perfection of generosity

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: that is not the perfection of morality.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ma zin pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pas ma zin pa'i sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: It is the perfection of generosity not conjoined with the perfection of morality.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa tshig 'og ma dang sbyor ba rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar du sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa tshig 'og ma dang sbyor ba rnams dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the perfection of wisdom should be connected with the following verses on the perfection of generosity.

original: sbyin pa gang yin pa de thams cad sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin @82a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa gang yin pa de thams cad sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa yin @82a * //
translated: Is every generosity a perfection of generosity?

original: nam ; pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de thams cad sbyin pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: nam ; pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de thams cad sbyin pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: Are all perfections generosity?

original: mu gsum du 'gyur te /üîΩsbyin pa yin la pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: mu gsum du 'gyur te / sbyin pa yin la pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: There are three alternatives.üîΩGenerosity that is not a perfection is

original: gang byang chub chen por yongs su ma bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang byang chub chen por yongs su ma bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: generosity not dedicated to great enlightenment.

original: sbyin pa'ang yin la pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yin pa yod de ;
analyzed: sbyin pa'ang yin la pha rol tu phyin pa'ang yin pa yod de ;
translated: There is generosity that is a perfection,

original: byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa rnams so //
analyzed: byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa rnams so //
translated: generosity dedicated to great enlightenment.

original: sbyin pa yang ma yin la pha rol tu phyin pa yang ma yin pa yod de /
analyzed: sbyin pa yang ma yin la pha rol tu phyin pa yang ma yin pa yod de /
translated: There is that which is neither generosity nor a perfection,

original: sngar bshad pa ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa ma gtogs pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: except for the above mentioned phenomena.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar las brtsams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar las brtsams te /
translated: In the same way, beginning with the perfection of wisdom,

original: re re la yang mu gsum gsum du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: re re la yang mu gsum gsum du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: each should be applied in three alternatives.

original: sbyin pa la kun tu spyod pa gang yin pa de thams cad sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i bsod nams skyed dam zhe na /
analyzed: sbyin pa la kun tu spyod pa gang yin pa de thams cad sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i bsod nams skyed dam zhe na /
translated: Is all that practice of generosity a cause of the generation of merit that arises from the perfection of generosity?

original: mu bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: mu bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: There are four possibilities.

original: mu dang po ni byang chub chen por yongs su ma bsngos pa'i sbyin pa spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mu dang po ni byang chub chen por yongs su ma bsngos pa'i sbyin pa spyod pa'o //
translated: The first possibility is the practice of generosity that is not dedicated to great enlightenment.

original: mu gnyis pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / bsngags pa brjod pa dang / yid rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mu gnyis pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / bsngags pa brjod pa dang / yid rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: The second possibility is engaging in the perfection of generosity, speaking in praise of it, and rejoicing in it.

original: mu gsum pa ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: mu gsum pa ni byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: The third possibility is the practice of generosity that is dedicated to great enlightenment.

original: mu bzhi pa ni rnam pa 'di dag ma gtogs pas so //
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni rnam pa 'di dag ma gtogs pas so //
translated: The fourth possibility is what is not included in these three.

original: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar las brtsams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar las brtsams te /
translated: In the same way, beginning with the perfection of wisdom,

original: re re la yang mu bzhi bzhir sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: re re la yang mu bzhi bzhir sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: each one should be applied in fourfold possibilities.

original: shin tu rgyas pa la rgya che ba dang zab par yang bstan pa ni de'i 'bras bu thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mchog tu rgya che ba dang zab pa'i phyir 'bras bu dang mthun par rgyu bsten par blta'o //
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pa la rgya che ba dang zab par yang bstan pa ni de'i 'bras bu thams cad mkhyen pa nyid mchog tu rgya che ba dang zab pa'i phyir 'bras bu dang mthun par rgyu bsten par blta'o //
translated: The teaching of the extensive and the profound in the extensive is to be seen as the cause in accordance with the result, because its result, omniscience, is supremely extensive and profound.

original: kha cig de la mi mos pa dang skrag pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs dang mi ldan pa dang / rang bzhin gyis sems dman pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i rigs su gyur du zin kyang byang chub chen po las brtsams te /
analyzed: kha cig de la mi mos pa dang skrag pa ni byang chub sems dpa'i rigs dang mi ldan pa dang / rang bzhin gyis sems dman pa'i phyir ro // de'i rigs su gyur du zin kyang byang chub chen po las brtsams te /
translated: Some have no interest in it and are frightened of it because they do not have the bodhisattva potential and their minds are naturally inferior.

original: smon lam la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smon lam la sogs pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if they have the potential, they have not generated the wholesome roots of the prayers and so on that commence with great enlightenment.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed du zin kyang theg pa chen po spong ba'i sems can gyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed du zin kyang theg pa chen po spong ba'i sems can gyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if they have generated the wholesome roots, they are surrounded by sentient beings who reject the Great Vehicle.

original: kha cig mos kyang nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde ma brtsal te /
analyzed: kha cig mos kyang nges par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba ni nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde ma brtsal te /
translated: Some have interest but do not attain emancipation because they do not seek out the sutras of definitive meaning.

original: bdag nyid lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la gnas pa dang / don la sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag nyid lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la gnas pa dang / don la sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are attached to the view that they themselves are supreme and they adhere literally to the meaning.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Thus,

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis mtshan nyid thams cad @82b kyis dngos po thams cad la skur ba 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis mtshan nyid thams cad @82b kyis dngos po thams cad la skur ba 'debs pa'o //
translated: by the words ‚Äúall things are essenceless,‚Äù they deny the reality of all things by all the characteristics.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang don la sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen pa ni theg pa chen po las nges par mi 'byung bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang don la sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen pa ni theg pa chen po las nges par mi 'byung bar rig par bya ste /
translated: Likewise, one should understand that adherence to the meaning of the Mahayana literally does not lead to emancipation,

original: theg pa chen po la ni dgongs pa sna tshogs kyis gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po la ni dgongs pa sna tshogs kyis gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Mahayana was taught by various intentions.

original: 'di la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi me long chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs las gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di la dgongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi me long chen po'i chos kyi rnam grangs las gsungs pa /
translated: With this in mind, the Lord said in the Dharma-mirror discourse of the Bodhisattvapitaka:

original: byang chub sems dpa' sgra ji bzhin du tshul bzhin ma yin par chos rnams rnam par 'byed pa la lta ba ngan pa nyi shu rtsa brgyad 'byung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sgra ji bzhin du tshul bzhin ma yin par chos rnams rnam par 'byed pa la lta ba ngan pa nyi shu rtsa brgyad 'byung ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe bodhisattva who does not properly discriminate the teachings literally generates the twenty-eight false views.‚Äù

original: lta ba ngan pa nyi shu rtsa brgyad po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa nyi shu rtsa brgyad po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the twenty-eight bad views?

original: mtshan mar lta ba nas mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi bar du lta ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan mar lta ba nas mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi bar du lta ba'o //
translated: They are views from the view of signs up to the view of over-estimation of one's own views.

original: de la theg pa chen po la chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrar dmigs shing thos nas /
analyzed: de la theg pa chen po la chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa dang / ma skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgrar dmigs shing thos nas /
translated: Therein, those who are unskilled in the intention of the Great Vehicle, having observed and heard the words such as 'all things are without own-being' and 'unproduced' and so on,

original: dgongs pa de la mi mkhas pa dag 'di'i don la sgra ji bzhin du mos nas 'di ni dngos po med pa nyid du bstan to zhes chos thams cad ma skyes pa nyid du med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar mngon par zhen pa ni de dag gi
analyzed: dgongs pa de la mi mkhas pa dag 'di'i don la sgra ji bzhin du mos nas 'di ni dngos po med pa nyid du bstan to zhes chos thams cad ma skyes pa nyid du med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar mngon par zhen pa ni de dag gi
translated: and having taken the meaning of that literally, they believe that this teaches the non-existence of things, and they become attached to the signs of the non-production of all things, non-existence and so on.

original: mtshan mar lta ba yin no //
analyzed: mtshan mar lta ba yin no //
translated: This is their view of signs.

original: de dag nyid med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar mngon par zhen nas kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gsum la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan mar mngon par zhen nas kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid gsum la skur pa 'debs pa'o //
translated: Having become attached to the signs of non-existence and so on, they deprecate the three natures: the imagined, the other-dependent and the fulfilled.

original: de la 'di ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de gang gzugs zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la 'di ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de gang gzugs zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The imagined nature is that which is merely imagined by verbal expressions such as form, etc.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar du brjod pas brtags pa tsam du zad nas yang dag pa ma yin pa lus med pa'i don gang la byis pa rnams kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du sgro btags nas yongs su rtog pa'o //üîΩde la 'di ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i bar du brjod pas brtags pa tsam du zad nas yang dag pa ma yin pa lus med pa'i don gang la byis pa rnams kyis gzugs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du sgro btags nas yongs su rtog pa'o // de la 'di ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: up to nirvana, which is a non-existent object, a non-entity, imagined by the naive as the characteristics of form, etc.

original: gang yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa tsam de nyid do //üîΩde la 'di ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de /üîΩgang zhe na /
analyzed: gang yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa tsam de nyid do // de la 'di ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid de / gang zhe na /
translated: The relative nature is that very mere imagination of what is unreal.

original: chos thams cad kyi de kho na de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi de kho na de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The perfected nature is that which is the reality of all things, suchness.

original: de la skur pa 'debs pa'i rnam pa 'dis lta ba gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la skur pa 'debs pa'i rnam pa 'dis lta ba gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: And the three views are due to this negation in regard to that.

original: btags pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / kun du rtog pa la skur ba 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / de kho na la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: btags pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / kun du rtog pa la skur ba 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / de kho na la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: The view that denies designations, the view that denies imagination, and the view that denies reality.

original: de ltar de dag rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad la skur pa 'debs pas na /
analyzed: de ltar de dag rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad la skur pa 'debs pas na /
translated: Thus, since they deny all phenomena in every way,üîΩthey are called nihilists.

original: skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba de @83a * //
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba de @83a * //
translated: In order to establish that view, they hold to some kind of logic,üîΩand they also hold to the sutras of definitive meaning that teach the inexpressible nature of phenomena, all of which they interpret in accordance with their own view.

original: gzhag pa'i phyir rigs pa 'ga' zhig yongs su 'dzin pa dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde gang dag brjod du med pa'i chos nyid ston pa de dag thams cad kyang rang gi lta ba dang mthun par yongs su grub pa de dag ni lta ba gnyis su 'gyur te //
analyzed: gzhag pa'i phyir rigs pa 'ga' zhig yongs su 'dzin pa dang / nges pa'i don gyi mdo sde gang dag brjod du med pa'i chos nyid ston pa de dag thams cad kyang rang gi lta ba dang mthun par yongs su grub pa de dag ni lta ba gnyis su 'gyur te //
translated: These two views are

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / sgyur ba'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / sgyur ba'i lta ba'o //
translated: the view of grasping and the view of transformation.

original: de dag yang lta ba 'di 'dra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag yang lta ba 'di 'dra bar 'gyur te /
translated: These views are as follows.

original: lta ba 'di lta bu la brten nas dge ba'am mi dge ba yang rung spyad na kha na ma tho ba med pa dang skyon med par 'gyur zhing de thams cad dge bar 'gyur ba dang / sngon bsags pa'i sgrib pa las de 'byung bar 'gyur bar 'dzin pa de lta bu de dag gi lta ba gnyis te /
analyzed: lta ba 'di lta bu la brten nas dge ba'am mi dge ba yang rung spyad na kha na ma tho ba med pa dang skyon med par 'gyur zhing de thams cad dge bar 'gyur ba dang / sngon bsags pa'i sgrib pa las de 'byung bar 'gyur bar 'dzin pa de lta bu de dag gi lta ba gnyis te /
translated: There are two views like that:

original: kha na ma tho ba med par lta ba dang / nges par 'byung bar lta ba'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med par lta ba dang / nges par 'byung bar lta ba'o //
translated: the view that there is no fault and the view that there is definite emergence.üîΩThose who adhere to such views disparage the sravaka canon that posits the aggregates and so on that are the antidote to those views and they are hostile to sravakas who do not believe in the view that deprecates those views.

original: de dag lta ba de lta bu la mngon par zhen pas lta ba de las bzlog pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnam par 'jog pa nyan thos kyi sde snod khyad du gsod pa dang / gang dag skur ba 'debs par lta ba de la mi mos pa nyan thos kyi theg pa pa de dag la rab tu sdang ba'i lta ba 'di gnyis te /
analyzed: de dag lta ba de lta bu la mngon par zhen pas lta ba de las bzlog pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnam par 'jog pa nyan thos kyi sde snod khyad du gsod pa dang / gang dag skur ba 'debs par lta ba de la mi mos pa nyan thos kyi theg pa pa de dag la rab tu sdang ba'i lta ba 'di gnyis te /
translated: There are two views like that:

original: dbang za ba'i lta ba dang / rab tu 'khrug pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: dbang za ba'i lta ba dang / rab tu 'khrug pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: the view that is contemptuous and the view that is hostile.

original: rang gi lta ba'i tshul du na stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa yin no snyam nas /
analyzed: rang gi lta ba'i tshul du na stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa yin no snyam nas /
translated: In their own view, they think, ‚ÄúIt is established just as it is in emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.‚Äù

original: de'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa la de'i mtshan nyid du 'du shes pa ni de dag gi mtshan nyid phyin ci log tu rnam par 'jog cing 'di snyam du yang sems te /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa la de'i mtshan nyid du 'du shes pa ni de dag gi mtshan nyid phyin ci log tu rnam par 'jog cing 'di snyam du yang sems te /
translated: The perception of the characteristics of those that are not the characteristics of those is established as the error of the characteristics of those. They think like this:üîΩ‚ÄúThose who enter into and engage in this reality will generate an immeasurable heap of merit.‚Äù

original: gang dag chos nyid 'di lta bu la 'jug pa dang 'dzud pa de dag thams cad bsod nams kyi phung po dpag tu med pa skyed do snyam pa la de lta bu'i lta ba 'di gnyis te /
analyzed: gang dag chos nyid 'di lta bu la 'jug pa dang 'dzud pa de dag thams cad bsod nams kyi phung po dpag tu med pa skyed do snyam pa la de lta bu'i lta ba 'di gnyis te /
translated: These are the two views:

original: phyin ci log tu lta ba dang / 'phel ba'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu lta ba dang / 'phel ba'i lta ba'o //
translated: the view of error and the view of increase.

original: gang gi tshe de dag lta ba de las brtsams te gzhan dag gis dris pa de'i tshe bdag ni ci yang khas len par mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de dag lta ba de las brtsams te gzhan dag gis dris pa de'i tshe bdag ni ci yang khas len par mi 'dod kyi /
translated: When others ask them about that view, they say, ‚ÄúI do not accept anything.‚ÄùüîΩThese are the two views:

original: tshig dor dang ltag chod kyis gzhan la 'dri ba'i lta ba 'di gnyis te /
analyzed: tshig dor dang ltag chod kyis gzhan la 'dri ba'i lta ba 'di gnyis te /
translated: the view of asking others with words and the view of asking others with sophistry.

original: khas mi len pa'i lta ba dang / ngan g-yo'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: khas mi len pa'i lta ba dang / ngan g-yo'i lta ba'o //
translated: The view of denial and the view of deceit.

original: de dag yang 'di lta bu'i nga rgyal can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag yang 'di lta bu'i nga rgyal can du 'gyur ro //
translated: They become conceited with a view such as this:

original: gang dag de ltar sgrub pa de dag ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la mchod pa byed pa dang / rim gro byed par 'dzin pa de dag gi lta ba ni bkur sti'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag de ltar sgrub pa de dag ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams la mchod pa byed pa dang / rim gro byed par 'dzin pa de dag gi lta ba ni bkur sti'i lta ba'o //
translated: Those who practice in this way are considered to be making offerings to and serving the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: @83b phyin ci log ma yin pa'i chos nyid la mkhas pa dag gis lta ba de dang 'byed cing legs par 'thad pa dang / rab tu grags pa'i rigs pas yid ches par byed pa na yang lta ba de ji ltar yang yongs su mi 'dor te 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni log pa'o snyam pa de dag ni rmongs pa brtan pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: @83b phyin ci log ma yin pa'i chos nyid la mkhas pa dag gis lta ba de dang 'byed cing legs par 'thad pa dang / rab tu grags pa'i rigs pas yid ches par byed pa na yang lta ba de ji ltar yang yongs su mi 'dor te 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni log pa'o snyam pa de dag ni rmongs pa brtan pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: The view of those who are not skilled in the nature of reality as it is, who do not abandon that view, and who are convinced by the reasoning that is accepted by others, even though it is not their own, is the view of firm delusion.

original: lta ba ji skad du bstan pa de dag gi bag chags kyi gnas ngan len gang yin pa de ni rtsa ba'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: lta ba ji skad du bstan pa de dag gi bag chags kyi gnas ngan len gang yin pa de ni rtsa ba'i lta ba'o //
translated: The negative reflex action that is the instinct for the views as they have been presented is the fundamental view.

original: lta ba bcu bdun po de dag nyid kyi skyon brjod pa'i sgo nas yang bshad par bya ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: lta ba bcu bdun po de dag nyid kyi skyon brjod pa'i sgo nas yang bshad par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: These seventeen views are also explained by way of stating their faults.

original: mtshan mar lta ba ni lta ba la lta ba ma yin par lta ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan mar lta ba ni lta ba la lta ba ma yin par lta ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The view of signs is called the view that the view is not a view.

original: med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa nyid du gyur kyang /
analyzed: med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan ma la mngon par zhen pa nyid du gyur kyang /
translated: Even though one has become attached to the sign of nonexistence and so on,

original: mtshan ma thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med do snyam pa'i 'du shes can du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma thams cad la mngon par zhen pa med do snyam pa'i 'du shes can du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: one has the notion that one is not attached to all signs.

original: brtags pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / kun du rtog pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / de kho na la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ni sbyor ba sel ba'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: brtags pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / kun du rtog pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba dang / de kho na la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ni sbyor ba sel ba'i lta ba ste /
translated: The view that denies the imagined, the view that denies the thoroughly imagined, and the view that denies reality are the view that rejects application.

original: thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ni 'bad pa mthu med pa'i 'du shes can du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ni 'bad pa mthu med pa'i 'du shes can du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The view that denies everything is the view that one has the notion that effort is powerless.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / sgyur ba'i lta ba ni nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i lta ba dang / sgyur ba'i lta ba ni nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: The view of grasping and the view of transformation are views that do not lead to emancipation.

original: thabs ma yin pa la sbyor ba ni de'i 'bras bu mi 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa la sbyor ba ni de'i 'bras bu mi 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not obtain the result of that view by applying oneself to what is not the method.

original: kha na ma tho ba med par lta ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i lta ba ni sgrib pa sogs pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med par lta ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i lta ba ni sgrib pa sogs pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: The view of non-offense and the view of emancipation are views that obscure, etc.

original: log par sgrub pa'i sgrub pa zad mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log par sgrub pa'i sgrub pa zad mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the exhaustion of wrong practice is impossible.

original: dbang za ba'i lta ba dang / rab tu 'khrug pa'i lta ba ni bsod nams ma yin pa 'phel ba'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: dbang za ba'i lta ba dang / rab tu 'khrug pa'i lta ba ni bsod nams ma yin pa 'phel ba'i lta ba ste /
translated: The view of despising power and the view of complete agitation are views that increase demerit.

original: dam pa'i chos dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la log par sgrub pa'i sgo nas smas pa chen po 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos dang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la log par sgrub pa'i sgo nas smas pa chen po 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one obtains great misfortune by wrongly practicing the true Dharma and those who practice pure conduct.

original: phyin ci log tu lta ba dang / 'phel ba'i lta ba ni 'bras bu med pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log tu lta ba dang / 'phel ba'i lta ba ni 'bras bu med pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: The view of error and the view of increase are views that are fruitless.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chos nyid rnam par 'jog pa 'dzin pa dang / 'dzin du 'jug pa la khyad par mi 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i chos nyid rnam par 'jog pa 'dzin pa dang / 'dzin du 'jug pa la khyad par mi 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference between the one who holds and the one who causes to hold the view that posits an unreal reality.

original: khas mi len pa'i lta ba dang / ngan g-yo'i lta ba ni chad pas bcad pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: khas mi len pa'i lta ba dang / ngan g-yo'i lta ba ni chad pas bcad pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: The view of denial and the view of deception are the view of punishment,

original: rigs pa ma yin pas rgol na rgyal mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin pas rgol na rgyal mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible to win when one argues with the unreasonable.

original: bkur sti'i lta ba ni skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: bkur sti'i lta ba ni skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: The view of respect is the view of disparagement,

original: de mi gsung ba la de sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mi gsung ba la de sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a superimposition of that on the one who does not teach that.

original: rmongs pa brtan pa'i @84a * //
analyzed: rmongs pa brtan pa'i @84a * //
translated: The view of firm delusion

original: lta ba ni bsnyad pa ma yin pa'i lta ba ste /
analyzed: lta ba ni bsnyad pa ma yin pa'i lta ba ste /
translated: is the view of the unutterable,

original: log pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / 'bel ba'i gtam bya ba bkag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: log pa la mngon par zhen pa dang / 'bel ba'i gtam bya ba bkag pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is an adherence to the false and because it is a prohibition against engaging in discussion,

original: don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is meaningless.

original: rtsa ba'i lta ba ni lta ba chen po ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba'i lta ba ni lta ba chen po ste /
translated: The root view is the great view,

original: de las phyi ma la lta bar gyur pa thams cad shin tu brtas pa rgyas par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las phyi ma la lta bar gyur pa thams cad shin tu brtas pa rgyas par 'gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all subsequent views are fully developed and expanded from it.

original: lta ba nyi shu rtsa bdun po thams cad ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi lta ba ste /
analyzed: lta ba nyi shu rtsa bdun po thams cad ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi lta ba ste /
translated: All twenty-seven views are views of overesteeming,

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis slong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis slong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are motivated by the pride of thinking ‚ÄúI am.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, the same sutra says immediately after the above:

original: de'i phyir mdo sde de nyid las de'i 'og tu 'di dag gi bcu bdun yin yang bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo sde de nyid las de'i 'og tu 'di dag gi bcu bdun yin yang bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAlthough there are seventeen, they are ten.

original: bcu yin yang bcu bdun du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcu yin yang bcu bdun du 'gyur ro //
