original: 'jig rten pa dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir ni 'jig rten na chos tsam gyi ming rnams kyi tha snyad thams cad ma grags kyi phal cher sems can gyi ming gis so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang mthun par bya ba'i phyir ni 'jig rten na chos tsam gyi ming rnams kyi tha snyad thams cad ma grags kyi phal cher sems can gyi ming gis so //
translated: In order to conform with the world, for in the world, all conventions are not known by the mere names of dharmas, but mostly by the names of sentient beings.

original: de bas na 'phags pa rnams kyis kyang gdon mi za bar 'jig rten dang mthun pa'i tha snyad rnams kyis de dang mthun par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa rnams kyis kyang gdon mi za bar 'jig rten dang mthun pa'i tha snyad rnams kyis de dang mthun par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the noble ones must also, without doubt, conform with the world by means of conventions.

original: ji skrag par bya ba'i phyir ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid la mi mkhas pa glo bur du thog mar rnam pa thams cad du sems can med pa thos pa na skrag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skrag par bya ba'i phyir ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid la mi mkhas pa glo bur du thog mar rnam pa thams cad du sems can med pa thos pa na skrag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to frighten, because those unskilled in the reality of dependent origination, when suddenly hearing at the beginning that there are no sentient beings in any way, become frightened.

original: bdag dang gzhan dag gi nyes pa dang ldan pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa brjod pa'i phyir na gzhan du sems can du btags pa med par kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid tsam bstan na che ge mo zhig gi sems kyi rgyud la nyes @86a * //üîΩpa 'di rnams spangs so //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dag gi nyes pa dang ldan pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa brjod pa'i phyir na gzhan du sems can du btags pa med par kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i mtshan nyid tsam bstan na che ge mo zhig gi sems kyi rgyud la nyes @86a * // pa 'di rnams spangs so //
translated: Because it describes the faults and virtues of oneself and others, it is taught elsewhere that there is no designation of sentient beings, but rather the mere characteristics of affliction and purification.üîΩ‚ÄúSo-and-so has abandoned these faults in his mindstream.‚ÄùüîΩüîΩ

original: yon tan 'di rnams skyes so zhes shes par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan 'di rnams skyes so zhes shes par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that the faults and virtues of self and others are described, if the mere characteristics of defilement and purification were taught without designating sentient beings, then it would be impossible to know that such and such faults have been abandoned in the mindstreams of those sentient beings and such and such virtues have been generated.

original: gang zag rnam par gzhag pa ni spyod pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: gang zag rnam par gzhag pa ni spyod pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bdun te /
translated: The classification of persons is sevenfold by way of the differences of their conduct and so on.

original: de la 'dod chags la spyod pa ni /üîΩ'dod chags kyi shas che zhing rgyun ring ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags la spyod pa ni / 'dod chags kyi shas che zhing rgyun ring ba ste /
translated: Those who engage in attachmentüîΩare those with a predominance of attachment and a long continuum of attachment.

original: chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po ngan pa la yang 'dod chags cher 'byung ba dang / byung nas kyang yun ring du rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags par 'gyur ba'i dngos po ngan pa la yang 'dod chags cher 'byung ba dang / byung nas kyang yun ring du rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are those in whom attachment arises strongly toward inferior objects of attachment and who are long bound by attachment that has arisen.

original: rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa'i bar du yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa'i bar du yang de bzhin te /
translated: The same is true up to the point of being engaged in discursive thought.

original: rang gi dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply the method according to the nature of the thing.

original: cha mnyam pa la spyod pa ni //
analyzed: cha mnyam pa la spyod pa ni //
translated: One who is engaged in the balanced state

original: nyon mongs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa ste /
translated: is one who is naturally inclined to the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs pa shas che ba dang / shas chung ba rnam par spangs nas mnyam pa'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa shas che ba dang / shas chung ba rnam par spangs nas mnyam pa'i gnas skabs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Having abandoned the state of being greatly afflicted and the state of being slightly afflicted, he is said to be in the balanced state.

original: dngos po ji lta ba dang mthun par nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ji lta ba dang mthun par nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the afflictions arise in accordance with the nature of the thing.

original: nyon mongs pa chung du ni nyon mongs pa shin tu srab pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa ste ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa chung du ni nyon mongs pa shin tu srab pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa ste ;
translated: One who is slightly afflicted is one who is naturally inclined to the afflictions in a very subtle way.

original: nyon mongs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dag nas /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rang bzhin du gnas pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dag nas /
translated: Having explained the characteristics of one who is naturally inclined to the afflictions,

original: nyon mongs pa ches srab pa yod pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pas srab pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ches srab pa yod pa de ni nyon mongs pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pas srab pa ste /
translated: one who is slightly afflicted is one who is naturally inclined to the afflictions in a very subtle way.

original: sngon gnyen po chen po goms par bya ba'i dbang gis dngos po shas che ba la yang rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa chung dus kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gnyen po chen po goms par bya ba'i dbang gis dngos po shas che ba la yang rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa chung dus kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even when the object is predominant due to the power of previously cultivating the great antidote, the affliction is naturally weak.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi theg pa ni rigs dang / dbang po dang / smon lam dang / bsam pa dang / dmigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bras bu'i rab tu dbye ba'i dbang gis bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi theg pa ni rigs dang / dbang po dang / smon lam dang / bsam pa dang / dmigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / 'bras bu'i rab tu dbye ba'i dbang gis bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The vehicle of the ≈õrƒÅvakas should be understood as taught through the classification of lineage, faculties, aspiration, attitude, object, practice, and result.

original: 'di'i dbang po rtul po nyid ni rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po las ltos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i dbang po rtul po nyid ni rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i dbang po las ltos pa'o //
translated: Their dull faculties are in relation to the faculties of pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: gzhan du ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa dbang po rnon po yin no zhes bya ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba la sogs pa dbang po rnon po yin no zhes bya ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would contradict the statement that those who are followers of reality and so on have sharp faculties.

original: de la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa sngon ma bskyed pa dang / sngon 'bras bu ma thob pa ni bse ru lta bur gyur te gcig pur gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa sngon ma bskyed pa dang / sngon 'bras bu ma thob pa ni bse ru lta bur gyur te gcig pur gnas pa'o //
translated: Those who do not previously generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight and who do not previously obtain the result are rhinoceros like pratyekabuddhas who live alone.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rang rgyal ba ni tshogs dang spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rang rgyal ba ni tshogs dang spyod pa'o //
translated: The other pratyekabuddhas are the assembly and conduct.

original: lung bstan pa yang thob ces bya ba ni sa brgyad pa la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lung bstan pa yang thob ces bya ba ni sa brgyad pa la mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: And they attain the prediction means that they attain the acceptance of the nonarising of dharmas on the eighth level.

original: tshogs ma bsags pa la sogs pa ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa chung ngu dang / @86b 'bring dang chen po rnams kyi nges par 'byed pa'i phyogs dang bden pa mngon par rtogs pa skyed pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs ma bsags pa la sogs pa ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa chung ngu dang / @86b 'bring dang chen po rnams kyi nges par 'byed pa'i phyogs dang bden pa mngon par rtogs pa skyed pa'o //
translated: Those who have not accumulated the collections and so on are those who generate the factors conducive to liberation, the small, medium and great factors conducive to penetrative insight and the side of penetrative insight that is the realization of the four truths.

original: de yang nges pa dang ma nges pa dang / tshe rabs de nyid kyi dus dang ldan pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang nges pa dang ma nges pa dang / tshe rabs de nyid kyi dus dang ldan pa'i phyir go rims bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, they should be understood as definite and indefinite and as possessing the time of that very lifetime.

original: 'di la bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos la mos pa dang / dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams te /
analyzed: 'di la bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos la mos pa dang / dad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams te /
translated: Here, those that are characterized by faith and conviction in the Dharma in terms of the four truths are the factors conducive to liberation.

original: de nyid la chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams ni dad pa mchog yin pa dang / shes rab mchog yin pa'i phyir te /üîΩgo rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de nyid la chos la nges par sems pa'i bzod pa'i mtshan nyid kyis nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa rnams ni dad pa mchog yin pa dang / shes rab mchog yin pa'i phyir te / go rims bzhin no //
translated: Because it is the supreme faith and the supreme wisdom, respectively.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ni rang bzhin gyis skad cig pa ste zhes bya ba ni rgyun ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ni rang bzhin gyis skad cig pa ste zhes bya ba ni rgyun ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The supreme mundane factors are momentary by nature, that is, they are not a continuum.

original: bag chags yongs su nyams pas yongs su nyams pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sngar bskyed pa'ang skyed mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bag chags yongs su nyams pas yongs su nyams pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das par byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba sngar bskyed pa'ang skyed mi dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not lost through the loss of the imprints.

original: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa chung ngu'i dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa chung ngu'i dbang du mdzad nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa //
translated: The Blessed One declared that the factors conducive to liberation are small,

original: 'jig rten pa yi yang dag lta //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi yang dag lta //
translated: The right view of the world

original: chen po su la yod gyur pa //
analyzed: chen po su la yod gyur pa //
translated: is that which is possessed by the great ones.

original: de ni tshe rabs stong du yang //
analyzed: de ni tshe rabs stong du yang //
translated: Even in a thousand lives

original: ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngan 'gror 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not go to the miserable destinies.

original: zhe'o // yang thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: zhe'o // yang thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa bzhi ste /
translated: Moreover, there are four kinds of factors conducive to liberation:

original: skabs su gtogs pa dang / mos pa las gyur pa dang / lhag par 'dod pa las gyur pa dang ; thob pa las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: skabs su gtogs pa dang / mos pa las gyur pa dang / lhag par 'dod pa las gyur pa dang ; thob pa las gyur pa'o //
translated: those included in the stage, those arisen from belief, those arisen from superior devotion, and those arisen from attainment.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la 'dun pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la 'dun pa nas nye bar bzung ste /
translated: Beginning with the aspiration for virtue,

original: thar pa'i cha mthun du bya ba ji snyed pa de ni skabs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i cha mthun du bya ba ji snyed pa de ni skabs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: all that is conducive to liberation is included in the stage.

original: de dang rab tu ldan pa'i bstan pa la mos pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni mos pa las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de dang rab tu ldan pa'i bstan pa la mos pa dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni mos pa las gyur pa'o //
translated: Those endowed with that are devoted to the teachings and are called those arisen from belief.

original: dga' ba dang dad pa dang ldan pa thar pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa mang ba gang yin pa de ni lhag par 'dod pa las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang dad pa dang ldan pa thar pa la dmigs pa'i yid la byed pa mang ba gang yin pa de ni lhag par 'dod pa las gyur pa'o //
translated: Those who are endowed with joy and faith and have much mental attention focused on liberation are called those arisen from superior devotion.

original: tshe 'di nyid la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa skyed par nges pa gang yin pa de ni thob pa las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa skyed par nges pa gang yin pa de ni thob pa las gyur pa'o //
translated: Those who are certain to generate the factors conducive to penetrative insight in this very life are called those arisen from attainment.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The factors conducive to penetrative insight are of six types:

original: rjes su mthun pa dang / khyad par ba dang / rab tu rtogs pa dang / gzhan du yongs su sgyur ba dang / skye ba gcig pa dang / stan gcig pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa dang / khyad par ba dang / rab tu rtogs pa dang / gzhan du yongs su sgyur ba dang / skye ba gcig pa dang / stan gcig pa'o //
translated: those that are compatible, those that are distinctive, those that are fully understood, those that are transformed into another state, those that are of one birth, and those that are of one sitting.

original: de la gang bden pa la dmigs pa'i rnam pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang po nyid du chung du 'byung ba de ni rjes su mthun pa pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang bden pa la dmigs pa'i rnam pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba dang po nyid du chung du 'byung ba de ni rjes su mthun pa pa'o //
translated: Among them, the first small roots of virtue that focus on the truths are compatible.

original: gang 'bring du gyur pa de ni khyad par ba ste /üîΩde bas chos mchog tu @87a * //
analyzed: gang 'bring du gyur pa de ni khyad par ba ste / de bas chos mchog tu @87a * //
translated: Those that are medium are distinctive.

original: gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are superior to the former.üîΩThose that are great are fully understood.

original: gang tshe 'di nyid la bden pa rtogs pa shas chen por gyur pa de ni rab tu rtogs pa pa'o //
analyzed: gang tshe 'di nyid la bden pa rtogs pa shas chen por gyur pa de ni rab tu rtogs pa pa'o //

original: phyis yang dag pa nyid la nges par 'jug pa de ni sems kyi skad cig bcu drug pa la lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: phyis yang dag pa nyid la nges par 'jug pa de ni sems kyi skad cig bcu drug pa la lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and later enter the correct state become once returners on the sixteenth moment of mind.

original: gang rnam pa dgu char spangs nas 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang rnam pa dgu char spangs nas 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur te /
translated: Those who abandon all nine types of objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation and become free from attachment to the desire realm

original: nges par gyur pa la 'jug pa de ni phyir mi 'ong ba nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nges par gyur pa la 'jug pa de ni phyir mi 'ong ba nyid du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and enter the state of definite entry become nonreturners.

original: mthong bas spang par bya ba thams cad spangs kyang kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs nas rgyun du zhugs pa zhes brjod pa ni /
analyzed: mthong bas spang par bya ba thams cad spangs kyang kun du sbyor ba gsum spangs nas rgyun du zhugs pa zhes brjod pa ni /
translated: Even though all objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing are abandoned, those who abandon the three fetters are called stream enterers.

original: 'di dag @87b thar pa thob pa'i gegs su gyur pas gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di dag @87b thar pa thob pa'i gegs su gyur pas gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are called that because they are the principal obstructions to obtaining liberation.

original: 'di ltar 'jig tshogs la lta bas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen nas bdag la dga' ba sdug bsngal las mi 'phags so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig tshogs la lta bas nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen nas bdag la dga' ba sdug bsngal las mi 'phags so //
translated: Thus, due to the afflicted view of the self, one clings to the five aggregates as the self and as what belongs to the self, and one does not transcend the suffering of the self.

original: ji snyed 'phags kyang thar par bya ba'i phyir tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom gyi lam ngan pa la mngon bar zhen pa dang / lam bzang po la the tshom za ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ji snyed 'phags kyang thar par bya ba'i phyir tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom gyi lam ngan pa la mngon bar zhen pa dang / lam bzang po la the tshom za ba'i phyir /
translated: Even if one does transcend that, one clings to the bad path of doubt, due to the overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices, in order to attain liberation, and one doubts the good path.

original: log pas nges par 'byung gi yang dag par nges par mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: log pas nges par 'byung gi yang dag par nges par mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, one does not attain true liberation, but only a false liberation.

original: yang 'jig tshogs la lta bas zhes bya ba la log par rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang 'jig tshogs la lta bas zhes bya ba la log par rtogs pa ste /
translated: Moreover, due to the afflicted view of the self, there is a false understanding of the self.

original: sdug bsngal tsam la bdag dang bdag gi ba'i mtshan nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal tsam la bdag dang bdag gi ba'i mtshan nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one superimposes the characteristics of the self and what belongs to the self on mere suffering.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas lta ba la log par rtogs te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas lta ba la log par rtogs te /
translated: Due to the overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual practices, there is a false understanding of views.

original: des dag par yid ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des dag par yid ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one has confidence in purity.

original: the tshom gyis ni gnyen po la log par rtogs te /
analyzed: the tshom gyis ni gnyen po la log par rtogs te /
translated: Through doubt, one wrongly understands the antidote,

original: dkon mchog gsum la nges par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la nges par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is not certain about the Three Jewels.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gong du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa 'bring po'i 'bring gi bar du spong ba'i lam la gnas pa'i gang zag gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gong du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa 'bring po'i 'bring gi bar du spong ba'i lam la gnas pa'i gang zag gang yin pa'o //
translated: The person who is entering the result of once-returner is the person who is on the path of abandoning the middling of the middling afflictions of the desire realm, above the path of seeing.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa 'bring po'i chung du spong ba'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa la gnas pa'i gang zag gang yin pa'o //üîΩphyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba ni nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa 'bring po'i chung du spong ba'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa la gnas pa'i gang zag gang yin pa'o // phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa ni /
translated: The once-returner is the person who is on the path of abandoning the lesser of the middling afflictions, having completed the path of abandoning the middling of the middling afflictions.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i gong du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung du'i chen po dang / chung du'i 'bring po spangs pa'i lam la gnas pa'i gang zag gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu'i gong du 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung du'i chen po dang / chung du'i 'bring po spangs pa'i lam la gnas pa'i gang zag gang yin pa'o //
translated: The person who is entering the result of non-returner is the person who is on the path of abandoning the greater of the lesser and the middling of the lesser afflictions of the desire realm, above the result of once-returner.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba ni dgu pa nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu'i chung du spong ba'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa la gnas pa'i gang zag gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba ni dgu pa nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chung ngu'i chung du spong ba'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa la gnas pa'i gang zag gang yin pa'o //
translated: Nonreturners are persons who are situated on the path of abandoning the smallest of the small degree of the afflictions.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa gang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba thams cad spangs kyang tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga spangs pas phyir mi 'ong ba zhes mdo las 'byung ba ni 'di dag 'gro ba dang khams tha ma'i rgyur gyur pas gtso
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa gang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba thams cad spangs kyang tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba lnga spangs pas phyir mi 'ong ba zhes mdo las 'byung ba ni 'di dag 'gro ba dang khams tha ma'i rgyur gyur pas gtso
translated: The sutras state that even though one has abandoned all objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the desire realm, one is called a nonreturner because one has abandoned the five fetters that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation in the summit of existence.

original: bo yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bo yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are called fetters because they are the cause of birth and the cause of realms.

original: 'gro ba tha ma ni sems can dmyal ba dang yid gas dang dud 'gro'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba tha ma ni sems can dmyal ba dang yid gas dang dud 'gro'o //
translated: The final birth is birth as a hell being, an animal, or a ghost.

original: khams tha ma ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: khams tha ma ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: The final realm is the desire realm.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom rnams kyis @88a * //
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom rnams kyis @88a * //
translated: The view of the transitory collection, the esteem of morality and asceticism, and doubt

original: ni 'gro ba tha ma las mi 'da' bas de'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: ni 'gro ba tha ma las mi 'da' bas de'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: are the causes of the final birth because they do not transcend the final birth.

original: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems gnyis kyis ni khams tha ma la mi 'da' bas de'i rgyu nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems gnyis kyis ni khams tha ma la mi 'da' bas de'i rgyu nyid do //
translated: The two, sensual desire and malice, are the cause of not transcending the final realm, the formless realm.

original: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs kyang gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga spangs pas dgra bcom pa zhes brjod pa ni gong ma nye bar len pa dang / yongs su mi gtong ba'i rgyur gyur pas gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te /üîΩde la gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags gnyis kyis ni 'dod pa'i khams nas gong ma nye bar len te /
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs kyang gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa lnga spangs pas dgra bcom pa zhes brjod pa ni gong ma nye bar len pa dang / yongs su mi gtong ba'i rgyur gyur pas gtso bo yin pa'i phyir te / de la gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags gnyis kyis ni 'dod pa'i khams nas gong ma nye bar len te /
translated: Even though one abandons all the afflictions of the three realms, one is called an arhat by abandoning the five higher fetters. They are the principal cause of not relinquishing the higher realms, since they are the cause of not relinquishing the higher realms and not relinquishing the higher realms.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su skye zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;üîΩ/ rgod pa dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa rnams kyis ni gong ma yongs su mi gtong ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su skye zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ; / rgod pa dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa rnams kyis ni gong ma yongs su mi gtong ste /
translated: The two attachments to the form and formless realms cause one to not relinquish the higher realms, since one is born in the form and formless realms.

original: sred pa dang nga rgyal dang the tshom gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid du der kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sred pa dang nga rgyal dang the tshom gyi shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nyid du der kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Excitement, pride and ignorance cause one not to relinquish the higher realms, since one is afflicted there by the predominance of craving, pride and doubt in the absorptions.

original: rigs nas rigs su skye ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa nyid de /
analyzed: rigs nas rigs su skye ba ni rgyun du zhugs pa nyid de /
translated: One who is born in the same family is a stream enterer.

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa lha'am mi rnams kyi nang du nges par srid pa gnyis 'khor bar byas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa lha'am mi rnams kyi nang du nges par srid pa gnyis 'khor bar byas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: One who is born in the same family and enters the result of once returner is definitely born twice in the desire realm as a god or human and then attains nirvana.

original: bar chad gcig pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyid de /
analyzed: bar chad gcig pa ni lan cig phyir 'ong ba nyid de /
translated: One with one obstruction is a once returner.

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa lha nyid kyi nang du srid pa gcig 'khor ba byas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu la 'jug pa lha nyid kyi nang du srid pa gcig 'khor ba byas nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: One who is born in the same family and enters the result of nonreturner is definitely born once as a god and then attains nirvana.üîΩOne with one obstruction is one who has one interval, one birth, because one birth is an interval.üîΩOne who attains nirvana in the intermediate state is one who attains nirvana in the intermediate state after death.

original: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni nyon mongs pa'i shugs gang gis skye ba'i yul du song na nying mtshams sbyor ba de zad nas bag la nyal tsam gang gis shi ba'i 'og tu phung po mngon par 'grub pa de'i lhag ma lus pas
analyzed: bar ma dor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ni nyon mongs pa'i shugs gang gis skye ba'i yul du song na nying mtshams sbyor ba de zad nas bag la nyal tsam gang gis shi ba'i 'og tu phung po mngon par 'grub pa de'i lhag ma lus pas
translated: One who attains nirvana in the intermediate state is one who attains nirvana in the intermediate state after death.üîΩOne

original: bar de'i srid pa mngon par 'grub ste /
analyzed: bar de'i srid pa mngon par 'grub ste /
translated: The intermediate existence is actualized.

original: sngon goms par byas pa'i lam mngon du gyur pas bag la nyal lhag ma spangs ste /
analyzed: sngon goms par byas pa'i lam mngon du gyur pas bag la nyal lhag ma spangs ste /
translated: Since the path previously cultivated becomes manifest, the latent propensities are eliminated.

original: de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: Nirvana is attained in that very state.

original: de yang skye ba'i yul las mi 'phags pa dang / 'phags pa tsam dang / ring du song ba'i gnas skabs kyi rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang skye ba'i yul las mi 'phags pa dang / 'phags pa tsam dang / ring du song ba'i gnas skabs kyi rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, it is of three types: not elevated above the destination of birth, merely elevated, and elevated far away.

original: skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba'i mdo'i tshul du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i 'gro ba'i mdo'i tshul du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood according to the method of the Sutra on the Destinations of the Holy Ones.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med par lam mngon du byas nas zhes bya ba ni sngon shin tu goms par 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med par lam mngon du byas nas zhes bya ba ni sngon shin tu goms par 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Having manifested the path without exertion means that one enters the path without exertion because of previous thorough cultivation.

original: bsgrim mi dgos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsgrim mi dgos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by ‚Äúwithout effort.‚Äù

original: de las bzlog pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas @88b pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas @88b pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: The opposite of that is nirvana through exertion.

original: gong du 'pho ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gong du 'pho ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those who advance upward are of two types:

original: 'og min du 'gro ba dang / srid pa'i rtse mor 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'og min du 'gro ba dang / srid pa'i rtse mor 'gro ba'o //
translated: those who go to Akani·π£·π≠ha and those who go to the peak of existence.

original: de la 'og min du 'gro ba ni ro myang ba mang bas bsam gtan gyi rnam pa chung du la sogs pa skyes shing skyes pa'i ro myong bar byed pa'i phyir tshangs ris nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de la 'og min du 'gro ba ni ro myang ba mang bas bsam gtan gyi rnam pa chung du la sogs pa skyes shing skyes pa'i ro myong bar byed pa'i phyir tshangs ris nas bzung ste /
translated: Those who go to Akani·π£·π≠ha are those who frequently savor their meditative attainment. They are born in the lesser and other stages of the fourth absorption and savor the taste of their meditative attainment.

original: rgyun mi 'chad par gnas gzhan thams cad du lan re re skyes nas 'og min gyi bar du zhugs te /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par gnas gzhan thams cad du lan re re skyes nas 'og min gyi bar du zhugs te /
translated: They are born in all other abodes without interruption, from the BrahmakƒÅyika realm up to Akani·π£·π≠ha.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: They attain nirvƒÅ·πáa there.

original: srid pa'i rtse mor 'gro ba ni bsam gtan bzhin pa la spel mar ma bsgoms pas gnas gtsang ma 'ba' zhig bkol te /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mor 'gro ba ni bsam gtan bzhin pa la spel mar ma bsgoms pas gnas gtsang ma 'ba' zhig bkol te /
translated: Those who go to the summit of existence are those who do not cultivate the fourth absorption in a combined way. They are born only in the pure abodes.

original: de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du song nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du song nas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'o //
translated: Similarly, they go to the summit of existence and attain nirvƒÅ·πáa there.

original: spel mar bsgom pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rnam pa chung du la sogs pa lnga bsgoms pas go rims bzhin du gnas gtsang ma lnga po rnams su skye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: spel mar bsgom pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i rnam pa chung du la sogs pa lnga bsgoms pas go rims bzhin du gnas gtsang ma lnga po rnams su skye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Those who cultivate the fourth absorption in a combined way are born in the five pure abodes in accordance with their lesser and other stages of the fourth absorption.

original: gsod kyang rung mi gsod kyang rung zhes bya ba ni bdag gis bdag gi srog gcod pa'am //
analyzed: gsod kyang rung mi gsod kyang rung zhes bya ba ni bdag gis bdag gi srog gcod pa'am //
translated: Whether I kill myself or not.üîΩ

original: mi gcod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi gcod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Whether one kills or does not kill is the same, means that it is the same whether one kills oneself or does not kill oneself.

original: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa las yongs su nyams pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa las yongs su nyams pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Complete degeneration from the state of abiding happily in this life refers to

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan rnams las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩdbang po rnams sbyong ba zhes bya ba ni chen po thob par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan rnams las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // dbang po rnams sbyong ba zhes bya ba ni chen po thob par byed pa ste /
translated: the mundane meditative states.

original: rno bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rno bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The purification of the faculties refers to the attainment of the sharp faculties.

original: de'i phyir mi 'khrugs pa'i chos can la dbang po rnams yongs su sbyong ba'i skal ba can zhes ma bshad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi 'khrugs pa'i chos can la dbang po rnams yongs su sbyong ba'i skal ba can zhes ma bshad de /
translated: Therefore, the steadfast one who is by nature an unshakable arhat is not called one who is capable of penetrating to the realization of the unshakable state,

original: rang bzhin gyis dbang po rno ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dbang po rno ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he or she is sharp by nature.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa nyid yin gyi gzugs med pa na spyod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod pa na spyod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa nyid yin gyi gzugs med pa na spyod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Bodhisattvas are only found in the desire and form realms, not in the formless realm.

original: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i gnas ma yin pa'i phyir mthu'i khyad par thob pa der mi skye'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i gnas ma yin pa'i phyir mthu'i khyad par thob pa der mi skye'o //
translated: He is not reborn there because he has attained the excellence of power and because he is not a place for the full maturation of beings.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams rnams par spangs pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni gzugs med par skyes bor ba'i ting nge 'dzin zhing bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams rnams par spangs pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni gzugs med par skyes bor ba'i ting nge 'dzin zhing bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The concentration that is free from the formless realm is the concentration that is free from rebirth in the formless realm.

original: bsam gtan gyi bden pas gnas pa ni yongs su ma nyams pa nyid de /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi bden pas gnas pa ni yongs su ma nyams pa nyid de /
translated: He abides in the bliss of concentration, but he does not fall into the state of an arhat.

original: bsam gtan las rnam par bzlog pa la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod pa'i khams su yang skye bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan las rnam par bzlog pa la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dod pa'i khams su yang skye bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva is skilled in turning away from concentration and is reborn in the realm of desire in order to bring about the full maturation of beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad ces bya ba ni dga' ldan gyi gnas na gnas pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad ces bya ba ni dga' ldan gyi gnas na gnas pa nas bzung ste /
translated: All the bodhisattva‚Äôs activities are from the time he is dwelling in the Tu·π£ita heaven

original: bdud las rgyal ba'i bar du'o //üîΩsangs rgyas kyi spyod @89a * //
analyzed: bdud las rgyal ba'i bar du'o // sangs rgyas kyi spyod @89a * //
translated: up to the time he conquers MƒÅra.üîΩThe activities of the Buddha are from the time of his complete enlightenment

original: pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa nas bzung ste /
translated: up to the time of his final nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i bar du'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i bar du'o //
translated: up to the great parinirvana.

original: mos pas spyod pa can gyi byang chub sems dpa' ni rigs las gnas pa thog mar smon lam chen po btab pa nas bzung nas rab tu dga' ba'i sa la ma zhugs kyi bar du ste /üîΩso sor rang gis 'jig rten las 'das pa thob pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa can gyi byang chub sems dpa' ni rigs las gnas pa thog mar smon lam chen po btab pa nas bzung nas rab tu dga' ba'i sa la ma zhugs kyi bar du ste / so sor rang gis 'jig rten las 'das pa thob pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who practices with devoted interest is from the stage of lineage up to the stage of action in faith, because he has not yet attained the supramundane state personally.

original: lhag pa'i bsam pas spyod pa can ni sa bcu rnams su 'jig rten las 'das pa thob pas bsam pa dag pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmtshan ma la spyod pa can ni sa drug po dag la mi 'dod bzhin du mtshan ma dang 'dre ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag pa'i bsam pas spyod pa can ni sa bcu rnams su 'jig rten las 'das pa thob pas bsam pa dag pa'i phyir ro // mtshan ma la spyod pa can ni sa drug po dag la mi 'dod bzhin du mtshan ma dang 'dre ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who practices with superior intention is on the ten stages, because he has attained the supramundane state and his intention is pure.üîΩThe bodhisattva who practices with signs is on the first six stages, because he is not free from the mixing of signs, even though he does not desire them.

original: mtshan ma med par spyod pa can ni sa bdun po dag la bsgrims nas ji srid 'dod par mtshan ma kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma med par spyod pa can ni sa bdun po dag la bsgrims nas ji srid 'dod par mtshan ma kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who practices without signs is on the seven stages, because he is free from the arising of signs, even though he does not strive to eliminate them.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med par spyod pa can ni sa lhag ma rnams su rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rnams thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med par spyod pa can ni sa lhag ma rnams su rnam par smin pa las byung ba'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes rnams thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those who practice without exertion attain the nonconceptual intuition that is the result of evolution on the remaining stages.

original: cig car nges par 'byin pa ni khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa cig car spong ba'o //
analyzed: cig car nges par 'byin pa ni khams gsum na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa cig car spong ba'o //
translated: Simultaneous deliverance is the simultaneous abandonment of the types of the addictions that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation in the three realms.

original: rnam pas zhes bya ba ni bsgom pas spang bar bya bar 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa chen po'i chen po cig car spong ba dang / de bzhin du chung ngu'i chung ngu'i bar du ste /
analyzed: rnam pas zhes bya ba ni bsgom pas spang bar bya bar 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa chen po'i chen po cig car spong ba dang / de bzhin du chung ngu'i chung ngu'i bar du ste /
translated: By way of type means that the great of the great of the realm of desire, etc., are simultaneously abandoned by the path of cultivation, and so on down to the small of the small.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba bzhin no //
translated: This is like the simultaneous abandonment of the addictions to be abandoned by the path of insight.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam bzhin du sa'i rnam pa'i bye brag gis so so ba ni ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam bzhin du sa'i rnam pa'i bye brag gis so so ba ni ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not separate by the distinctions of the types of stages, as is the case with the mundane path.

original: 'dir khungs ni sor mo'i rtse mo'i mdo las gzugs gang ci yang rung ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'dir khungs ni sor mo'i rtse mo'i mdo las gzugs gang ci yang rung ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The source for this is the Sutra on the Tip of the Fingernail: Whatever form there is, all that is included in the four great elements and the form derived from the four great elements.

original: rnam par shes pa'i bar du 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba zhes rgya cher 'byung ba nas /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i bar du 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba zhes rgya cher 'byung ba nas /
translated: up to consciousness, past, future, and present, and so on at length,üîΩup to far and near, all that is included in one, made into one part,

original: rgyang ring po dang / thag nye ba zhes bya ba'i bar du de thams cad gcig tu bsdus te cha gcig tu byed do //üîΩgcig tu bzlum mo //
analyzed: rgyang ring po dang / thag nye ba zhes bya ba'i bar du de thams cad gcig tu bsdus te cha gcig tu byed do // gcig tu bzlum mo //
translated: made into one whole,üîΩmade into one collection,

original: gcig tu sdom mo //üîΩphung po gcig tu byed do //
analyzed: gcig tu sdom mo // phung po gcig tu byed do //
translated: made into one heap.

original: cha gcig tu byas shing phung po gcig gi bar du byas nas 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
analyzed: cha gcig tu byas shing phung po gcig gi bar du byas nas 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste /
translated: Having made it into one part, up to having made it into one heap, he trains thus:

original: 'di thams cad ni mi rtag pa /
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni mi rtag pa /
translated: All this is impermanent,

original: 'di thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni sdug bsngal ba zhes rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: all this is suffering, and so on at length.

original: de ni 'bras bu dang po'o //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu dang po'o //
translated: That is the first fruit.

original: tha ma gnyis kho na la gdags te /
analyzed: tha ma gnyis kho na la gdags te /
translated: Only the last two are designated as fruits,

original: de gnyis ni khams gsum pa'i mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spong @89b bar bya ba thams cad ma lus pa spangs pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni khams gsum pa'i mthong ba dang / bsgom pas spong @89b bar bya ba thams cad ma lus pa spangs pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir go rims bzhin no //
translated: because they are distinguished by the complete abandonment of all that is to be abandoned by the path of seeing and the path of cultivation in the three realms, respectively.

original: bar ma dag la mi gdags te /
analyzed: bar ma dag la mi gdags te /
translated: The intermediate one is not designated as a fruit,üîΩbecause it is not distinguished by the abandonment of the objects to be abandoned by the path of cultivation in the realm of desire.

original: de dag ni bden pa mthong ba'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid la lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med par spangs pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni bden pa mthong ba'i bsgom pas spang bar bya ba 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid la lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / lhag ma med par spangs pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are classified as having or not having abandoned the remainder of the objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation that sees the four truths in the desire realm.üîΩThe sutra Unravelling the Intended Meaning declares:

original: cig car nges par 'byin pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo las rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i 'og tu dgra bcom pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: cig car nges par 'byin pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo las rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i 'og tu dgra bcom pa rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Those who are liberated instantaneously are classified as stream enterers and arhats.

original: thams cad la ma lus par 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pas de gal te mthong ba'i chos la kun shes pa thob par mi byed na myur du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir smon lam gyi dbang gis 'dod pa'i khams nyid du
analyzed: thams cad la ma lus par 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin pas de gal te mthong ba'i chos la kun shes pa thob par mi byed na myur du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir smon lam gyi dbang gis 'dod pa'i khams nyid du
translated: Those who are not completely free from attachment to the desire realm but who do not obtain the state of an arhat in this life make aspirations through the power of prayer to attain nirvana quickly and are born in the desire realm.

original: skye'o // mngon par rtogs pa rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa bcu ste /
analyzed: skye'o // mngon par rtogs pa rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa bcu ste /
translated: There are ten types of clear realization.

original: de la chos mngon bar rtogs pa ni gzhan gyi sgra'i dbang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: de la chos mngon bar rtogs pa ni gzhan gyi sgra'i dbang du byas pa ste /
translated: The clear realization of phenomena is based on the words of another.

original: bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos rnams la thar pa'i cha dang mthun ba tha mas bsdus pa'i mos pa dang / dad pa chen po thob pa ste /
analyzed: bden pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos rnams la thar pa'i cha dang mthun ba tha mas bsdus pa'i mos pa dang / dad pa chen po thob pa ste /
translated: Great faith is the acquisition of the faith of conviction.

original: 'di ltar de la mos pa dang dad pa thob pas bden pa de dag la chos mngon par rtogs pas mngon par rtogs par gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la mos pa dang dad pa thob pas bden pa de dag la chos mngon par rtogs pas mngon par rtogs par gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In this way, by the acquisition of this faith and this conviction, one has the clear understanding of the Truths, which is called the clear understanding of the dharmas.

original: don mngon par rtogs pa ni chos de dag nyid la gang tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i dbang du byas nas bden pa rnams la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa tha mas bsdus pa'i chos nges par sems pa'i bzod pa chen po thob pa'o //
analyzed: don mngon par rtogs pa ni chos de dag nyid la gang tshul bzhin du yid la byed pa'i dbang du byas nas bden pa rnams la nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa tha mas bsdus pa'i chos nges par sems pa'i bzod pa chen po thob pa'o //
translated: The clear understanding of the object is the great patience of the Dharma, included in the last stage conducive to penetration, with regard to the Truths, by reason of the attention which one gives to these dharmas in conformity with reality.

original: chos nges par sems pa'i bzod pa de yang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa rnam pa gsum gyis rab tu phye ba ste /
analyzed: chos nges par sems pa'i bzod pa de yang tshul bzhin yid la byed pa rnam pa gsum gyis rab tu phye ba ste /
translated: This patience of the Dharma is distinguished by three kinds of attention in conformity with reality.

original: chen po'i chung ngus ni tshe de'i dro bar gyur pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: chen po'i chung ngus ni tshe de'i dro bar gyur pa rnams su'o //
translated: The small of the great is in the heats of this existence.

original: chen po'i 'bring pos ni rtse mo dang bzod pa rnams su'o //
analyzed: chen po'i 'bring pos ni rtse mo dang bzod pa rnams su'o //
translated: The medium of the great acquires the summits and the forbearances.

original: chen po'i chen pos ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams su'o //
analyzed: chen po'i chen pos ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog rnams su'o //
translated: The great of the great acquires the supreme mundane factors.

original: de kho na mngon par rtogs pa ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: de kho na mngon par rtogs pa ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
translated: The clear realization of thatness is the path of insight.

original: der ni bden pa rnam par 'jog pa mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba kun rdzob shes pa rnams thob ste /üîΩ'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi dbang gis de'i sa bon gsos pa'i phyir gyi mngon sum du byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: der ni bden pa rnam par 'jog pa mngon par rtogs pa'i mtha' las byung ba kun rdzob shes pa rnams thob ste / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi dbang gis de'i sa bon gsos pa'i phyir gyi mngon sum du byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: There one acquires conventional cognition that arises from the end of clear realization of the establishment of the truths.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig bcu drug po dag rgyun mi 'chad pas 'jig rten pa'i sems kyi skabs med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrjes @90a * //üîΩla mngon par rtogs pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gong du 'jig rten pa yang rung /üîΩ'jig rten las 'das pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi sems kyi skad cig bcu drug po dag rgyun mi 'chad pas 'jig rten pa'i sems kyi skabs med pa'i phyir ro // rjes @90a * // la mngon par rtogs pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi gong du 'jig rten pa yang rung / 'jig rten las 'das pa yang rung ste /
translated: One does not manifest it, because the seed of that conventional cognition is nourished by the power of supramundane cognition, and there is no opportunity for a mundane mind during the uninterrupted continuum of the sixteen moments of mind of the path of insight.

original: bsgom pa'i lam thams cad do //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam thams cad do //
translated: Subsequent clear realization is all the path of meditation, mundane or supramundane, that is subsequent to the path of insight.

original: dkon mchog mngon par rtogs pa ni //
analyzed: dkon mchog mngon par rtogs pa ni //
translated: The realization of the Three Jewels is as follows.

original: kye ma bcom ldan 'das ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: kye ma bcom ldan 'das ni yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams so //
translated: The Blessed One is a Perfectly Awakened One.

original: de'i chos 'dul ba ni legs par gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i chos 'dul ba ni legs par gsungs pa'o //
translated: His Dharma and Vinaya are well-proclaimed.

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa'o zhes de ltar shes te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa'o zhes de ltar shes te /
translated: His community of disciples practices well.

original: nges nas sangs rgyas la sogs pa la 'phags pa nyan thos dad pa'o //
analyzed: nges nas sangs rgyas la sogs pa la 'phags pa nyan thos dad pa'o //
translated: Having thus realized the Three Jewels, one becomes a noble disciple.

original: kun du mi 'byung bar mngon par rtogs pa ni mi bya ba'i sdom pa 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims kyis bsdus pa thob pas de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs byed pa la sogs pa kun du mi 'byung ste /üîΩbdag gi sems can dmyal ba zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: kun du mi 'byung bar mngon par rtogs pa ni mi bya ba'i sdom pa 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims kyis bsdus pa thob pas de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs byed pa la sogs pa kun du mi 'byung ste / bdag gi sems can dmyal ba zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The realization of the non-arising of the non-arisen is the attainment of the restraint of non-action, which is included in the morality pleasing to the noble ones. Through that, the arising of its opposing factors, such as action, does not occur.üîΩOne thinks, My hell existences are exhausted, and so on.

original: bdag gi sems can dmyal ba zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gi sems can dmyal ba zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: One thinks, My hell existences are exhausted, and so on.

original: de ltar nges par 'byung ba de ni kun du mi 'byung ba mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar nges par 'byung ba de ni kun du mi 'byung ba mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, that realization is the realization of the non-arising of the non-arisen.

original: mthar thug pa mngon par rtogs pa ni gnas ngan len thams cad shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji ltar lam gyi bden pa las mthar phyin pa'i lam bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa mngon par rtogs pa ni gnas ngan len thams cad shin tu sbyangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji ltar lam gyi bden pa las mthar phyin pa'i lam bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: The final realization is called ‚Äúthe thorough purification of all negative tendencies,‚Äù and so forth, just as the truth of the path is taught as the path of culmination.

original: mngon par rtogs pa bdun po de dag ni nyan thos rnams kyis gzhan gyi sga la brten nas thob pas nyan thos kyi mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa bdun po de dag ni nyan thos rnams kyis gzhan gyi sga la brten nas thob pas nyan thos kyi mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These seven realizations are called the realizations of the ≈õrƒÅvakas because they are attained by the ≈õrƒÅvakas in dependence on the words of another.

original: gzhan gyi sgra la ma brten par thob pas rang sangs rgyas kyi mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra la ma brten par thob pas rang sangs rgyas kyi mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called the realizations of the pratyekabuddhas because they are attained without relying on the words of another.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas 'dul ba'i thabs la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas 'dul ba'i thabs la mkhas par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: The bodhisattva realizations are the realizations of the bodhisattvas that are attained in order to be skilled in the methods for training the ≈õrƒÅvakas and pratyekabuddhas.

original: mngon par rtogs pa bdun po de dag la byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag par 'grub pa'i bzod pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa bdun po de dag la byang chub sems dpa'i yang dag par 'grub pa'i bzod pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: They are the realizations of the bodhisattvas that are the patience for attaining the seven realizations.

original: sems can la lta bas theg pa chung dus nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir mngon du byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can la lta bas theg pa chung dus nges par mi 'byung ba'i phyir mngon du byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not actualized, because it is not realized by the Hinayana, due to its regard for sentient beings.

original: yang thog ma nyid du sa la 'jug pa yang byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yang thog ma nyid du sa la 'jug pa yang byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the first entry into the stages is called the bodhisattvas clear realization.

original: mngon par rtogs pa de la brten nas nyan thos kyi mngon par rtogs pa las byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa khyad par ci yod pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa de la brten nas nyan thos kyi mngon par rtogs pa las byang chub sems dpa'i mngon par rtogs pa khyad par ci yod pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: The difference between the bodhisattvas clear realization and the sravakas clear realization should be explained.

original: dmigs pa'i khyad par na shin tu rgyas pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i khyad par na shin tu rgyas pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The difference in their object is that the bodhisattvas object is the extensive discourses.

original: nye bar rtog pa'i khyad par ni bskal pa chen po grangs med par bsod rnams dang ye shes kyi tshogs @90b yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar rtog pa'i khyad par ni bskal pa chen po grangs med par bsod rnams dang ye shes kyi tshogs @90b yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The difference in their thorough knowledge is that they thoroughly know the great accumulations of merit and wisdom over many countless eons.

original: rab tu rtogs pa'i khyad par ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos la sbyor ba'i 'phen pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis de gnyi ga rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu rtogs pa'i khyad par ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'i dbang du byas pa'i chos la sbyor ba'i 'phen pas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyis de gnyi ga rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinctive feature of realization is that one realizes both of those, i.e., the selflessness of persons and of dharmas, by means of supramundane intuition, by the impetus of application to the Dharma in terms of the selflessness of persons and of dharmas.

original: khas len pa'i khyad par ni bdag dang sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas len pa'i khyad par ni bdag dang sems can thams cad mnyam pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinctive feature of acceptance is that one accepts the sameness of oneself and all sentient beings.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i khyad par ni sa bcu po dag gis nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i khyad par ni sa bcu po dag gis nges par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinctive feature of emancipation is that one is emancipated by means of the ten stages.

original: yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin pa'i khyad par ni mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinctive feature of retention is that one retains non-abiding nirvana.

original: gnas dang g-yog 'khor gyi khyad par ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba dang / gdul ba'i skye bo nye bar sdud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas dang g-yog 'khor gyi khyad par ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba dang / gdul ba'i skye bo nye bar sdud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinctive feature of abode and retinue is that one purifies the buddhaverse and attracts disciples.

original: btsun par skye ba'i khyad par ni pha bzhin du rang gi rigs yang dag par 'dzin pa'i bu gtso bo'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btsun par skye ba'i khyad par ni pha bzhin du rang gi rigs yang dag par 'dzin pa'i bu gtso bo'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The special quality of being a monk is the characteristic of a son who properly upholds his family, like a father.

original: skye ba'i khyad par ni 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i khyad par ni 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor rnams su skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The special quality of birth is being born in the circles of the retinue.

original: 'bras bu'i khyad par de yang gnas gyur pa'i khyad par ni nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i gnas ngan len gyi rnam pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir yon tan bla na med pa thams cad kyi gnas nyid du gyur pas gnas gyurüîΩpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad par de yang gnas gyur pa'i khyad par ni nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i gnas ngan len gyi rnam pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir yon tan bla na med pa thams cad kyi gnas nyid du gyur pas gnas gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The special quality of result is the special quality of transformation, because it becomes the basis of all unsurpassed qualities through abandoning all aspects of afflicted and unafflicted negative propensities.

original: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa yon tan dpag tu med pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par ni stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa yon tan dpag tu med pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The special quality of abundant good qualities is the accomplishment of immeasurable good qualities such as the powers, fearlessnesses, and the unique qualities of a buddha.
